original: ci ste 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na za ba po lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na za ba po lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But if the effect does not exist, how could the experiencer exist?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i @46a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i @46a * //
translated: For,

original: za ba por 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu de yang mi 'thad de de med na de gang gi za ba por 'gyur /
analyzed: za ba por 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu de yang mi 'thad de de med na de gang gi za ba por 'gyur /
translated: if the experiencer of the effect were to exist, the effect would not be tenable. If it does not exist, how could it be the experiencer of that?

original: de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po yod do zhes bya ba de ni glu'i tshig tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po yod do zhes bya ba de ni glu'i tshig tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThe agent, action, effect, and experiencer exist‚Äù is mere verbiage.

original: byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag gi 'thad na 'khor ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag gi 'thad na 'khor ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is: if the agent, action, effect, and experiencer are tenable, how could cyclic existence be tenable?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause the experiencer who experiences its effect exists‚Äù is not established.

original: log par ston na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: log par ston na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: If it is taught incorrectly, it is contradictory. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: de ltar byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: As such, the agent, action, effect, and experiencer are untenable.

original: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate status of the reason, ‚Äúbecause the experiencer of the effect of the action exists,‚Äù is not established, and in the conventional it is contradictory.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe view that is the denial of action and effect

original: log par lta ba yin pas /
analyzed: log par lta ba yin pas /
translated: is wrong view.üîΩTherefore, it is not tenable that those whose eyes of intelligence are obscured by the cataracts of the faults of the proponents of the Middle Way see reality.‚Äù

original: dbu ma smra ba pa'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag dbu ma pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba pa'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag dbu ma pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of our own schools that denigrates the Followers of the Middle Way.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba yin par gsungs pas de dag thams cad dbu ma pa nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba yin par gsungs pas de dag thams cad dbu ma pa nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since the Lord has said that the view that denies karma and its effects is wrong view, all of these would arise for a Follower of the Middle Way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar dbu ma pa ni byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag med cing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi tshogs thams cad drungs 'byin pa yin pas dbu ma smra ba lta ba'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo
analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma pa ni byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag med cing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi tshogs thams cad drungs 'byin pa yin pas dbu ma smra ba lta ba'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo
translated: Because Followers of the Middle Way are free of the creator, the created, karma, and its effects, and they are free of all the trappings of samsara and nirvana.

original: gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable for those whose eyes of intelligence are covered by the cataracts of the faults of the view of the Followers of the Middle Way to see suchness.‚Äù

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
translated: Just as one who displays emanations

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //
translated: Through the perfect manifestation of his magical power

original: sprul zhing sprul pa'ang gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: sprul zhing sprul pa'ang gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Emanates emanations and those emanations emanate further emanations,

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar ;
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar ;
translated: And that emanation also emanates others.

original: / sprul pa byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / sprul pa byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is called ‚Äúemanation.‚Äù

original: des ni dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: des ni dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i dpe bstan te /
translated: This teaches the example that refutes the apprehension of things as existent.

original: ji ltar sprul pa ston par byed pa'i gang zag rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pas sprul pa sprul zhing sprul pa de yang gzhan sprul par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa ston par byed pa'i gang zag rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pas sprul pa sprul zhing sprul pa de yang gzhan sprul par byed la /
translated: Just as a person who is skilled in emanation emanates an emanation and that emanation also emanates another emanation,

original: sprul pa gzhan des kyang gzhan dag sprul par @46b byed pa ltar byed pa pos las gang byas pa dang las de'i 'bras bu la gang longs spyod par byed pa'i za ba po dag kyang tshul de bzhin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: sprul pa gzhan des kyang gzhan dag sprul par @46b byed pa ltar byed pa pos las gang byas pa dang las de'i 'bras bu la gang longs spyod par byed pa'i za ba po dag kyang tshul de bzhin no zhes ston to //
translated: so too the agent who performs an action and the experiencer who experiences the effect of that action are similar in that respect.

original: dpe des mtshon pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe des mtshon pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the things that are illustrated by that example, it is said:

original: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas //
analyzed: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas //
translated: So too the agent who performs an action

original: de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
analyzed: de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
translated: Is like an emanation.

original: de bzhin du byed pa pos las gang byas pa'i byed pa po de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa pos las gang byas pa'i byed pa po de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the agent who performs an action is like an emanation,

original: thog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pa las byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pa las byung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the self that arises from the continuum of conditions since beginningless time.

original: las de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
analyzed: las de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /
translated: And that action is like an emanation,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because it is essenceless.

original: de dag nyid kyi dpe gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi dpe gzhan bstan pa'i phyir / dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig /
translated: In order to demonstrate other examples of those,üîΩit is said:üîΩFor example, just as an emanation

original: sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
translated: Emanates another emanation,üîΩSo it is with the emanation of the TathƒÅgata.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul pa mdzad pa de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul pa mdzad pa de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Just as the emanation of the TathƒÅgata emanates another emanation, so it is with that emanation, which is essenceless.

original: de ni dpe dang dngos po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni dpe dang dngos po de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the conclusion of those examples and their referents,üîΩit is said:

original: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: a city of gandharvas, a mirage, or a dream.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa las dang phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi lus dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba byed pa po dang / 'gro ba lngar bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pa tha snyad du grags pa mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa'i chogs su gyur pa dag tha snyad du khas len pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa las dang phung po'i mtshan nyid kyi lus dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba byed pa po dang / 'gro ba lngar bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pa tha snyad du grags pa mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa'i chogs su gyur pa dag tha snyad du khas len pas de'i phyir /
translated: Afflictions such as attachment, karma such as intention, bodies characterized by the aggregates, agents called ‚Äúmind and mental factors,‚Äù and results characterized by the experience of happiness and suffering in the five types of transmigration are generated by the assembly of causes and conditions. Since they are accepted conventionally, they are the means for attaining high status and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: las dang 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since we do not deny karma and its effects, we are free of the faults that you ascribe to us.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma smra ba rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma smra ba rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of not seeing reality does not apply to the Madhyamikas.

original: de gal te don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas de ni lan ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gal te don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas de ni lan ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is not a response because ultimately they are disparaged,

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu de dag khas blangs kyang don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas tshig snga ma de ni lan ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas kun rdzob tu de dag khas blangs kyang don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas tshig snga ma de ni lan ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: if the opponent says, ‚ÄúAlthough the Madhyamikas accept them conventionally, ultimately they are disparaged, so that previous statement is not a response,‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: in response to that,üîΩit was previously stated:

original: de ni sngar gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: de ni sngar gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: If things are not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nonthings are not established.

original: yod ces bya bar rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces bya bar rtag par 'dzin //
translated: To say ‚Äúexists‚Äù is to grasp permanence.

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta //üîΩde phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta // de phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: To say ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is to view nihilism.üîΩTherefore, the wise do not

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: dwell on existence or nonexistence.

original: zhes bstan pa der sgrub pa smras pas las @47a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa der sgrub pa smras pas las @47a * //
translated: The response to that is stated in that passage.

original: dang 'bras bu med par smra ba khas ma blangs ba'i phyir lan ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang 'bras bu med par smra ba khas ma blangs ba'i phyir lan ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because we do not accept the thesis that there is no effect, it is not the case that this is not an answer.

original: de ni sngar dngos po med pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pa der kho bo cag gis med par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smras pas ma yin par dgag pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de ni sngar dngos po med pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pa der kho bo cag gis med par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smras pas ma yin par dgag pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ;
translated: We have already explained this in the chapter on the examination of nonthings, where we said that we do not accept the thesis of external negation, because we have stated the proof of internal negation.

original: kho bo cag gi sgrub pa snga ma de lan ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sgrub pa snga ma de lan ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, our previous proof is not not an answer.

original: tshig le 'ur byas pa 'das ma thag pa gsum po dag gis dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i dpe bstan pa de dag gi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig le 'ur byas pa 'das ma thag pa gsum po dag gis dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i dpe bstan pa de dag gi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The three preceding verses explain the example that refutes the apprehension of the existence of things. To explain the meaning of those verses in another way, the following verse is stated.

original: yang na rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa yin na las dang 'bras bu dang de dag 'brel pa dang byed pa po dang za ba po dag med pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa
analyzed: yang na rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa yin na las dang 'bras bu dang de dag 'brel pa dang byed pa po dang za ba po dag med pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa
translated: abiding in pure action would be pointless.

original: don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa rnams kyi rnam par rmongs pa'i yol ba bshu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa rnams kyi rnam par rmongs pa'i yol ba bshu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the curtain of confusion of those who think in this way,

original: las la sogs pa kun rdzob tu sprul pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las la sogs pa kun rdzob tu sprul pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that karma and so on exist conventionally, like emanations and so on,üîΩthe root text says:

original: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
translated: Just as the creator of an emanation

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //üîΩsprul zhing sprul pa'ang gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis // sprul zhing sprul pa'ang gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Through the perfect power of his magicüîΩEmanates emanations and those emanations in turn emanate others,

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
translated: And those emanations in turn emanate others,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And so on, extensively.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i
translated: The meaning of this chapter is to show that actions and results are essenceless by pointing out the faults of the argument presented by the opponent in the first chapter.

original: 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.üîΩIn this seventeenth chapter, ‚ÄúExamination of Action and Result,‚Äù the meaning of the chapter is to be seen as the result of valid knowledge.

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'dis dang por don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la /üîΩ'khor pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'dis dang por don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la / 'khor pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIn the first chapter, ‚ÄòExamination of Action and Result,‚Äô you said, ‚ÄòInner formations cycle in the ultimate sense, because they are impermanent.‚ÄôüîΩYou said, ‚ÄòCyclic existence exists, because there is a connection between actions and results.‚Äô

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: We have shown that the reason is faulty. We have shown that actions and results are essenceless.‚Äù

original: las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag ni re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag ni re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung
translated: To dispel the idea of others who say, ‚ÄúThis teaching was established by the mere logic of logicians in this treatise.‚Äù

original: gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya /
translated: Here, we will also establish scriptural sources that inspire confidence.

original: de'i phyir / 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo @47b 'od srungs kyi le'u las /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo @47b 'od srungs kyi le'u las /
translated: Thus, the chapter of KƒÅ≈õyapa in the Great Heap of Jewels S≈´tra says:

original: gang la las kyang med las kyi 'bras bu yang med pa de ni byang chub po //
analyzed: gang la las kyang med las kyi 'bras bu yang med pa de ni byang chub po //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is without karma and without the effects of karma is awakening.

original: byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du 'thob pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du 'thob pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is awakening, so is attainment.

original: 'thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du lung bstan pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du lung bstan pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is attainment, so is prophecy.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la las kyang med //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la las kyang med //
translated: Just as is the lineage of the noble ones, so in that there is no karma.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do //
translated: There is no ripening of karma.

original: rigs de la ni lus kyis kyang las mi byed /
analyzed: rigs de la ni lus kyis kyang las mi byed /
translated: In that lineage, the body does not perform karma.

original: ngag gis kyang mi byed /
analyzed: ngag gis kyang mi byed /
translated: One does not commit them with the body,üîΩone does not commit them with speech,

original: yid kyis kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yid kyis kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one does not commit them with the mind.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs ni don dam pa thugs su chud pa las 'phags pa rnams 'khrung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs ni don dam pa thugs su chud pa las 'phags pa rnams 'khrung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The noble lineage is the realization of the ultimate, from which the noble ones are born.

original: gal te don dam par yang las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par yang las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yod par gyur na /
translated: If karma and its effects were related ultimately,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las khyad par med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i lung ni de yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las khyad par med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i lung ni de yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: samsara and nirvana would be indistinguishable. Therefore, this is the scripture that clarifies that karma and its effects are essenceless.

original: dbu ma pa rnams la log par lta ba med do //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams la log par lta ba med do //
translated: Therefore, Madhyamikas do not have wrong views.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
translated: The establishment of these scriptures that inspire confidence is the source and the good qualities of the teaching that karma and its effects are essenceless.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad pa bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad pa bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The fact that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise is due to the great knowledge of the master and the skill of the commentator.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: Composed by Master BhƒÅviveka.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: From the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way.

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Examination of Action and Effect.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the seventeenth chapter, composed by Master Avalokitavrata, is complete.

original: // / da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa brtsam mo
analyzed: // / da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa brtsam mo
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the arguments presented by others and the faultlessness of our own arguments, the eighteenth chapter is begun with the meaning of the statement that compounded phenomena are empty of self and being mine in mind.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be viewed as having the sense of the cause of engaging in a commitment and the sense of being related to what will be stated in the treatise below.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, in terms of the sense of the cause of engaging in a commitment,

original: da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas zhes @48a * //
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas zhes @48a * //
translated: now, in order to dispel the objections raised by others and to demonstrate the irreproachability of his own proof,

original: bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bya ba smras te /
translated: he says,

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas /
translated: Since the author of the treatise, in the context of beginning the first chapter, the examination of conditions, made the commitment that all things are not produced,

original: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa da la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa da la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: here, in terms of the sense of the cause of engaging in that commitment, he says this.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba ni rang gi bde ba dang gzhan dag gis chos dang gang zag bdag yod par smras pa'i sgrub pa 'og nas 'byung ba bdag phung po yin no zhe 'am bdag phung po las gzhan no zhes bya ba la sogs paüîΩdag bsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba ni rang gi bde ba dang gzhan dag gis chos dang gang zag bdag yod par smras pa'i sgrub pa 'og nas 'byung ba bdag phung po yin no zhe 'am bdag phung po las gzhan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag bsal ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the proofs stated by others is the refutation of the proofs stated by others that the self exists, that is, the proofs that the self is the aggregates, that the self is different from the aggregates, and so forth.

original: bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho  ba med pa bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis chos dang gang zag bdag med par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa 'og nas 'byung ba /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho  ba med pa bstan pas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis chos dang gang zag bdag med par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa 'og nas 'byung ba /
translated: The teaching of the faultless proofs by the self is the teaching of the faultless proofs by the author of the treatise that the self does not exist in either of the two truths, that is, the proofs that will be stated below.

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have production and disintegration.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag bstan pas so //
translated: And so forth.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the passage that will be cited from the text, the eighteenth chapter is composed in terms of the meaning that compositional factors are taught to be empty of self and being mine.

original: bdag dang chos brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i khyon ni chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: bdag dang chos brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i khyon ni chos dang gang zag bdag med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: The passage from the text of the eighteenth chapter, the Examination of the Self and Phenomena, that will be cited below teaches the selflessness of persons and phenomena. Therefore it is said in terms of that.

original: de la chos bdag med pa de nyid bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: de la chos bdag med pa de nyid bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: In that regard, in terms of the meaning of the teaching of the selflessness of phenomena, it is said in terms of the meaning that compositional factors are taught to be empty of self and being mine.

original: des ni theg pa chen po las chos bdag med pa bstan pa gang yin pa de rab tu byed pa 'dir ston to zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: des ni theg pa chen po las chos bdag med pa bstan pa gang yin pa de rab tu byed pa 'dir ston to zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: This is connected to the statement that whatever teaches the selflessness of phenomena in the MahƒÅyƒÅna is taught in this chapter.

original: gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúin terms of the meaning of the teaching of the emptiness of self and being mine‚Äù is in terms of the meaning of the teaching of the selflessness of persons.

original: de ni chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs byed dag gis btags pa'i gang zag bdag med par ston to //
analyzed: de ni chos 'di pa dang gzhan mu stegs byed dag gis btags pa'i gang zag bdag med par ston to //
translated: This teaches the selflessness of persons imputed by Buddhists and non-Buddhists.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis na 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis na 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what aspects is that result obtained?

original: 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the emptiness of self and being mine of compounded phenomena is its result.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba @48b dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba @48b dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las
translated: That result is obtained by the aspect of the refutation of the proofs stated by others and the teaching of the faultlessness of one‚Äôs own proofs. Therefore the author of the commentary, in this context of connecting the chapter, states that the result is obtained by the method and the object of the method.

original: byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: The result of the first is taught first.

original: de la re zhig dang por gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan cing phyis chos bdag med pa nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por gang zag bdag med pa nyid bstan cing phyis chos bdag med pa nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: The selflessness of persons is taught first, and later the selflessness of phenomena is taught.

original: gang gi phyir go rims 'di ltar bstan pa ni slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir go rims 'di ltar bstan pa ni slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
translated: The order in which they are taught is stated by Master ƒÄryadeva:üîΩFirst, turn away from nonvirtue,

original: dang por bsod nams min las bzlog / bar du bdag las bzlog par bya //
analyzed: dang por bsod nams min las bzlog / bar du bdag las bzlog par bya //
translated: in the middle, turn away from self,

original: tha mar kun las bzlog bya ba //
analyzed: tha mar kun las bzlog bya ba //
translated: and in the end, turn away from everything.

original: gang shes de ni rigs pa ldan //
analyzed: gang shes de ni rigs pa ldan //
translated: One who knows this is endowed with reasoning.

original: zhes gsungs pas re zhig dang por sems can rnams bsod nams ma yin pa las bzlog pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / tha mar 'dzin pa thams cad las bzlog par bya ba thabs gang gis shes pa de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas re zhig dang por sems can rnams bsod nams ma yin pa las bzlog pa dang / de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / tha mar 'dzin pa thams cad las bzlog par bya ba thabs gang gis shes pa de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first sentient beings are turned away from nonvirtue, then they are turned away from grasping, and finally they are turned away from all grasping. One who knows this method is endowed with reasoning.

original: de'i phyir de la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa du ma dag gi yul yang phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa du ma dag gi yul yang phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since the aggregates are the object of the many views of self, the analysis should be undertaken in terms of the aggregates alone.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag bdag tu rtog par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag bdag tu rtog par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The proponents of self imagine the self in this way:

original: kha cig ni bdag ces bya ba lus tsam du rtog / kha cig ni mthe bong tsam du /üîΩkha cig ni nas 'bru tsam du /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag ces bya ba lus tsam du rtog / kha cig ni mthe bong tsam du / kha cig ni nas 'bru tsam du /
translated: Some imagine the self to be the body alone, some imagine it to be the size of a thumb,üîΩsome imagine it to be the size of a barley grain,

original: kha cig ni yungs 'bru tsam du /
analyzed: kha cig ni yungs 'bru tsam du /
translated: some imagine it to be the size of a mustard seed,üîΩand some imagine it to be the size of a hundredth of the tip of a hair.

original: kha cig ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha tsam du rtog par byed pa de dag thams cad kyi yul yang phung po yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa'i cha tsam du rtog par byed pa de dag thams cad kyi yul yang phung po yin te /
translated: The object of all of them is the aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad phung po rnams kho na la rtogs par byed pa de'i phyir 'dir yang phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas bdag med pa nyid dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad phung po rnams kho na la rtogs par byed pa de'i phyir 'dir yang phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas bdag med pa nyid dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Since all of them imagine the self in terms of the aggregates alone, therefore the selflessness of the aggregates alone should be analyzed here.

original: de ltar bdag tu lta ba dag gis yul phung po rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu lta ba dag gis yul phung po rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar nges par shes she na /
translated: Thus, how is it ascertained that the object of the view of self is the aggregates?

original: de'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of this,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge spyod ngam bram ze gang dag bdag tu yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge spyod ngam bram ze gang dag bdag tu yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúThus the BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄòAny virtuous practitioners or brahmins who view the self all view the five appropriated aggregates.‚Äô

original: ba smras so //
analyzed: ba smras so //
translated: The above is the commentary on the third chapter of the text,üîΩthe chapter on the refutation of the self of the person.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the very refutation of the proof the opponent stated,

original: de la re zhig gang dag 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam par 'jug pa dag gam /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam par 'jug pa dag gam /
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúIn this regard, first, to those who say that the self is the body, which is the manifestation of the great elements,

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa'am /
translated: the aggregation of the elements,

original: dbang po rnams sam /
analyzed: dbang po rnams sam /
translated: the sense faculties,

original: dbang po 'dus @49a * //
analyzed: dbang po 'dus @49a * //
translated: the aggregation of the sense faculties,

original: pa'am ; rnam par shes pa bdag yin no zhes smras pa de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'am ; rnam par shes pa bdag yin no zhes smras pa de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: or consciousness, one should say the following.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristics of the aggregates are the elements, faculties, and consciousnesses, either individually or collectively.

original: de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
analyzed: de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that they are the self,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na ji ltar kho bo cag gis tha snyad kyi don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na ji ltar kho bo cag gis tha snyad kyi don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
translated: then if the aggregates were the self, would it be like how we describe the aggregates as the self for the purpose of conventional expression?üîΩOr would it be something else?üîΩSome proponents of a self imagine that the elements such as earth individually enter into the form of the body and they imagine that the self is each of the elements.

original: 'on te gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba na bdag tu smra ba gang dag sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam pa 'dra bar 'jug pa so sor bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag 'byung ba chen po spyir 'dus pa tsam la bdag tu rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba na bdag tu smra ba gang dag sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam pa 'dra bar 'jug pa so sor bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag 'byung ba chen po spyir 'dus pa tsam la bdag tu rtog pa dang /
translated: Some imagine that the self is the mere collection of the elements.

original: gang dag mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams so so la bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag dbang po spyir 'dus pa tsam la bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag rnam par shes pa la bdag tu rtog pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams so so la bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag dbang po spyir 'dus pa tsam la bdag tu rtog pa dang / gang dag rnam par shes pa la bdag tu rtog pa de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: Those who imagine the eyes and so on, the faculties, to be the self individually, those who imagine the mere collection of the faculties to be the self, and those who imagine consciousness to be the self should be asked the following:

original: khyed 'byung ba so so 'am /
analyzed: khyed 'byung ba so so 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you imagine the self to be the individual elements,

original: 'dus pa dang / dbang po so so 'am /
analyzed: 'dus pa dang / dbang po so so 'am /
translated: the collection of elements, the individual faculties,

original: 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am /
analyzed: 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am /
translated: the collection of faculties, or the individual consciousnesses or the collection of consciousnesses?

original: 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are characterized by being aggregates,

original: de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
analyzed: de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
translated: if you imagine them to be the self,

original: ji ltar kho bo cag sangs rgyas pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo cag sangs rgyas pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa'i don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
translated: are you like us Buddhists who teach that the self is the object of the aggregates for the sake of positing conventional designations?

original: 'on te bdag ces bya ba don dam par sgrub pa zhig yod par 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag ces bya ba don dam par sgrub pa zhig yod par 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: Or do you assert that the so-called self is ultimately established?‚Äù

original: gal te ji ltar yang rung ste bdag sgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yang rung ste bdag sgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the object of your desire is accomplished in some way or another,

original: de skad ces dris pa na pha rol po dag na re khyed 'dod pa ltar yang rung gzhan 'dod pa ltar yang rung ste /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa na pha rol po dag na re khyed 'dod pa ltar yang rung gzhan 'dod pa ltar yang rung ste /
translated: then when asked this, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is all right if it is as you desire, or if it is as others desire.

original: yong spyir bdag yod par 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yong spyir bdag yod par 'grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don 'grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: In general, since the self is established, the object of our desire is accomplished.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir da de dpyad par bya ste /üîΩkhyod 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir da de dpyad par bya ste / khyod 'dod pa ltar /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúTherefore, this should be analyzed.

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates are the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: then it would arise and disintegrate.

original: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the aggregates have the quality of arising and disintegrating.‚Äù

original: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par gyur na de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par gyur na de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: If the aggregates were the self, then it would have the quality of arising and disintegrating.

original: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates are subject to arising and destruction.üîΩThus, this shows that the aggregates are subject to arising and destruction.

original: de ltar @49b na 'des ni phung po'i chos ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni phung po rnams bdag ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni
analyzed: de ltar @49b na 'des ni phung po'i chos ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni phung po rnams bdag ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni
translated: The first half of the verse shows that the aggregates are not the self by means of a reason that proves the thesis.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The aggregates are subject to arising and destruction.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The example is the external elements, which are a commonly recognized subject for both parties in the debate, and which are related to the thesis and the reason.

original: 'dir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul gyis gzung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul gyis gzung bar zad kyi /
translated: Here, the aggregates are subject to arising and destruction, which is stated by means of the method of the definition of a reason.

original: ji ltar phung po'i chos skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa de bzhin du phung po'i chos 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir phung po rnams nyid bdag ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan pa ni mtshan nyidüîΩkyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung bas mtshon ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po'i chos skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa de bzhin du phung po'i chos 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin par bya ba nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir phung po rnams nyid bdag ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung bas mtshon ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Here, the aggregates‚Äô characteristics of arising and disintegration are taught as the reason proving that the aggregates are not the self. This is merely an illustration by way of the term ‚Äúcharacteristic.‚Äù

original: phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that other characteristics as well, such as being effects, being causes, being objects of knowledge, being objects of purification, and so on, are the reason proving that the aggregates are not the self.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the valid cognition of that, it says:

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'byung ba dang 'byung ba 'dus pa dang dbang po dang dbang po'i 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'byung ba dang 'byung ba 'dus pa dang dbang po dang dbang po'i 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: Here the statement of the syllogism is: Ultimately, the elements, the assembly of the elements, the sense faculties, the assembly of the sense faculties, consciousness, the body together with the sense faculties, and the body together with consciousness are not the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they are subject to arising and disintegration.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, this is just like the external elements.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: de dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the external elements are subject to arising and disintegration.

original: bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du nad gi 'byung ba sa la sogs pa so so dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po so so dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang /üîΩrnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag @50a * //
analyzed: bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du nad gi 'byung ba sa la sogs pa so so dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po so so dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag @50a * //
translated: Likewise, the individual primary elements of the body, such as the earth element, the individual sense faculties such as the eyes, the composite of the sense faculties, consciousness, the body together with consciousness,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: and the body together with consciousness are not the self because they possess the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs re res kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs re res kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: Likewise, each of the reasons such as ‚Äúbecause it is an effect‚Äù should be elaborated with inference.

original: don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang ; dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang ; dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, the elements, the assembly of elements, the sense faculties, the assembly of sense faculties, consciousness, the body with sense faculties, and the body with consciousness are not the self,

original: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba brjod par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par shes par bya ba nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba brjod par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par shes par bya ba nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because they are the effect, because they are the cause, because they are the object of understanding, because they are the result of evolution, and because they are the object of expression, the object of consciousness, and so on, as in the case of external elements.

original: gal te 'dir mu stegs grangs can gsal bar smra ba dag 'di skad ces lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir mu stegs grangs can gsal bar smra ba dag 'di skad ces lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhya tƒ´rthikas were to say here, ‚ÄúThe body is the self, because it is the object of the notion ‚ÄòI,‚Äô‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then we would reply, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is manifest.

original: 'di ltar lus nyid bdag gis gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus nyid bdag gis gsal bar byed de /
translated: In this way, the body itself clarifies the self.

original: bdag yod pas 'di ni zin pa'i 'byung ba dag yin no zhes bya bar gzung du rung gi / bdag med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag ni ltar gzung du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong
analyzed: bdag yod pas 'di ni zin pa'i 'byung ba dag yin no zhes bya bar gzung du rung gi / bdag med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag ni ltar gzung du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong
translated: Since the self exists, it is suitable to apprehend that this is the appropriated elements, but without the self, there is no clarification and it is not suitable to apprehend the external elements that are not appropriated.

original: nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis ;
analyzed: nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis ;
translated: In response to this former opponent, the author of the commentary here says:

original: gsal ba smra ba dag la yang gsal ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rang gi rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsal ba smra ba dag la yang gsal ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rang gi rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even for those who speak of clarification, since the absence of self in pots and so on is not dependent on clarification, it is harmed by our own inference for those who say that the body possesses a self.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi lus bdag dang bcas pa'i phyogs la gsal ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs de bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa yod kyang bdag med pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi lus bdag dang bcas pa'i phyogs la gsal ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs de bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa yod kyang bdag med pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i
translated: Because the body is the subject of the statement, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is manifest‚Äù is like a pot.

original: phyogs yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs yod pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: But because the position that the body is not the self is not inconsistent with the existence of manifestation, the reason is indefinite.

original: 'di na bum pa la sogs pa dag la gsal bar byed pa mar me la /
analyzed: 'di na bum pa la sogs pa dag la gsal bar byed pa mar me la /
translated: For example, in regard to pots and so on, although a lamp exists as that which manifests them,üîΩit is seen that they are not the self.

original: sogs pa yod kyang de dag la bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas des na ji re zhig gsal ba'i phyir lus la bdag yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sogs pa yod kyang de dag la bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas des na ji re zhig gsal ba'i phyir lus la bdag yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, is the body the self because it is manifest?üîΩOr is it indefinite because it is not the self, like a pot and so on, because it is manifest?

original: 'on te gsal ba'i phyir dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bdag med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rang @50b gi rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bas gnod do //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i phyir dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bdag med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas par smra ba rnams la rang @50b gi rjes su dpag pa gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya bas gnod do //
translated: Thus the assertion that the body is the self is undermined by the autonomous argument ‚Äúbecause it is manifest.‚Äù

original: yang na gal te phung po bdag yin na zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gal te phung po bdag yin na zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Again, if the aggregates were the self, then the self would be plural,üîΩbecause the aggregates are many.üîΩThis is the remainder of the sentence.

original: phung po mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas mi
analyzed: phung po mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la bdag mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas mi
translated: Or, in another way, the fault of the self being plural would ensue in the position that advocates that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: rung bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable.

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would arise and disintegrate.

original: zhes bya ba ni des na phung por rjes su dpog pas skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyis bdag gi chos can gyi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des na phung por rjes su dpog pas skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyis bdag gi chos can gyi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par
translated: Since the self is inferred from the aggregates, the self would have the attribute of arising and disintegrating, because the attribute of arising and disintegrating is manifest in the aggregates.

original: gsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni yang rnams pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag ma yin par smra ba'i phyogs la chos can bdag gi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa gsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung
analyzed: gsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni yang rnams pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag ma yin par smra ba'i phyogs la chos can bdag gi khyad par skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa gsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthere is the fault of clarity‚Äù indicates that, in one sense, in the position that advocates that the aggregates themselves are not the self, the subject, the self, has the fault of clarity, because it has the property of being a thing that arises and disintegrates.

original: bar bstan to //
analyzed: bar bstan to //
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: the self would have production and disintegration.

original: zhes bya ba ni des na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du rjes su dpog pas bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi de'i bdag nyid gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid gsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du rjes su dpog pas bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi de'i bdag nyid gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid gsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas
translated: Since it is inferred that the self has the property of being a thing that arises and disintegrates, the subject, the self, is not the self. Therefore, the thesis has the fault of clarity, because the nature of the subject is clear.

original: ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la chos can bdag gi ngo bo nyid bdag ma yin par gsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ba bstan to //
analyzed: ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la chos can bdag gi ngo bo nyid bdag ma yin par gsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ba bstan to //
translated: In another way, the position that the aggregates themselves are the self is untenable because of the fault that the nature of the subject, the self, is clearly not the self.

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na /
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na /
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bdag ni skye dang 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / don dam par bdag med pa ni smra bar nus te /
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni bdag ni skye dang 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / don dam par bdag med pa ni smra bar nus te /
translated: it would have production and disintegration.üîΩSince the self is not asserted to have production and disintegration, it is difficult to demonstrate that it exists, that it does not have those characteristics.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: It is possible to say that ultimately the self does not exist because it does not have the qualities of being produced and disintegrating, like, for example, the horn of a rabbit.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra pa'i phyogs de la bdag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas pha rol pos de yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / dbu ma pas de med par smra bar nus pa'i 'thad pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra pa'i phyogs de la bdag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas pha rol pos de yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / dbu ma pas de med par smra bar nus pa'i 'thad pa bstan to //
translated: The Madhyamaka is able to demonstrate the logical reasoning that the self does not exist.

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni phung po rnams skye ba dang / @51a * //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams skye ba dang / @51a * //
translated: it would possess production and disintegration.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir des na don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir des na don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
translated: Since the aggregates are subject to production and disintegration, it is possible to demonstrate that ultimately the five aggregates, which are characterized by being suitable to be form, to be experienced, to apprehend signs, to be formative factors, and to be cognized, are not the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni yang rnam pa gcig tu na phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par smra ba'i phyogs de la phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin
translated: The phrase because they are subject to arising and disintegration, like a vase, for example indicates that the aggregates are subject to arising and disintegration.

original: pa'i phyir des na don dam par phung po rnams bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus pa'i phyogs gtan tshigs dang dpe dang bcas pa bstan te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir des na don dam par phung po rnams bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus pa'i phyogs gtan tshigs dang dpe dang bcas pa bstan te /
translated: This is a statement of a position that is supported by a logical reason and an example, which demonstrates that the aggregates cannot ultimately be the self.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The logical reason, the predicate of the proposition, the proposition to be proven, and the example should be understood in that order.

original: dper na bum pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: The phrase like a vase, for example indicates that a vase is subject to arising and disintegration and that it is not the self.

original: phung po dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus so //
analyzed: phung po dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus so //
translated: and the aggregates are also able to be known as not the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, one should elaborate the inference by means of such reasons as being the cause of the effect itself, being the cause of the cause itself, being the cause of the occasional pleasure and pain, being the cause of the doubtful cognition, and being the cause of the wrong cognition.

original: don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
translated: The five aggregates characterized by being suitable as form, experience, apprehension of signs, conditioning, and consciousness are able to be known as not the self because they are ultimately suitable as form, experience, apprehension of signs, conditioning, and consciousness.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: because it is the result, because it is the cause, because it is the cause of pleasure on some occasions, because it is the cause of torment on some occasions, because it is the cause of doubtful knowledge,

original: log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because it is the cause of wrong knowledge, and so on, like a pot.

original: de lta bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: da ni bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa yang med par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa yang med par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, it will be established that the self is also not different from the aggregates.

original: de la re zhig mu stegs bye brag pa dang / grangs can dang / skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par smra @51b ba'i gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig mu stegs bye brag pa dang / grangs can dang / skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par smra @51b ba'i gzhung bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, the Vai≈õe·π£ika, SƒÅ·πÉkhya, and Puru·π£a-s≈´trakƒÅra proponents of the self assert that the self is different from the aggregates. To demonstrate their texts,

original: bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan pa /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan pa /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that the self is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the intellect,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa thams cad du song ba yin par brjod la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa thams cad du song ba yin par brjod la /
translated: is the basis of pleasure and so on, is the agent, is not conscious, and is omnipresent.

original: grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa byed pa po ma yin pa dang / zab po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa byed pa po ma yin pa dang / zab po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the self is different from the effect and the cause, is not an agent, is subtle, is pure, is omnipresent, is unchanging, and is conscious.

original: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pas kyang de bzhin bas de dag la sgrub pa 'di mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skyes bu rgyur 'dod pas kyang de bzhin bas de dag la sgrub pa 'di mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that puru·π£a is the cause, they say that the self is not harmed by this argument.

original: da ni de dag gsal ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de dag gsal ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, let us explain those.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag bstan dka' ba des par mdzad nas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag bstan dka' ba des par mdzad nas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, the master, having made it difficult to teach a self that is different from the aggregates, explained for their sake:

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it is different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //üîΩphung po'i mtshan nyid med pa ni //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur // phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa ni //
translated: The aggregates would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: The aggregates would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.üîΩThe aggregates would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that they would not have the characteristics of form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness.

original: ci ste bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: de ltar na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
