analyzed: de ltar na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas des na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas des na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the aggregates have the characteristics of arising and disintegrating, the self would not have the characteristics of arising and disintegrating because it is different from the aggregates.

original: de lta na rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be permanent.

original: bdag brtags pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag brtags pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were an imputation, all endeavors would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod ;
translated: What can be done to an unchanging permanent thing?

original: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩde la cung zad kyang 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te / de la cung zad kyang 'jug pa'am /
translated: Even so, the conception of the existence of a self would be pointless.

original: ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, nothing whatsoever would be engaged or disengaged in regard to it.

original: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to //üîΩde ltar na 'dis ni brtags pa'i bdag gi chos ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag pha rol po dag gis
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to // de ltar na 'dis ni brtags pa'i bdag gi chos ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar na tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag pha rol po dag gis
translated: Therefore, it is shown that it is not tenable that the self is different from the aggregates.üîΩThus, this shows that the self that is imagined does not have the characteristic of the aggregates.üîΩThus, this second half of the verse shows that the self that is imagined by others to be different from the aggregates is established as nonexistent.

original: brtags pa med par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: brtags pa med par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The reason is that it does not have the characteristic of the aggregates.

original: dpe ni dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub @52a * //
analyzed: dpe ni dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub @52a * //
translated: The example is established by the power of that reason.

original: pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag med pa dang /
translated: The example that is similar to that predicate is the nonexistence of a self that is different from the aggregates, which is the probandum by the power of the proof.üîΩThe predicate of the proof is ‚Äúnot having the character of the aggregates.‚Äù The subject that is renowned to both parties is the son of a barren woman and so on.üîΩIn order to teach that, the text says, ‚ÄúThe example that is similar to that predicate is the nonexistence of a self that is different from the aggregates, which is the probandum by the power of the proof.

original: sgrub pa'i chos phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba dag dang chos mthun pa rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin par sbyar ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba dag dang chos mthun pa rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin par sbyar ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The predicate of the proof is ‚Äònot having the character of the aggregates.‚Äô The subject that is renowned to both parties is the son of a barren woman and so on.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
translated: In order to teach the valid knowledge of that, here a logical argument is stated: ‚ÄúUltimately, a self is not different from the aggregates of form and so on,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not have the character of the aggregates.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the son of a barren woman.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni /
translated: For example, just as the son of a barren woman

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phung po las logs shig na med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phung po las logs shig na med do //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phung po las logs shig na med pa de bzhin du bdag kyang phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phung po las logs shig na med do //
translated: is not separate from the aggregates because he does not have the characteristics of the aggregates, so too the self is not separate from the aggregates because it does not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa //
translated: If you say that nirvanaüîΩis not ascertained because it does not have the characteristics of the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is the opponent‚Äôs statement that the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not have the characteristics of the aggregates‚Äù is not ascertained, and it is a statement that raises the fault that it is not ascertained.

original: de dag na re 'di na mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin yang phung po las logs shig na yod par 'dod pas des na ji re zhig phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du bdag phung po las logs shig na med dam /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin yang phung po las logs shig na yod par 'dod pas des na ji re zhig phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir / dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du bdag phung po las logs shig na med dam /
translated: They say: Although nirvana is not characterized by the aggregates, since we assert that it exists separately from the aggregates, is it not the case that,

original: 'on te phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: like the son of a barren woman, the self does not exist separately from the aggregates because it is not characterized by the aggregates?üîΩOr, like nirvana, is it not the case that the self exists separately from the aggregates because it is not characterized by the aggregates?

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du bdag phung po las logs shig na yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du bdag phung po las logs shig na yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not certain, the Madhyamaka reason is not established.

original: de'i lan du /üîΩde ni // mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni ;
analyzed: de'i lan du / de ni // mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni ;
translated: In response to that, Candrakƒ´rti‚Äôs Commentary on the Middle Way says:üîΩThere is no existent thing

original: /'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: /'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: that is without a characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba der mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, because nirvana and so on are unconditioned things, it is not that the reason is not established because there is no counterexample.

original: de ni sngar khams brtag pa'i skabs su tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'dis mtshan @52b nyid med pa'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sngar khams brtag pa'i skabs su tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'dis mtshan @52b nyid med pa'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is because the first half of the verse in the chapter on the analysis of the elements refutes the unconditioned thing that is nirvana, which has no characteristics.üîΩIf you say that the reason is faulty because it is incomplete since the author of the treatise does not state the parts of a syllogism, such as the proposition,

original: gal te bstan bcos mdzad pas dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re slob dpon klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos mdzad pas dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re slob dpon klu sgrub kyis /
translated: then the opponent says, Master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna does not state the parts of a syllogism, such as the proposition,

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid me par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid me par 'gyur //
translated: it would have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: zhes smos pa des phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba phyogs kyi chos nyi tshe zhig bstan par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: zhes smos pa des phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba phyogs kyi chos nyi tshe zhig bstan par mdzad kyi /
translated: This statement indicates only a part of the subject of the syllogism, namely, that the aggregates are not the characteristics of the person.üîΩSince the thesis and example are not stated, the syllogism is incomplete.

original: dam bcas pa dang dpe dag ma bstan pas yan lag ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de ni bsgrub par mi rung ngo zhes skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang dpe dag ma bstan pas yan lag ma rdzogs pa'i phyir de ni bsgrub par mi rung ngo zhes skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The statement is faulty because it is not a correct proof.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says:

original: don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault because it is a statement of meaning.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyi tshig dag yin te /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi tshig dag yin te /
translated: The words of the master are like this.

original: yi ge mdor bsdus pa dang / don rgya che ba dag yin pas don gyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag gi gzhi yin par bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yi ge mdor bsdus pa dang / don rgya che ba dag yin pas don gyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag gi gzhi yin par bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since they are concise in letters but extensive in meaning, he accepts that they are the basis of many statements of proof that are governed by meaning.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa mdzad pa dag la skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa mdzad pa dag la skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the statements of the master himself in the verses.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig la ni de skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa sbyor ba'i tshig rtsom pa dag la ni sgrub pa ma tshang ba de skyon du yang 'gyur ba bden no zhes khas blang ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig la ni de skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa sbyor ba'i tshig rtsom pa dag la ni sgrub pa ma tshang ba de skyon du yang 'gyur ba bden no zhes khas blang ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of a syllogistic statement, that would be a fault‚Äù is a statement of acceptance by the commentator that it is true that the incompleteness of the proof would be a fault in the case of the composition of a syllogistic statement.

original: 'o na khyod la skyon du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod la skyon du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Well then, would it not be a fault for you?

original: kho bos don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
analyzed: kho bos don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
translated: We accept that ultimately the self does not exist apart from the aggregates such as form,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes yan lag tshang bar brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes yan lag tshang bar brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: because it does not have the character of the aggregates, just like the son of a barren woman.

original: yang na de la de yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de la de yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, it would not be a fault for us, because

original: rab tu byed pa'am lung las la la la yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na'o zhes bya ba ni yang na sbyor ba'i tshig de la yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod du zin kyang de la skyon du mi 'gyur bar gzhung 'dzugs pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'i skabs sam /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'am lung las la la la yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na'o zhes bya ba ni yang na sbyor ba'i tshig de la yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod du zin kyang de la skyon du mi 'gyur bar gzhung 'dzugs pa'i tshig yin te / de yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'i skabs sam /
translated: If in a treatise or scripture, some part is known to someone, then even if the words of the syllogism are not complete, the text is established as faultless.

original: lung las gang zag la la sgrub pa'i yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na de ma brjod kyang skyon du ma'i 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung las gang zag la la sgrub pa'i yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na de ma brjod kyang skyon du ma'i 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if in the context of a treatise or in a scripture, some part of the proof is known to someone, then even if it is not stated, there is no fault.

original: ji skad du gang yang rung ba brjod na yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du gang yang rung ba brjod na yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said, If any one of them is stated, it is a proof.üîΩSome say that the previous reason is not established, because of the directions, etc.

original: kha cig na re phyogs la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid do zhe'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa rdzas dgu rtag par 'dod pa dag dbu ma pas sngar phung po @53a * //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyogs la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid do zhe'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa rdzas dgu rtag par 'dod pa dag dbu ma pas sngar phung po @53a * //
translated: Those who assert that the nine substances, earth, etc., are permanent say that the previous reason is not established, because the directions, etc., are not established for the Madhyamikas.

original: rnams nyid bdag ma yin par bsgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: rnams nyid bdag ma yin par bsgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang / dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: In the context of establishing that the elements themselves are not the self, the argument that the elements, the composite of elements, the sense faculties, the composite of sense faculties, consciousness, the body with faculties, and the body with consciousness are not the self

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they possess the attributes of arising and disintegrating

original: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: is a statement that faults the reason as being indefinite.

original: de dag na re 'di na phyogs dang / dus dang / nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba rdzas lnga po dag skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na phyogs dang / dus dang / nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid ces bya ba rdzas lnga po dag skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la /
translated: They say that in this regard, the five substances called direction, time, space, self, and mind possess the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: de dag rang bzhin rtag pas bdag kyang yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /üîΩdper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin du phung po rnams bdag ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin rtag pas bdag kyang yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir / dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin du phung po rnams bdag ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, are the aggregates not the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration,üîΩlike the external elements?

original: 'on te skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or are the aggregates not the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration,

original: dper na phyogs dang / dus dang / nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid bzhin du phung po rnams bdag yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dper na phyogs dang / dus dang / nam mkha' dang / bdag dang / yid bzhin du phung po rnams bdag yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
translated: like space, direction, time, the self, and the wish-fulfilling tree?

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is uncertain, the Madhyamaka reason is not established.

original: de dag gi gzhung las phyogs la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul gyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la rang bzhin brtags pas bdag tu yang 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las phyogs la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul gyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la rang bzhin brtags pas bdag tu yang 'dod de /
translated: In their texts, they assert that space and so on are the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration in the manner of being visible and invisible and because they are imputed to be the nature.

original: 'di ltar phyogs kyang len 'ga' ma bslad pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs kyang len 'ga' ma bslad pa'i tshe ni /
translated: Thus when space is not contaminated by clouds,üîΩit is visible.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye la bslad pa'i tshe na ni mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa dang / dus kyang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa 'jug pa'i tshul gyis ni skye la 'das pa ldog pa'i tshul gyis ni 'jig pa dang nam mkha' yang dngos po gzhan gyis go phyi ba'i tshul gyis ni skye la dngos po gzhan gyis go bkag pa'i tshul gyis ni 'jig
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye la bslad pa'i tshe na ni mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'jig pa dang / dus kyang da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa 'jug pa'i tshul gyis ni skye la 'das pa ldog pa'i tshul gyis ni 'jig pa dang nam mkha' yang dngos po gzhan gyis go phyi ba'i tshul gyis ni skye la dngos po gzhan gyis go bkag pa'i tshul gyis ni 'jig
translated: Time is produced by the mode of engaging the present and future and is destroyed by the mode of turning back to the past. Space is produced by the mode of being pervaded by other things and is destroyed by the mode of being blocked by other things.

original: pa dang / bdag kyang mthe bong tsam la sogs par mthong ba'i tshul gyis ni skye la de ltar ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis ni 'jig pa dang / yid kyang dran pa'i tshe na skye la mi dran pa'i tshe ni 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: pa dang / bdag kyang mthe bong tsam la sogs par mthong ba'i tshul gyis ni skye la de ltar ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis ni 'jig pa dang / yid kyang dran pa'i tshe na skye la mi dran pa'i tshe ni 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang yin la /
translated: The self is produced by the mode of being seen as the size of a thumb and so on and is destroyed by the mode of not being seen in that way. The mind is produced when it is remembered and is destroyed when it is not remembered.

original: de dag rang bzhin rtag pas bdag yin par yang 'dod ces grag go //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin rtag pas bdag yin par yang 'dod ces grag go //
translated: It is also said that they assert that these are the self because they are permanent by nature.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te //
translated: That is not good.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i @53b dngos po ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i @53b dngos po ni //
translated: A thing without a defining characteristic

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist anywhere at all.

original: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, since this has already been answered,

original: sngar khams brtag pa'i skabs su tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po gsal ba bzhin du phyogs la sogs pa yang gsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar khams brtag pa'i skabs su tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po gsal ba bzhin du phyogs la sogs pa yang gsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since this verse-form clearly indicates such unconditioned things as space, and since direction and so on are also clearly indicated, there is no counterexample, and thus it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: brtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúall-pervading‚Äù is that it is the basis of pleasure, pain, and so on,

original: skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
translated: because it possesses arising and so on.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust like form and so on‚Äù indicates the valid cognition that refutes the assertion of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is the basis of pleasure and so on, which is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the mind.

original: / bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan brtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / blo dang ; 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang /
analyzed: / bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag lus dang dbang po dang blo las gzhan brtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don de ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / blo dang ; 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika texts assert that the self, which is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the mind, is the basis of pleasure and pain, cognition, desire, hatred,

original: 'bad pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / shes pa dag gi gzhir 'gyur ba yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /üîΩde dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'bad pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / shes pa dag gi gzhir 'gyur ba yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /üîΩde dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: effort, virtue, nonvirtue, and cognition. This is refuted by this chapter.üîΩThe body, the sense faculties, and the mind are the subject. Pleasure and so on are the property to be proven. The self is the property of the subject. The example is the pot and so on.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / byas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don de yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa ni skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / byas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don de yang skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: For example, form and so on are not the basis of pleasure, pain, and so on because they are produced and because they are created and so on.

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, that object of expression that is different from the sense faculties and the mind, that is permanent and all-pervading, is not the basis of pleasure, pain, and so on because it is produced and because it is created and so on.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir zhes bya ba de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir zhes bya ba de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The extensive explanation is the same as before means that the reason in the previous inference, ‚Äúbecause they are produced and so on,‚Äù is merely an illustration.

original: de'i gtan tshigs de ni snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya ba yin no //üîΩbdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs de ni snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya ba yin no // bdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te //
translated: The reason for that is that, as before, it is the reason that it is the effect, the cause, the cause of pleasure and pain, the cause of doubt and wrong knowledge, and so on.

original: rdzas @54a * //
analyzed: rdzas @54a * //
translated: The self is not the all-pervading lord,üîΩbecause it is a substance,üîΩlike a pot.

original: yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa thams cad du song ba yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa thams cad du song ba yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: This shows the valid knowledge that refutes the statement by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is all-pervading and pervades everything other than the body, sense faculties, and mind.

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag thams cad du song ba ni khyab bdag yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag thams cad du song ba ni khyab bdag yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures assert that the all-pervading self is the all-pervading lord. This passage refutes that.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na bum pa ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a pot is not a pervader because it is a substance.

original: khyab bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rdzas yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rdzas yin pa'i phyir khyab bdag ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the self is not a pervader because it is a substance.üîΩIf you say that space is not ascertained,

original: gal te nam mkha' ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rdzas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rdzas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: the opponent‚Äôs words that the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äúbecause it is a substance‚Äù is not ascertained are words that raise an objection.

original: de dag na re 'di na nam mkha' rdzas yin yang khyab bdag ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin du bdag khyab bdag ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na nam mkha' rdzas yin yang khyab bdag ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin du bdag khyab bdag ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúHere we see that space is a substance but is not a pervader. Therefore, does this mean that the self is not a pervader because it is a substance, like a pot, for example?

original: 'on te rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin du bdag khyab bdag yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'on te rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin du bdag khyab bdag yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamaka reason is not established.

original: de'i lan du /üîΩnam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du / nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that,üîΩbecause the substantial existence of space is refuted and because its being a pervasive entity is refuted, like the self being a pervasive entity, it is not uncertain.

original: don dam par nam mkha' ma skyes pas rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir khyab bdag ma yin pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam par nam mkha' ma skyes pas rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir khyab bdag ma yin pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because ultimately space is not arisen, its substantial existence is refuted and it is not a pervasive entity, and because the status of being a pervasive entity of space is refuted, like the status of being a pervasive entity of the self.

original: ji ltar bdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te /
translated: Just as the self is not a pervasive entity

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: because it is not arisen, like a sky flower,

original: nam mkha' yang khyab bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang khyab bdag ma yin te /
translated: in the same way, space is not a pervasive entityüîΩbecause it is not arisen, like the self.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no counterexample, it is not indeterminate.

original: de bzhin du bdag ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the self is not an agentüîΩbecause it has a body, like an action.

original: lus can yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa byed pa po yin par brjod la zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma @54b ston te /
analyzed: lus can yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa byed pa po yin par brjod la zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma @54b ston te /
translated: This shows the valid knowledge that refutes the assertion of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is an agent that is different from the body, the senses, and the intellect.

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag byed pa po yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag byed pa po yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The assertion of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is an agent is refuted by this passage.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na bsams pa'i las ni lus can yin pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang mthe bong tsam la sogs pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bsams pa'i las ni lus can yin pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang mthe bong tsam la sogs pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: For example, the object of thought is not an agent because it has a body. Likewise, the self is not an agent because it has a body, such as a thumb.

original: bdag ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The self is not permanent because it is a substance, like a pot.

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa rtag pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa rtag pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: This shows the valid knowledge that refutes the statement of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, ‚ÄúThe self is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the intellect and it is permanent.‚Äù

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag rtag pa yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag rtag pa yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The assertion of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is permanent is refuted by this passage.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na bum pa ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rdzas yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni rdzas yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rdzas yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, just as a pot is not permanent because it is a substance, so too the self is not permanent because it is a substance.

original: de bzhin du shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, it should be said that the self is not permanent because it is an object of knowledge, because it is expressible, because it is an entity, and so on.

original: bdag ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The self is not without a cause,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is an entity.üîΩFor example, like a pot.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa yin par brjod la zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: This shows the valid knowledge that refutes the assertion of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas that the self is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the intellect.

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The Vaise~ika system asserts that the self is causeless, that it is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the intellect. This passage refutes that.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The self, the property to be established, is the subject, and the property that establishes it and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na bum pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, because a pot is a thing, it is not causeless. Similarly, because the self is a thing, it is not causeless.

original: de bzhin du tshig gi don nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //üîΩre zhig @55a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig gi don nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //üîΩre zhig @55a * //
translated: In the same way, it should be said that because it is the meaning of the words and so on, the reason is also applied to the previous inference.

original: de dag ni bye brag pa dag gis bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par brtags pa'i gzhung mi 'thad par sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bye brag pa dag gis bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par brtags pa'i gzhung mi 'thad par sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: These are refutations of the non-validity of the doctrines that the Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine the self to be different from the aggregates.

original: da ni grangs can dag gis bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par brtags pa'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni grangs can dag gis bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par brtags pa'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-validity of the doctrines that the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine the self to be different from the aggregates,

original: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: in the same way, ultimately the self is not a conscious experiencer,

original: rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not permanent,

original: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
translated: it does not pervade all,

original: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not causeless.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir /
translated: Because it is a thing, because it is sometimes the cause of correct consciousness, incorrect consciousness, and doubtful consciousness, and because it is sometimes the cause of pleasure, pain, and so on,

original: dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is like a pillar.

original: des ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa sems pa yod pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / thams cad du song ba dang / rgyu las gzhan pa yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de dag sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: des ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa sems pa yod pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / thams cad du song ba dang / rgyu las gzhan pa yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de dag sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: This shows the valid cognition that refutes the assertions of the Samkhyas that the self is the mind, which is different from the effect and cause, is unchanging, is omnipresent, and is different from the cause.

original: grangs can dag gi gzhung las bdag sems pa yod pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / rgyu med pa yin par 'dod pa de dag skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi gzhung las bdag sems pa yod pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / rgyu med pa yin par 'dod pa de dag skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The Samkhyas assert that the self exists as the mind, is permanent, is omnipresent, and is causeless. This section refutes those assertions.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na ka ba ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na ka ba ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: For example, a pillar is not a sentient being because it is a thing, because it is not the cause of a correct consciousness, an incorrect consciousness, or a doubting consciousness, and because it is not the cause of pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /üîΩrgyu med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa ba dang ; the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin / rgyu med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa ba dang ; the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang /
translated: It does not pervade all things.üîΩIt is not without a cause.

original: yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the self is not a sentient being because it is a thing, because it is not the cause of a correct consciousness, an incorrect consciousness, or a doubting consciousness, and because it is not the cause of pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
translated: It does not pervade all things.üîΩIt is not without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it causeless.

original: yang grangs @55b can gyi phyogs la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang grangs @55b can gyi phyogs la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya position should be stated:

original: don dam par bdag ni za ba po ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni za ba po ma yin te /
translated: ultimately, the self is not the experiencer

original: the tshom gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of doubt, cognition, and so on.üîΩFor example, it is like a tree stump and a pot.

original: dper na sdong du ma dang bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa za ba po yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: dper na sdong du ma dang bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa za ba po yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de sun 'byin pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: This statement shows the valid reasoning that refutes the earlier statement by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas that the self is different from the effect and the cause and is the experiencer.

original: grangs can dag gi gzhung las bdag za ba po yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi gzhung las bdag za ba po yin par 'dod pa de skabs 'dis sun 'byin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the self is the experiencer. This section refutes that.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na sdong du ma dang bum pa ni the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir za ba po ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir za ba po ma yin
analyzed: dper na sdong du ma dang bum pa ni the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir za ba po ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir za ba po ma yin
translated: For example, a tree and a pot are not the experiencer because they are the cause of a doubting consciousness and so on.

original: no // ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du dbu ma pas bdag tshig gi don nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: no // ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du dbu ma pas bdag tshig gi don nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa mi rigs te /
translated: If someone thinks, ‚ÄúSince the MƒÅdhyamika does not accept a self as the referent of the term, it is illogical to teach its attributes,üîΩjust as it would be to teach the blueness or whiteness of the son of a barren woman,‚Äù

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang dkar sham nyid dag ston pa bzhin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba la la dag 'di snyam du dbu ma pas don dam par bdag ces bya ba tshig gi don nyid du yod
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang dkar sham nyid dag ston pa bzhin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba la la dag 'di snyam du dbu ma pas don dam par bdag ces bya ba tshig gi don nyid du yod
translated: some opponents might think, ‚ÄúThe MƒÅdhyamika does not accept a self as the referent of the term ‚Äòself‚Äô ultimately.

original: par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur ba dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba la sogs pa phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur ba dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba la sogs pa phyogs su byas te /
translated: Because the Vai≈õe·π£ikas do not accept that, they take as their position that the self is the basis of such qualities as pleasure, the agent, not an object of touch, permanent, omnipresent, and so on.

original: de dag med par ston pa ni gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir mi rigs te /üîΩdper na mo gsham gyi bu med pa'i khyad par sngo bsangs dang dkar sham nyid dag ston pa mi rigs pa bzhin no snyam du sems pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag med par ston pa ni gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir mi rigs te / dper na mo gsham gyi bu med pa'i khyad par sngo bsangs dang dkar sham nyid dag ston pa mi rigs pa bzhin no snyam du sems pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Because the opponent does not accept that, he posits the attributes of being the basis of pleasure and so on, being the agent, being insentient, being permanent, being all-pervading, and so on.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yul la bdag tu tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la bdag tu brjod de /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yul la bdag tu tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la bdag tu brjod de /
translated: because the so-called self is described as the consciousness that is the basis of the conventions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù and the basis of the appropriation of the existence of rebirth.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúA tamed mind is virtuous.

original: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba 'thob //
translated: One obtains happiness through a tamed mind.‚Äù

original: ces gsungs nas /
analyzed: ces gsungs nas /
translated: Thus he taught.

original: yang mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: yang mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: Again, in another sutra it says:

original: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
translated: One‚Äôs own self is one‚Äôs own protector;

original: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
translated: Who else could be one‚Äôs protector?

original: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
translated: The wise one who is well disciplined

original: mtho ris dag kyang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes @56a * //
analyzed: mtho ris dag kyang thob par 'gyur // zhes @56a * //
translated: Will attain the higher realms.

original: gsungs pas de'i phyir tha snyad du bdag spyir khas blangs pa'i phyir khyad par ma grags pa sel ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsungs pas de'i phyir tha snyad du bdag spyir khas blangs pa'i phyir khyad par ma grags pa sel ba'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, since in general the self is accepted conventionally, the fault is removed by eliminating the non-renowned features.

original: dbu ma pa yang tha snyad du rnam par shes pa la bdag tu gdags pa khas len pas tha snyad du gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dbu ma pa yang tha snyad du rnam par shes pa la bdag tu gdags pa khas len pas tha snyad du gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Since the Madhyamikas also conventionally accept the designation of consciousness as the self, the basis is not non-established conventionally.

original: de'i khyad par pha rol bos brtags pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba la sogs pa ma grags pa dag don dam par sel ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par pha rol bos brtags pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba la sogs pa ma grags pa dag don dam par sel ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Since the non-renowned features imputed by the opponent, such as being the basis of pleasure and so on, being the agent, being without mind, being permanent, being all-pervading, and so on, are eliminated ultimately, there is no fault.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should perform another syllogism.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /üîΩdmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes bya bas ni bdag tu smra ba dag dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas bdag gi phyi rol gyi yul dmigs par byed pas dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag gi yul
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te / dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes bya bas ni bdag tu smra ba dag dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas bdag gi phyi rol gyi yul dmigs par byed pas dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag gi yul
translated: The body together with the sense faculties is not the uncommon cause of the object of the word that goes everywhere and is permanent,üîΩbecause it is the object of observation, like a pillar.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i tshad ma gzhan ston te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i tshad ma gzhan ston te /
translated: This demonstrates another valid cognition that refutes the assertion of the proponents of self that the body together with the sense faculties is the uncommon cause of the object of the self‚Äôs observation of external objects because the body together with the sense faculties is the object of observation of the self‚Äôs consciousness.üîΩThe body together with the sense faculties is not the uncommon cause of the object of the self‚Äôs observation of external objects because it is the object of observation, like a pillar.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na ka ba ni dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ka ba ni dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pillar is not the uncommon cause of the observation of the meaning of the word ‚Äúpermanent self‚Äù and ‚Äúself that pervades all.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyang dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the body together with the sense faculties is not the uncommon cause of the observation of the meaning of the word ‚Äúpermanent self‚Äù and ‚Äúself that pervades all.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, you should state the reasons ‚Äúbecause it is not an object of knowledge‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir bdag tu smra bdag phyir zlog par byed de phung po lnga dang lus la bdag med do zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas /
analyzed: 'dir bdag tu smra bdag phyir zlog par byed de phung po lnga dang lus la bdag med do zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas /
translated: Here, the proponents of a self are refuted because the five aggregates and the body are not the self. What is the meaning of that?

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have production and disintegration.

original: zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar @56b nus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sgrub pa'i skabs su don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar @56b nus te /
translated: In the context of the proof, it is possible to understand that the five aggregates, which have the characteristics of being able to be formed, experienced, conceptually differentiated, conditioned, and cognized, are not the self,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have the quality of being produced and disintegrating.üîΩFor example, it is like a pot.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de la 'dir bdag tu smra ba dag na re dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes rtog cing de'i dpe bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi 'gyur bar glan ka tshol ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa de la 'dir bdag tu smra ba dag na re dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes rtog cing de'i dpe bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi 'gyur bar glan ka tshol ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Here, the proponents of a self may think, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of that thesis?‚Äù And they may seek to refute the example, ‚ÄúIt is like a pot,‚Äù by saying, ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gal te de dag la bdag med do zhe na ni dpe med de bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de dag la bdag med do zhe na ni dpe med de bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, if you say that they are selfless, then the example is not established, because a vase and so on also exist.

original: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po de dag la bdag med pas phung po lnga po de dag bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te zhes bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po de dag la bdag med pas phung po lnga po de dag bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te zhes bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If the meaning of the Madhyamaka thesis is that the five aggregates are to be understood as not the self because the self does not exist in the aggregates,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de mi rung ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de mi rung ste /
translated: then the example ‚Äúlike a vase‚Äù is not suitable.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang bdag yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang bdag yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we assert that the self exists in vases and so on.

original: gal te de la dmigs par mi byed do zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te de la dmigs par mi byed do zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is not observed,

original: de lta na yang dpe med de bum pa la sogs pa ni yul dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe med de bum pa la sogs pa ni yul dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then the example is not established because a vase and so on is the cause of observing an object.

original: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi lus de dag bdag de yul de la dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas phung po rnams kyis bdag de yul de la dmigs par mi byed pas phung po lnga po dag
analyzed: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi lus de dag bdag de yul de la dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas phung po rnams kyis bdag de yul de la dmigs par mi byed pas phung po lnga po dag
translated: If the meaning of the Madhyamaka thesis is that the five aggregates and the body are not the cause of the observation of the self, then the aggregates do not observe the self.

original: bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te zhes bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te zhes bya ba yin na ni /
translated: But if the five aggregates are able to be known as not the self,

original: de lta na yang dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i dpe de mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i dpe de mi rung ste /
translated: then the example ‚Äúlike a pot‚Äù is not suitable.

original: dmigs pa'i bya ba ni byed pa po la yang gnas la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bya ba ni byed pa po la yang gnas la /
translated: Because the action of observation is based on the agent,

original: yul la yang gnas pas des na bum pa la sogs pa yul rnams kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la yang gnas pas des na bum pa la sogs pa yul rnams kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is also based on the object, therefore objects such as pots are the cause of observation.

original: gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin no zhe na yang de lta na yang dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin no zhe na yang de lta na yang dpe med de /
translated: But if you say that the cause of observation is not common, then in that case there is no example.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because pots and so on are the uncommon cause of observation.

original: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi lus de dag bdag yul de la dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pas phung po lnga po dag bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus
analyzed: gal te dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa de'i don phung po lnga dang gzugs kyi lus de dag bdag yul de la dmigs par byed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pas phung po lnga po dag bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus
translated: If the meaning of the Madhyamaka thesis is that the five aggregates and the body are not the self because they are not the uncommon cause of the observation of the object, the self, then it is possible to understand that the five aggregates are not the self.

original: te zhes bya ba yin na ni de ltan yang dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de mi rung ste /
analyzed: te zhes bya ba yin na ni de ltan yang dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe de mi rung ste /
translated: But even so, the example, ‚Äúlike a pot,‚Äù is not correct.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni snam bu la sogs pa gzhan dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni snam bu la sogs pa gzhan dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is because pots and so on are not the uncommon cause of the observation of other things, such as cloth,

original: rang nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but they are the uncommon cause of their own observation.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, Candrakƒ´rti‚Äôs Commentary on the Middle Way says:

original: de la 'dir phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, because it is asserted that the five aggregates and the body are not the uncommon cause of the observation of the self,

original: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub @57a */
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub @57a */
translated: the example is not correct.

original: pa sun 'byung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa sun 'byung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But this is not a response that can refute us.

original: kho bo cag gis phung po lnga dang / gzugs kyi lus kyi bdag de yul la dmigs par mi byed do zhes dam bcas pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis phung po lnga dang / gzugs kyi lus kyi bdag de yul la dmigs par mi byed do zhes dam bcas pas /
translated: We have asserted that the five aggregates and the body are not the object of the self.

original: phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag de'i yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir don de bum pa la yang yod de /üîΩ'di ltar bum pas kyang bdag de yul la dmigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag de'i yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir don de bum pa la yang yod de / 'di ltar bum pas kyang bdag de yul la dmigs par mi byed de /
translated: The five aggregates and the body are not the cause of the self observing its object, and the meaning of that is also found in the example of a pot.

original: bum pa ni bdag da yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdpe grub pas khyed kyi tshig de gsum ni /
analyzed: bum pa ni bdag da yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro // dpe grub pas khyed kyi tshig de gsum ni /
translated: In this way, a pot is not the object of the self because a pot is not the cause of the self observing its object.

original: kho bos ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa sun 'byung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: kho bos ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa sun 'byung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po lnga bcu dgu pa /
translated: Since the example is established, your three statements are not a response that can refute the proof that we have stated.

original: yang na rnal 'byor bas rang nyid kyis 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos 'di gang zag bdag med pa nyid bsgom pa'i thabs yin par ston te /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor bas rang nyid kyis 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan bcos 'di gang zag bdag med pa nyid bsgom pa'i thabs yin par ston te /
translated: Or else, the yogi/nƒ´ should investigate this, etc. shows that this treatise is a method for meditating on the selflessness of persons.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa rtogs par 'dod pas rang nyid kyis don 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa rtogs par 'dod pas rang nyid kyis don 'di brtag par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nƒ´ who wishes to realize the selflessness of persons should investigate this matter for him/herself.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: What is called ‚Äúself‚Äù here, is it the characteristic of the aggregates,

original: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or is it something other than the aggregates?

original: 'di la rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pas 'di ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pas 'di ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya ste /
translated: Here, the yogi/nƒ´ who wishes to see the reality of the selflessness of persons, who is endowed with thorough analysis, should investigate this as follows:

original: 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ji ltar phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ji ltar phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: What is called ‚Äúself‚Äù here, is it the characteristic of the aggregates,üîΩor is it something other than the aggregates?

original: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin /
translated: Or is it different from the aggregates?

original: bdag de ni phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag de ni phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The self is either characterized by the aggregates orüîΩit is different from the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba de tsam du zad de /
translated: This is the extent of the matter.

original: 'dir rnam pa gzhan du smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba dag kho nar 'dus te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa gzhan du smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba dag kho nar 'dus te /
translated: All those who speak of the self in some other way are included among those who speak of it as being identical to or different from the aggregates.üîΩBut both of these positions are untenable.

original: gnyis ka yang mi 'thad do zhes de ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mi 'thad do zhes de ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya'o //
translated: This is how you should analyze them individually.

original: ci'i phyir de gnyis ka la yang mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gnyis ka la yang mi 'thad ce na /
translated: Why are both positions untenable?

original: de la re zhig /
analyzed: de la re zhig /
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the self would have production and destruction.

original: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par gyur na /üîΩde lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag yin par gyur na / de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the self would have the qualities of production and destruction because the aggregates have the qualities of production and destruction.

original: de la bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, it follows that there would be many selves.

original: bdag tu smra ba @57b don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba @57b don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: And the doctrine of self would be pointless,

original: bdag ces bya ba ni phung po'i rnam grangs tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni phung po'i rnam grangs tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ‚Äúself‚Äù would be no more than a synonym for the aggregates.

original: de bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logical argument for that,

original: des na de dag bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag bdag ma yin te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, they are not the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have the property of arising and ceasing,

original: dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like a pillar.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na ka ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na ka ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The aggregates are the subject, the property to be proven is ‚Äúnot the self,‚Äù the reason is ‚Äúbecause they have the property of arising and ceasing,‚Äù and the example is ‚Äúlike a pillar.‚ÄùüîΩFor example, a pillar is not the self because it has the property of arising and ceasing.

original: phung po de dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po de dag kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir bdag ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the aggregates are not the self because they have the property of arising and ceasing.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
