translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: ci ste yang bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: But if the self were different from the aggregates,

original: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par gyur te /
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas des na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas des na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the aggregates have the characteristics of arising and ceasing, the self would not have the characteristics of arising and ceasing because it is different from the aggregates.

original: de lta na rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be permanent.

original: bdag rtag pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were permanent, all effort would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod /
translated: What use is there for something permanent and unchanging?

original: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the conception of the existence of the self would be pointless.

original: de la cung zad kyang 'jug pa'am ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la cung zad kyang 'jug pa'am ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nothing would be engaged or disengaged in relation to it.

original: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the self is different from the aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logical argument for that, he says:

original: des na de ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na de ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not exist at all,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not have the characteristics of a heap.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like a flower in the sky.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the logical argument, the property of the position, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a flower in the sky does not exist at all because it does not have the characteristics of a heap.

original: bdag de yang phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bdag de yang phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir med pa kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, the self does not exist at all because it does not have the characteristics of a heap.

original: de bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the self does not exist through such logical arguments as its non-arising and its lack of a cause.

original: sgrub pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The logical arguments of the previous proof are also to be applied to these.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Proponents of a self say: The self definitely exists because

original: don mthong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: don mthong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: objects are seen.

original: @58a * // 'di ltar lus la bdag med na dbang po sems pa med pa skar khung dang 'dra bas don mthong bar mi 'thad kyi /
analyzed: @58a * // 'di ltar lus la bdag med na dbang po sems pa med pa skar khung dang 'dra bas don mthong bar mi 'thad kyi /
translated: If the body were devoid of self, it would be untenable for the insentient sense faculties, which are like windows, to see objects.

original: bdag des ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan mthong bar rigs pas gang gis mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: bdag des ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan mthong bar rigs pas gang gis mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
translated: But it is logical that the self, which is not similar to them in characteristics, sees them.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Therefore the self definitely exists.

original: 'dir bdag tu smra ba bdag phyir rol gyi yul mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyis phung po la bdag yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag tu smra ba bdag phyir rol gyi yul mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyis phung po la bdag yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is a statement that proves the self exists in the aggregates by the reason of the self seeing external objects.üîΩThe self is the subject, the property to be proven is the self, the proving property is the reason, the example of the dissimilar class is the eye, the application of the reason is the application, and the conclusion is the summary.

original: 'di na skar khung lta bu sems pa med pa gang gis phyi rol gyi don mi mthong ba de la ni bdag med kyi dbang po sems pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba phyi rol gyi don gzhan mthong bas gang gis
analyzed: 'di na skar khung lta bu sems pa med pa gang gis phyi rol gyi don mi mthong ba de la ni bdag med kyi dbang po sems pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba phyi rol gyi don gzhan mthong bas gang gis
translated: But those sense faculties that have mind see external objects that are different from them.

original: mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
translated: Therefore the one who sees is the self.

original: de'i phyir lus la bdag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la bdag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the self definitely exists in the body.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: don mthong ba ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don mthong ba ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not established that seeing objects is the intrinsic reality of the self and because it is not concomitant with the self.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la phyir rol gyi don mthong ba ni dbang po'i chos nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir dang khyed la
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la phyir rol gyi don mthong ba ni dbang po'i chos nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir dang khyed la
translated: In our system, seeing external objects is renowned as the reality of the sense faculties, but it is not established as the reality of the self. Therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause it sees objects,‚Äù is not established.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med de /üîΩbdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med de / bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: And you have no example that illustrates the pervasion of your reason.üîΩThe self alone exists because it sees objects, like so and so.

original: don mthong ba'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: don mthong ba'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyed kyi sgrub pa de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Since you have no example, your proof is not good.

original: lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o zhes phyogs su byed na yang zhes bya bas ni gal te bdag tu smra ba dag lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o zhes phyogs su byed na yang zhes bya bas ni gal te bdag tu smra ba dag lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If you take the position that the body is the self, then the body would be the self.

original: don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes phyogs su byed na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes phyogs su byed na yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: If you take the position that the reason is ‚Äúbecause the object is seen,‚Äù then that is also not good, because there is no pervasion.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that, he says,

original: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚Äúit would be a reason that is not shared.‚Äù

original: de ltar lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te zhes lus thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te zhes lus thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the body is associated with the self, because the entire body is the subject.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don mthong ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro @58b ba'i dpe med pa nyid du 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don mthong ba med pas gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro @58b ba'i dpe med pa nyid du 'gyur bas mi rung ste /
translated: Since there is no seeing of an object that is different from that, there is no example that would illustrate the pervasion of the reason.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la thun mong nyid du khyab par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul gyis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la thun mong nyid du khyab par bya ba yin na /
translated: Thus, a reason is shared in common with both the subject and the similar class by the mode of existence in the similar class and by the mode of existence in the subject.

original: 'dir khyed kyis don mthong ba'i lus thams cad phyogs su byas pas de las gzhan pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir khyed kyis don mthong ba'i lus thams cad phyogs su byas pas de las gzhan pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since you have taken the body that sees objects as the subject, there is no example that is similar to it.

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs don mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, your reason ‚Äúbecause it sees objects‚Äù is not suitable because it is not common to both the subject and the example, and it does not pervade.üîΩThis also replies to the arguments of the proponents of the self, such as ‚Äúbecause the right eye sees and the left eye recognizes, because experience is remembered, and because objects are observed.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya bas ni bdag tu smra ba dag gis rang gi sgrub pa'i mtha' don gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'dis ni g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya bas ni bdag tu smra ba dag gis rang gi sgrub pa'i mtha' don gyi phreng ba zhes bya ba
translated: This is called a garland of arguments refuting the tenets of the proponents of the self.

original: la sogs pa dag las bdag yod pa de nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gang smras pa de dag kyang dbu ma pa'i bsgrub pa snga ma 'dis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: la sogs pa dag las bdag yod pa de nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gang smras pa de dag kyang dbu ma pa'i bsgrub pa snga ma 'dis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and so on, any reason that is stated to prove the existence of the self is refuted by this former proof of the Madhyamikas.

original: de dag 'di ltar bdag yod pa nyid sgrub ste /
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar bdag yod pa nyid sgrub ste /
translated: They prove the existence of the self in the following way.

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: The position is: ‚ÄúThe self exists.‚Äù

original: mig g-yas pas ma thong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: mig g-yas pas ma thong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: The property of the position is: ‚ÄúBecause the left eye sees what the right eye sees.‚ÄùüîΩThus, if the self did not exist, then when the left eye was impaired by disease or closed, the object seen by the right eye would not be seen by the left eye when the disease was cured or the eye was opened.

original: 'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na sngon mig g-yon pa nad kyis nyams pa'am btsums pa'i tshe des mthong ba'i dngos po mig g-yas pas mthong ba gang yin pa phyis mig g-yon pa nad sos sam phye bas mthong ba'i tshe na bdag gis sngon mthong ba
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na sngon mig g-yon pa nad kyis nyams pa'am btsums pa'i tshe des mthong ba'i dngos po mig g-yas pas mthong ba gang yin pa phyis mig g-yon pa nad sos sam phye bas mthong ba'i tshe na bdag gis sngon mthong ba
translated: In that case, when the left eye sees, it would not be able to think, ‚ÄúI saw this before.‚Äù

original: de 'di yin no zhes ngo zhes par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'di yin no zhes ngo zhes par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: sngon mig g-yas pas mthong ba gang yin pa de phyis mig g-yon pas mthong ba'i tshe na yang ngo shes pa'i phyir gang gis de ngo shes pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sngon mig g-yas pas mthong ba gang yin pa de phyis mig g-yon pas mthong ba'i tshe na yang ngo shes pa'i phyir gang gis de ngo shes pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.

original: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.

original: sngon nyams su myong ba da ltar dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba da ltar dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.

original: 'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na /
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.

original: sngon nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin pa de yang dbang pos ma mthong na mi dran pa'i rigs na de lta ma yin te /üîΩsngon @59a * //
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba'i don gang yin pa de yang dbang pos ma mthong na mi dran pa'i rigs na de lta ma yin te / sngon @59a * //
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.üîΩThe self exists because it is the appropriator of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties.

original: nyams su myong ba'i don da ltar dbang pos ma mthong yang dran pa'i phyir gang gis de dran pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i don da ltar dbang pos ma mthong yang dran pa'i phyir gang gis de dran pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The self exists because it is the appropriator of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and objects of mind.

original: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba de ni phyogs yin no //
translated: Likewise, the thesis is ‚Äúthe self exists,‚Äù

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na las 'di ni dge ba'o 'di ni mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba bdag dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phyogs kyi chos yin te / 'di ltar gal te bdag med par gyur na las 'di ni dge ba'o 'di ni mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba bdag dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de lta ma yin te /
translated: and the reason is ‚Äúbecause virtuous and nonvirtuous karma are observed.‚Äù

original: 'di ni las dge ba'o 'di ni las mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni las dge ba'o 'di ni las mi dge ba'o zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: If the self did not exist, it would be impossible to observe ‚Äúthis is virtuous karma‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is nonvirtuous karma.‚ÄùüîΩBut since it is observed,

original: gang gis dmigs pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de dag gi lan kyang de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis dmigs pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de dag gi lan kyang de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: the self exists because it is observed.

original: de dag ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response to that is not good because it is not established that those are the characteristics of the self and they are not concomitant.

original: lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o zhes phyogs su byed na yang gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o zhes phyogs su byed na yang gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te /
translated: If you take the position that the body is the self, then the reason is not established for you, and if you take the position that the body is associated with the self, then the reason is not established for us.üîΩIn our system, the right eye seeing, the left eye recognizing, the experience remembering, the observation of karma, and so on are renowned as the qualities of the sense faculties, but they are not established as the qualities of the self.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mig g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa dang nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / las dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po'i chos nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mig g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa dang nyams su myong ba dran pa dang / las dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po'i chos nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause the right eye sees and the left eye recognizes,‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag ma grub pa'i phyir dang / khyed la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med de /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag ma grub pa'i phyir dang / khyed la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med de /
translated: ‚Äúbecause the experience remembers,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause the observation of karma‚Äù are not established for you, and you have no example that is a concordant case of the reason.

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The self definitely exists.

original: g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir dper na na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa de ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir dper na na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa de ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the right eye sees and the left eye recognizes, because one remembers what one has experienced, and because one observes one‚Äôs actions, just as one says, ‚ÄúI am like so-and-so.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag tu smra ba dag lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu smra ba dag lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If the proponents of a self argue that the body is endowed with a self

original: mig g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyogs su byed na yang /
analyzed: mig g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyogs su byed na yang /
translated: because the right eye sees and the left eye recognizes, because one remembers what one has experienced, and because one observes one‚Äôs actions,

original: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas mi rung ste 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul @59b gyis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la thun mong nyid du khyab par bya ba yin na 'dir khyed kyis lus thams cad phyogs su byas pas de las gzhan pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur bas mi rung ste 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid kyi tshul @59b gyis phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la thun mong nyid du khyab par bya ba yin na 'dir khyed kyis lus thams cad phyogs su byas pas de las gzhan pa phyogs dang mthun pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir
translated: But that is illogical, because the reason would be unshared, for a reason pervades both the subject and the similar class by virtue of existing in the inferential subject and existing in the similar class. But here, since you make the entire body the subject, there is no example that is similar to the subject, which is different from that.

original: khyod kyi gtan tshigs g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong pa dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur pas /
analyzed: khyod kyi gtan tshigs g-yas pas mthong ba g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong pa dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur pas /
translated: Therefore, your reason, ‚Äúbecause the right eye sees and the left eye recognizes, because experience is remembered, and because objects are observed,‚Äù would not be shared by both the subject and the similar class.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, because it does not pervade, it is illogical.

original: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smras pa gzhan gang dag 'di skad smras na bdag nyid gzhan dag la mkhas par grags su re ba'i nga rgyal can dag / bdag ces bya ba'i sgra dang blo yul 'ga' zhig la
analyzed: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smras pa gzhan gang dag 'di skad smras na bdag nyid gzhan dag la mkhas par grags su re ba'i nga rgyal can dag / bdag ces bya ba'i sgra dang blo yul 'ga' zhig la
translated: ‚ÄúOthers who imagine themselves to be scholars‚Äù refers to those who imagine themselves to be scholars and who are renowned to others as proponents of the self.üîΩThey teach two kinds of inferences that prove that the object of the term and the conception ‚Äúself‚Äù is a self that exists as a different object from the aggregates.

original: nye bar btags pa dang / log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya ba'i sgra dang blo de'i yul bdag la dngos po logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa dang / log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya ba'i sgra dang blo de'i yul bdag la dngos po logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: The first is the inference that proves that the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in reference to something else.üîΩThe second is the inference that proves that the conception of self has a referentüîΩThe first is the inference that proves that the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in reference to something else.

original: de la lus la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos su yod de /
analyzed: de la lus la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos su yod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in reference to something else,

original: 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is used in reference to some other object.

original: dper na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i seng ge'i ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de yang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir de ni de las gzhan pa de la dngos su yod pas de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i seng ge'i ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin no // de bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de yang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir de ni de las gzhan pa de la dngos su yod pas de ni bdag yin te /
translated: For example, the term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to a brahman youth, but it is not applied in the same way to other lions that have manes and tufts of hair on their chests.üîΩIn the same way, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is applied to the body, faculties, and mind, but it is applied to some other thing, and that other thing is the self that is the object of the term ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya ba'i sgra yul gzhan 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de'i yul bdag dngos logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya ba'i sgra yul gzhan 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de'i yul bdag dngos logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa
translated: Therefore the self exists. This is an inference that proves that the object of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a self that exists separately from the body, faculties, and mind, using as a reason the fact that the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is applied to some other object.

original: gcig yin te /
analyzed: gcig yin te /
translated: This is one inference.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar pa'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na seng ge zhes bya ba'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul bram ze'i khye'u de las gzhan pa seng ge ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can dngos lags shig na yod pas seng ge zhes bya ba'i sgra de
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar pa'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na seng ge zhes bya ba'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul bram ze'i khye'u de las gzhan pa seng ge ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can dngos lags shig na yod pas seng ge zhes bya ba'i sgra de
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, the example, the application, and the conclusion.üîΩFor example, the term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to a brahmin boy. The object of that application is a real lion with a mane and a tuft on its forehead.

original: ba ma ze'i khye'u'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa @60a * //üîΩtsam du zad de seng ge'i yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
analyzed: ba ma ze'i khye'u'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa @60a * // tsam du zad de seng ge'i yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
translated: The term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to the object of the brahmin boy.üîΩIt is applied to the object of the lion itself.

original: sgra de'i yul seng ge dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sgra de'i yul seng ge dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the object of the term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is a real lion,

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra phung po la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul phung po de las gzhan pa bdag rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can dngos kyang logs shig na yod pas /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra phung po la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul phung po de las gzhan pa bdag rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can dngos kyang logs shig na yod pas /
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a designation imputed to the aggregates. The object of that term, a permanent self that is different from the aggregates and that pervades all of them, and so on, also exists separately.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de phung po'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi bdag gi yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de phung po'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi bdag gi yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is a mere designation imputed to the object of the aggregates, but it directly engages the object of the self.

original: sgra de'i yul bdag dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgra de'i yul bdag dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the object of that term, the self, also definitely exists.

original: yang na bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i yul can yin par nges par shes te /
analyzed: yang na bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i yul can yin par nges par shes te /
translated: Or, the cognition that knows the self is definitely a cognition that has an object that is just as it is.

original: yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a mistaken cognition in regard to another object.

original: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that knows a stump to be a person.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yul la bdag tu shes pa de yang log par shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yul la bdag tu shes pa de yang log par shes pa yin pas /
translated: In the same way, the cognition that knows the object of cause and effect to be a self is a mistaken cognition.

original: de ltar yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul gang la don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa de ni bdag yin te /üîΩde'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo yul gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de yul bdag dngos logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i
analyzed: de ltar yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul gang la don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa de ni bdag yin te / de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo yul gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de yul bdag dngos logs shig na yod par sgrub pa'i
translated: Thus, because the mind that conceives ‚ÄúI‚Äù is mistaken with regard to other objects, the self is the object that is not mistaken with regard to other objects.

original: rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: Therefore the self alone exists. This is the second syllogism that proves that the mind that conceives ‚ÄúI‚Äù exists as a separate object from the self.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug pa sdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug pa sdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, the application of the reason to the subject, and the conclusion.

original: dper na mir shes pa'i blos sdong du ma la log par shes pa gang yin pa de'i yul sdong du ma de las gzhan pa mi sems pa dang bcas pa dngos logs shig na yod pas mir shes pa'i blo de sdong du ma gyi yul la ni nye
analyzed: dper na mir shes pa'i blos sdong du ma la log par shes pa gang yin pa de'i yul sdong du ma de las gzhan pa mi sems pa dang bcas pa dngos logs shig na yod pas mir shes pa'i blo de sdong du ma gyi yul la ni nye
translated: For example, the mind that knows a man is a wrong consciousness in regard to a tree trunk. The object of that wrong consciousness, the tree trunk, is not the mind that thinks of a man. It is a different thing, a tree trunk.

original: bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi mi'i yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
analyzed: bar btags pa tsam du zad kyi mi'i yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
translated: The mind that knows a man is only imputed to the object, the tree trunk. It is not actually engaged in the object, the man.

original: blo de'i yul dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo rgyu dang 'bras bu la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul rgyu dang 'bras bu de las gzhan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa'i bdag
analyzed: blo de'i yul dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo rgyu dang 'bras bu la nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de'i yul rgyu dang 'bras bu de las gzhan pa rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa'i bdag
translated: The actual object of that mind is a man, and it exists. In the same way, the mind that knows what is called a self is imputed to causes and effects. The object of that mind, causes and effects, is not a self that is different from causes and effects.

original: rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can dngos kyang logs shig na yod pas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can dngos kyang logs shig na yod pas /
translated: The self is a different thing, a permanent self that pervades everything and so on.

original: bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad @60b kyi bdag gi yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
analyzed: bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yul la ni nye bar btags pa tsam du zad @60b kyi bdag gi yul la ni dngos su 'jug pas /
translated: The cognition that knows the self is merely nominally imputed to the object that is cause and effect, but it directly engages the object that is the self.

original: blo de'i yul bdag dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: blo de'i yul bdag dngos kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the object of that cognition, the self, also exists in reality.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that statement,

original: 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa / gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the author of the commentary explains here:üîΩIf you assert the self in general without specifying the nature of the self according to your philosophical system, then you are proving what is already established.

original: gal te bdag tu smra ba khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las 'byung ba'i bdag gi ngo bo nyid rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de lta bu nges par ma bzung bar kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du
analyzed: gal te bdag tu smra ba khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las 'byung ba'i bdag gi ngo bo nyid rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa de lta bu nges par ma bzung bar kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du
translated: If you proponents of the self assert the self in general without specifying the nature of the self that arises in your philosophical system, which possesses the attributes of being permanent, omnipresent, and so on, then you are proving what is already established.

original: bdag spyir grags pa yod par dam 'cha' na ni /üîΩgrub pa la sgrub pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag spyir grags pa yod par dam 'cha' na ni / grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas /
translated: If you assert that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù generally refers to what is renowned,üîΩthen your proofs are established by what is to be established.

original: khyed kyi sgrub pa de dag don med par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: khyed kyi sgrub pa de dag don med par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Thus your proofs are pointless.

original: de lta na ji ltar grub pa la sgrub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar grub pa la sgrub pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, how are they established by what is to be established?

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, we say that in our scriptures the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in the sense of consciousness, but in the sense of birth and so on it is a designation.

original: dper na shing rta'i yan lag dag la brten nas shing rtar gdags par 'dod pa de bzhin du phung po la brten nas sems can du gdags par 'dod la /
analyzed: dper na shing rta'i yan lag dag la brten nas shing rtar gdags par 'dod pa de bzhin du phung po la brten nas sems can du gdags par 'dod la /
translated: Just as it is asserted that a chariot is imputed in dependence on its parts, so it is asserted that a sentient being is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Consciousness is called the self because it takes up the existence of rebirth.

original: ci ste sems ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste sems ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that the mind is not the actual referent of the term self, but is the actual referent of the mind that knows the self,üîΩthen it is said that it is not, because it is produced, like the body.

original: byas pa'i phyir dper na lus bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gong du dbu ma pas 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dper na lus bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gong du dbu ma pas 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
translated: This is a passage from above, where the Madhyamika explained that in our scriptures the term self is the actual referent of consciousness,üîΩbut with regard to arising and so on, it is a reification.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin te zhes bshad pa'i skabs de la 'dir bdag tu smra ba dag bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag logs
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin te zhes bshad pa'i skabs de la 'dir bdag tu smra ba dag bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag logs
translated: Here, the proponents of a self argue that the term self is not the actual referent of consciousness, but is the actual referent of a self that is different from consciousness.

original: shig na dngos su yod pa nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: shig na dngos su yod pa nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a passage that proves that the self is the actual referent of the term self.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na lus ni byas pa'i phyir bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du @61a * //
analyzed: dper na lus ni byas pa'i phyir bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du @61a * //
translated: For example, the body is not the actual referent of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù and is not the actual referent of the cognition that knows ‚Äúself,‚Äù because it is produced.

original: sems pa yang byas pa'i phyir bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems pa yang byas pa'i phyir bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, the mind is not the actual referent of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù and is not the actual referent of the cognition that knows ‚Äúself,‚Äù because it is produced.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis //
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir gal te pha rol po dag don dam par sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te pha rol po dag don dam par sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te
translated: Here, if the opponent is demonstrating that ultimately the mind is not the actual referent of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù and is not the actual referent of the cognition that knows ‚Äúself,‚Äù then this is establishing what is already established.

original: / bdag tu smra ba rnam pa thams cad kyang thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgal te pha rol po dag gi sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de don dam par de ltar ston par byed na ni grub pa
analyzed: / bdag tu smra ba rnam pa thams cad kyang thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / gal te pha rol po dag gi sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de don dam par de ltar ston par byed na ni grub pa
translated: Because we Madhyamikas want to eliminate all forms of the belief in a self in every way.

original: la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ste /
translated: If you are proving what is already established for us, then your argument is not correct.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pas yang bdag tu lta ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam pa thams cad kyang lus sam rnam par shes pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pas yang bdag tu lta ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam pa thams cad kyang lus sam rnam par shes pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we Madhyamikas want to eliminate all forms of the belief in a self, whether it is permanent or impermanent, in every way.

original: 'on te tha snyad du na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad du na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you are proving this conventionally, then your argument is not correct.

original: sgra dang blo'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dag tha snyad du 'dod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sgra dang blo'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dag tha snyad du 'dod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Because the ascertainment of the term and the thing, and the ascertainment of the mind and the thing, are established in one‚Äôs own tenets, and are also established in the tenets of others, and because they are asserted for the sake of conventional expression.

original: 'on te pha rol po dag gi sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de tha snyad du de ltar ston par byed na ni de
analyzed: 'on te pha rol po dag gi sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de'i spyod yul dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes dam bcas pa de tha snyad du de ltar ston par byed na ni de
translated: If you are demonstrating that the opponent‚Äôs assertion, ‚ÄúThe referent object of the term ‚Äòself‚Äô and the referent object of the cognition that knows ‚Äòself‚Äô are not the same,‚Äù is so only conventionally, then that

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sgra'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa dang blo'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dang / yang gi sgras gzhan gyi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dag tha snyad du 'dod pas tha snyad gdags pa'i don du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa dang blo'i btags pa dang dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dang / yang gi sgras gzhan gyi grub pa'i mthar yang grub pa dag tha snyad du 'dod pas tha snyad gdags pa'i don du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ascertainment of the term and the thing, and the ascertainment of the mind and the thing, are established in one‚Äôs own tenets, and because the ascertainment of the term and the thing, and the ascertainment of the mind and the thing, are also established in the tenets of others, and because they are asserted for the sake of conventional expression, and because they are asserted for the sake of conventional designation.

original: de lta bas na kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na kho bo cag gi lung las kyang bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
translated: Therefore, in our scriptures, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in the sense of consciousness, and

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin par grub pas /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar brtags pa yin par grub pas /
translated: it is established that the terms ‚Äúarising,‚Äù etc., are imputations.

original: khyed gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyed gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert a self in general, without specifying its nature in accordance with your philosophical tenets, then that is unacceptable, since it would be establishing what is already established.

original: don dam par na ni bdag gi sgra yang bdag la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par na ni bdag gi sgra yang bdag la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: But if you assert a self in the ultimate sense, then the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is not established as an actual entity.

original: seng @61b ge'i sgrar 'jug pa'i don kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: seng @61b ge'i sgrar 'jug pa'i don kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is also imputedly existent, and the term ‚Äúlion‚Äù is not used in accordance with its meaning in that context.

original: sngar pha rol po dag na re bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de las gzhan pa bdag la dngos su yod de /
analyzed: sngar pha rol po dag na re bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de las gzhan pa bdag la dngos su yod de /
translated: Previously, the opponent said, ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòself‚Äô is imputed to the body, faculties, and mind, but the self that exists in reality is something other than that.üîΩFor example, the term ‚Äòlion‚Äô is imputed to a young brahman, but the lion with a mane and a tuft of hair on its chest is seen to be the actual referent of the term.‚Äù

original: dper na seng ge'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa yang de las gzhan pa seng ge'i ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa dang dpe de dag mi 'grub par
analyzed: dper na seng ge'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa yang de las gzhan pa seng ge'i ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa dang dpe de dag mi 'grub par
translated: We now demonstrate that the example and the proof are not established.

original: ston te / 'di ltar bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pas yul de la dngos su yod par ma grub pa de bzhin du de las gzhan bdag la yang dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste
analyzed: ston te / 'di ltar bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de lus dang dbang po dang blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pas yul de la dngos su yod par ma grub pa de bzhin du de las gzhan bdag la yang dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste
translated: The term ‚Äúself‚Äù is imputed to the body, faculties, and mind. The self that exists in reality is not established as the referent of that term. In the same way, the self that is something other than that is also not established as the referent of that term.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: seng ge'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa de las gzhan pa seng ge nyid la yod par brjod pa'i don seng ge nyid kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi gdags par yod pa'i phyir seng ge'i yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang donüîΩji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra bram ze'i khye'u la nye bar btags pa de las gzhan pa seng ge nyid la yod par brjod pa'i don seng ge nyid kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi gdags par yod pa'i phyir seng ge'i yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of the term lion itself is also not the object of the term lion, because it is not as it is in reality.

original: des na ji ltar seng ge'i sgrar brjod pa'i don seng ge nyid btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar seng ge'i sgrar brjod pa'i don seng ge nyid btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the meaning of the term lion is imputedly existent, the meaning of the term lion is not as it is in reality.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i don bdag nyid kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la bdag gi sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i don bdag nyid kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la bdag gi sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: Just as the meaning of the term self is imputedly existent, the meaning of the term self is not as it is in reality.

original: yang na sgra gang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na sgra gang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, any term imputed to something is seen to exist in the collection because it is imputed to the collection.

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin pas /
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin pas /
translated: Because of the words ‚Äúlion‚Äù and so on.

original: des na bdag gi sgra 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des na dam bcas pa la chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: des na bdag gi sgra 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des na dam bcas pa la chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Therefore, since the word ‚Äúself‚Äù directly excludes actual existence, the fault of the thesis being vitiated by the property of the subject is incurred.

original: sngar pha rol po dag gis bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos su yod de zhes bya ba'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras pa'i don 'gal ba nyid du ston
analyzed: sngar pha rol po dag gis bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos su yod de zhes bya ba'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras pa'i don 'gal ba nyid du ston
translated: This demonstrates the contradiction in the earlier statement by the opponent that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is a term that directly exists in relation to another object, because it is applied to some property that is to be proven.

original: te / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: te / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The subject, the probandum, the property that proves it, the example, the application, and the conclusion are to be applied in order.

original: dper na seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra @62a * //
analyzed: dper na seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra @62a * //
translated: For example, the words ‚Äúlion‚Äù and so on.

original: ni spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir seng ge sder mo dang mche ba rnam par 'gyur ba dang dam bsdur rngam pa dang ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa dang mjug ma ldang du gzar ba dag gis 'jigs su rung ba 'dus pa la yod par mthong
analyzed: ni spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir seng ge sder mo dang mche ba rnam par 'gyur ba dang dam bsdur rngam pa dang ral pa dang ze ba spungs pa dang mjug ma ldang du gzar ba dag gis 'jigs su rung ba 'dus pa la yod par mthong
translated: Because the word ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to a class, it is seen to exist in a collection of things that have a mane, claws, fangs, a gaping mouth, bared teeth, a bristling mane, a tufted tail, and a raised tail.

original: bas 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bas 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is not applied to any one of them.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de yang spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir lus dang dbang po dang blo 'dus pa la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin par /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra de yang spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir lus dang dbang po dang blo 'dus pa la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin par /
translated: In the same way, because the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is applied to a class, it is seen to exist in a collection of things that are the body, the senses, and the mind. It is not applied to any one of them.

original: des pha rol po dag bdag gi sgra bdag gcig pu 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod par 'dod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des ni pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa la chos can bdag gi sgra'i chos kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la
analyzed: des pha rol po dag bdag gi sgra bdag gcig pu 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod par 'dod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des ni pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa la chos can bdag gi sgra'i chos kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la
translated: Since this refutes the assertion of the opponent that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù exists in reality in a self that is not a collection of things, it follows that the opponent‚Äôs thesis is that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is a quality of the subject, a self, and that it is a quality that is not shared by other phenomena.

original: nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
translated: The fault of being a mere designation is eliminated.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra spyi la nye bar btags pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpes 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra spyi la nye bar btags pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpes 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a reason that is a mere designation, it is contradictory to the example of the reason that is a mere designation of the word ‚Äúlion‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra gcig pu 'ga' zhig la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra gcig pu 'ga' zhig la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is not established as a mere single thing.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs 'dus pa spyi la nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad pas lus dang dbang po dang blo 'dus pa dag las gzhan pa bdag gcig pu'i yul dngos logs shig na med do zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs 'dus pa spyi la nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad pas lus dang dbang po dang blo 'dus pa dag las gzhan pa bdag gcig pu'i yul dngos logs shig na med do zhes bstan to ;
translated: It is merely a designation for the collection of the body, the sense faculties, and the mind. Therefore, other than the collection of the body, the sense faculties, and the mind, there is no separate object of the single self.

original: / des blo'i phyogs la yang skyon gyis lan btab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / des blo'i phyogs la yang skyon gyis lan btab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The response with the fault of the mind is as follows.

original: sgra gang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa des blo'i phyogs la yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba'i skyon yodüîΩpar bstan to //
analyzed: sgra gang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa des blo'i phyogs la yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba'i skyon yod par bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is a consciousness that is mistaken with regard to some other thing‚Äù is contradictory.

original: de yang blo gang yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: de yang blo gang yang gzhan 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the consciousness that is mistaken with regard to some other thing is seen to exist in the collection.

original: spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a consciousness that is mistaken with regard to a universal.

original: sdong dum la sogs pa la log par shes pa'i blo bzhin pas /
analyzed: sdong dum la sogs pa la log par shes pa'i blo bzhin pas /
translated: It is like the consciousness that is mistaken with regard to a stump and so on.

original: des bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas /
analyzed: des bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that cognizes what is called ‚Äúself‚Äù excludes the existence of the collection.

original: des na dam bcas pa la chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: des na dam bcas pa la chos kyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, the fault of the thesis being vitiated by the property of the subject is committed.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example, the application, and the conclusion.

original: 'di ni sdong dum @62b la mir shes pa la sogs pa'i blo ni spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni sdong dum @62b la mir shes pa la sogs pa'i blo ni spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of a stump as a man and so on is a mistaken cognition with regard to a universal.

original: sdong dum kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa 'dus pa la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de yang spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dus pa
analyzed: sdong dum kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa 'dus pa la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo de yang spyi la log par shes pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dus pa
translated: But the cognition of a stump as a man is not a mistaken cognition with regard to some particular, since it is seen to exist in the collection of the stump's color, shape and so on. Likewise, the cognition that thinks I is a mistaken cognition with regard to a universal.

original: la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa ma yin pas des pha rol po bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo bdag gcig pu 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod par 'dod pa nyid sel bar byed pas /
analyzed: la yod par mthong bas 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa ma yin pas des pha rol po bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo bdag gcig pu 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod par 'dod pa nyid sel bar byed pas /
translated: Since it is seen to exist in the collection of causes and effects, it is not a mistaken cognition with regard to some particular. Therefore, since it eliminates the assertion that the cognition that thinks I is a cognition of a self that is not a collection of causes and effects,üîΩit is a mistaken cognition with regard to a universal.

original: des na pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i chos kyi khyad par yul 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: des na pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i chos kyi khyad par yul 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
translated: Therefore, the subject of the opponent‚Äôs thesis is flawed in that it is a cognition that is mistaken with regard to some objects, a cognition that is called ‚Äúthe awareness that knows the self.‚Äù

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs yul 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sdong dum la mir shes pa'i blo spyi la log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs yul 'ga' zhig la log par shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sdong dum la mir shes pa'i blo spyi la log par shes pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause it is a cognition that is mistaken with regard to some objects,‚Äù is a reason that is contradictory to the example, ‚Äúthe cognition that knows a stump to be a man.‚Äù

original: bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo bdag gcig pu 'ga' zhig la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo bdag gcig pu 'ga' zhig la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: The cognition that is called ‚Äúthe awareness that knows the self‚Äù is not established as an actual cognition that exists with regard to some single self.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs 'dus pa spyi la log par shes pa tsam du zad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dus pa dag las gzhan pa bdag gcig pu'i yul dngos logs shig na med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshogs 'dus pa spyi la log par shes pa tsam du zad pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dus pa dag las gzhan pa bdag gcig pu'i yul dngos logs shig na med do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is merely a mistaken cognition with regard to the collection of causes and effects. Therefore, apart from the collection of causes and effects, there is no other object that is a single self.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say:

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The existence of consciousness is the very essence of a person.

original: de yang smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas kho bo cag gis de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de yang smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas kho bo cag gis de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: Since this is something that all proponents of philosophical systems accept, we do not offer a formal syllogistic reasoning to prove that it exists.

original: 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: However, we do explain its specific attributes, such as being the experiencer.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las /
translated: In this regard, some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say:

original: kha cig shes pa yod pa nyid //
analyzed: kha cig shes pa yod pa nyid //
translated: The existence of consciousness

original: ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: is the very essence of a person.

original: de ni bdag yin pas bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
analyzed: de ni bdag yin pas bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin te /
translated: Since that is the self, the self certainly exists.

original: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin la ;
analyzed: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin la ;
translated: They say that in our scriptures the phrase ‚Äúthe existence of consciousness‚Äù refers to the very essence of a person.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa ni rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni za ba po yin te /
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa ni rang bzhin yin pas rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni za ba po yin te /
translated: The three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas are in equal proportion in prakriti, and so prakriti is the creator and purusha is the experiencer.

original: long ba dang grum po bzhin no zhes 'byung bas shes pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: long ba dang grum po bzhin no zhes 'byung bas shes pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: This is like a blind man and a cripple going somewhere together.

original: yang bdag tu smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin @63a * //
analyzed: yang bdag tu smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin @63a * //
translated: Since this is accepted by all proponents of a self,üîΩwe do not

original: pas kho bo cag gis /üîΩde yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: pas kho bo cag gis / de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: assertüîΩthat consciousness exists.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not make an inference to prove that it exists because it would be a fault to prove what is already established.

original: 'di ltar shes pa yod pa nyid de'i khyad par za ba po nyid dang rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba nyid dang yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag pha rol po dag la ma grags pa de dag 'dir bstan par bya'o zhes zer
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa yod pa nyid de'i khyad par za ba po nyid dang rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba nyid dang yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag pha rol po dag la ma grags pa de dag 'dir bstan par bya'o zhes zer
translated: Thus consciousness exists, and its attributes such as being the experiencer, being permanent, pervading everything, and being indifferent are not accepted by others, so we will teach them here.

original: ro // de'i phyir gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni don gcig la shes pa ni blo yin pas de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ro // de'i phyir gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni don gcig la shes pa ni blo yin pas de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, if others say, ‚ÄúThe existence of consciousness is one thing, but consciousness is the mind, therefore the existence of consciousness is not the nature of the person,‚Äù

original: de ni grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúIn our scriptures the existence of consciousness is the nature of the person.

original: blo ma yin no zhes bya ba de sangs rgyas pa dag la sogs pa'i gzhung la ma grags pas /
analyzed: blo ma yin no zhes bya ba de sangs rgyas pa dag la sogs pa'i gzhung la ma grags pas /
translated: It is not the mind.‚Äù Since this is not renowned in the scriptures of the Buddhists and so on,

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag la sogs pa gzhan dag skyes bu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med par sems shing de skad ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag la sogs pa gzhan dag skyes bu zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med par sems shing de skad ces zer na /
translated: if others, such as the Buddhists, think that the nature called a person does not exist and say this,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: that is not logical.

original: de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is illogical, he says,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not the existence of consciousness.

original: skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: des ni blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ston te ;
analyzed: des ni blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ston te ;
translated: This is the proof that the mind does not exist as consciousness.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na bum pa ni skye ba'i phyir /üîΩshes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni skye ba'i phyir / shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pot, because it arises,üîΩdoes not exist as consciousness.

original: blo yang skye ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: blo yang skye ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the mind, because it arises, does not exist as consciousness.

original: de bzhin du dag par bya ba nyid dang / spag par bya ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dag par bya ba nyid dang / spag par bya ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because of being purified, being cleansed, being benefited, and so on,

original: dper na hvags la sogs pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: dper na hvags la sogs pa bzhin pas /
translated: for example, like grass and so on,

original: de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: therefore the mind does not exist as consciousness.

original: bsgrub pa snga ma de'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa snga ma de'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar te /
translated: The previous proof, its reason, and example are also to be applied to this.

original: dper na hvags la sogs pa ni dri ma dag par bya ba nyid dang / dri mas spag par bya ba nyid dang / byi dor bya ba la sogs pas phan gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na hvags la sogs pa ni dri ma dag par bya ba nyid dang / dri mas spag par bya ba nyid dang / byi dor bya ba la sogs pas phan gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
