translated: For example, a broom and so on are not consciousness because they are used to clean dirt, they are used to remove dirt, and they are used to benefit by sweeping and so on.

original: blo yang dri ma dag par bya ba nyid dang / dri mas spag par bya ba nyid dang / sbyang ba la sogs pas phan gdags par bya ba @63b nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: blo yang dri ma dag par bya ba nyid dang / dri mas spag par bya ba nyid dang / sbyang ba la sogs pas phan gdags par bya ba @63b nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Likewise, the mind is not consciousness because it is used to clean dirt, it is used to remove dirt, and it is used to benefit by training and so on.

original: de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the mind is not consciousness.

original: de'i shes pa nyid de ni longs spyod par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas des ni za ba po nyid yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa nyid de ni longs spyod par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas des ni za ba po nyid yin par grub ste /
translated: Since that consciousness is not included among the objects of enjoyment, it is established that it is the experiencer.

original: bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba de sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag 'dod pa ltar blo'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba de sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag 'dod pa ltar blo'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The existent consciousness and so on are not the nature of the intellect as the Buddhists and so on assert.

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: They are the nature of the person.

original: de ni snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin long ba ltar longs spyod par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas de ni grum po ltar za ba po nyid yin par grub te /
analyzed: de ni snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin long ba ltar longs spyod par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas de ni grum po ltar za ba po nyid yin par grub te /
translated: Therefore, since the existent consciousness is not included among the objects of enjoyment, like a blind person who has the nature of sattva, rajas and tamas, it is established that it is the enjoyer, like a cripple.

original: de'i ming gi rnam grangs ni shes pa yod pa nyid dang skyes bu dang za ba po dang bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i ming gi rnam grangs ni shes pa yod pa nyid dang skyes bu dang za ba po dang bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The synonyms of that are the existent consciousness, the person, the enjoyer, the self and the knower of the field.

original: shes bya'i zhing thams cad du mngon sum du shes pas zhing shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i zhing thams cad du mngon sum du shes pas zhing shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the knower of the field because it directly knows all fields of objects of knowledge.

original: de'i khyad par ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Its attributes are permanence, omnipresence, and indifference.

original: sngar grangs can dag gis 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes dam bcas pa'i skabs nyid bstan te /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes dam bcas pa'i skabs nyid bstan te /
translated: This passage indicates the context of the earlier promise to teach the attributes of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs self, such as being the experiencer.

original: shes pa yod pa nyid de ni mi 'gyur bas rtag pa yang yin /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid de ni mi 'gyur bas rtag pa yang yin /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the existence of consciousness is unchanging, so it is permanent.

original: khyab bdag yin pas thams cad du song ba nyid kyang yin /
analyzed: khyab bdag yin pas thams cad du song ba nyid kyang yin /
translated: Since it is the all-pervading lord, it is omnipresent.

original: byed pa po ma yin pas yal bar 'dor ba nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pas yal bar 'dor ba nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not an agent, it is indifferent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir bdag gis shes pa yod pa nyid dang thams cad du song ba nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa smras zin pas de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar smras te /
analyzed: de la 'dir bdag gis shes pa yod pa nyid dang thams cad du song ba nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa smras zin pas de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya bar smras te /
translated: Here I have already refuted the existence of consciousness, its omnipresence, its being the experiencer, and so on. Therefore this is not good.

original: de ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa /
analyzed: de ni sngar grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa /
translated: Previously, the Enumerators said that the self is not different from the effect and the cause,üîΩit is not an agent, it is not an experiencer, it is pure, it pervades everything, it is unchanging, and it is conscious.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa dang / za ba po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de dgag pa'i skabs gong du rgya cher smras zin pas /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa dang / za ba po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing zhes bya ba de dgag pa'i skabs gong du rgya cher smras zin pas /
translated: Since this was extensively refuted above,

original: sgrub pa de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: that proof is not good.üîΩSince the statement ‚ÄúThe mind does not exist as consciousness‚Äù is a thesis, the question ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of that thesis?‚Äù

original: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i dam bcas pa'i don gang yin zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni shes pa dang don gcig la @64a * //
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i dam bcas pa'i don gang yin zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni shes pa dang don gcig la @64a * //
translated: is asked. Previously, the Enumerators said, ‚ÄúIf others say, ‚ÄòThe existence of consciousness is synonymous with consciousness.

original: shes pa ni blo yin pas de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: shes pa ni blo yin pas de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Since consciousness is the mind, therefore the existence of consciousness is not the nature of the person,‚Äô

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to //üîΩgal te dam bcas pa de'i don sems pa med pa'am /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa ston to // gal te dam bcas pa de'i don sems pa med pa'am /
translated: The meaning of the thesis ‚ÄúThe mind does not exist‚Äù is being examined.üîΩIf the meaning of the thesis is that the mind is not conscious,

original: shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: or that the mind is not the capacity for consciousness,üîΩthen the opponent‚Äôs thesis is undermined.

original: phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don blo la sems pa gtan med pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhes bya ba ni gal te dam bcas pa de'i don blo la sems pa gtan med pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: If the meaning of the thesis is that the mind is not conscious at all,

original: blo la shes pa yod pa nyid gsal ba'i dngos por ni med la shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: blo la shes pa yod pa nyid gsal ba'i dngos por ni med la shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ni /
translated: or that the mind is not the entity that is clear and conscious, or that the mind is not the capacity for consciousness,

original: phyogs snga ma la gnod pas mi rung ste /üîΩ'di ltar khyed nyid kyi grub pa'i mtha' las blo la sems pa gtan med par yang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la gnod pas mi rung ste / 'di ltar khyed nyid kyi grub pa'i mtha' las blo la sems pa gtan med par yang mi 'dod la /
translated: then the opponent‚Äôs thesis is undermined.üîΩThis is unacceptable because, according to your own tenets, you do not assert that the mind is not conscious at all,

original: shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa blo la yod par yang mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa blo la yod par yang mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and you do not assert that the mind is the capacity for consciousness.

original: gal te sems pa las gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: gal te sems pa las gzhan zhig yin no zhe na yang /
translated: But if you say it is different from intention,

original: gang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de gang yin te de yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de gang yin te de yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is that from which it is different?

original: gal te dam bcas pa de'i don sems pa las blo gzhan zhig yin pas blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa de'i don sems pa las blo gzhan zhig yin pas blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhe na yang /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe meaning of that thesis is that the mind is not consciousness because it is different from intention,‚Äù

original: gang las blo gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i sems pa de gang yin te /
analyzed: gang las blo gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i sems pa de gang yin te /
translated: what is that intention from which the mind is different?

original: sems pa de yang med pas de las blo gzhan zhig yin no zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems pa de yang med pas de las blo gzhan zhig yin no zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since that intention does not exist, it is not tenable to say that the mind is different from it.

original: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: In that case, your thesis is not established.

original: dam bcas pa la brten pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la brten pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The error in your thesis is that it is not established in dependence on that.

original: de ltar sems pa de ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems pa de ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, since that intention is not established,

original: khyed kyis dam bcas pa la sems pa las blo gzhan yin par bsgrub pa brten pa de ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: khyed kyis dam bcas pa la sems pa las blo gzhan yin par bsgrub pa brten pa de ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas /
translated: the error in your thesis is that it is not established in dependence on that.

original: khyed kyi blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te ;
analyzed: khyed kyi blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te ;
translated: You say, ‚ÄúThe mind is not consciousness.‚Äù

original: zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs ma grub po //
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs ma grub po //
translated: Thus the proposition is not established.

original: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang gang yin zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang gang yin zhes bya bas ni /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it arises‚Äù?

original: sngar grangs can dag gis blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos skye ba'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang gang yin zhes brtag pa ston te /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos skye ba'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don yang gang yin zhes brtag pa ston te /
translated: This shows that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs earlier statement, ‚ÄúThe mind does not exist,‚Äù is a proposition that is not established. The reason they state, ‚Äúbecause it arises,‚Äù is also being analyzed: what is the meaning of that reason?

original: gal te ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni rang la gtan tshigs ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni rang la gtan tshigs ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause it arises from what did not previously exist,‚Äù then the reason is not established for you.

original: gal te gtan tshigs de'i don dngos po rnams sngon ma byung ba las phyis byung ba'i phyir skye ba zhes pa'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs de'i don dngos po rnams sngon ma byung ba las phyis byung ba'i phyir skye ba zhes pa'o zhe na ni /
translated: If the meaning of that reason is that things arise because they arise from what did not previously exist,

original: rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not suitable because the reason is not established for you.

original: 'di ltar khyed @64b grangs can dag 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i phyogs la ma byung ba las 'byung ba yin par mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed @64b grangs can dag 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i phyogs la ma byung ba las 'byung ba yin par mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub po //
translated: In this way, in the position of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya who advocates that the effect exists prior to the cause, since you do not assert that arising from what has not occurred, any of the reasons are not established.

original: gal te rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
analyzed: gal te rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
translated: If you say that although the reason is not established for you, it teaches the meaning that is asserted,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: like a phenomenon that is renowned to both parties because it is established for the opponent,

original: grangs can dag skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang la ma grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: grangs can dag skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rang la ma grub tu zin kyang /
translated: then the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúAlthough the reason ‚Äòbecause of arising‚Äô is not established for us because it is arising from what has not occurred,

original: des blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus so zhes gzhung 'jug pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: des blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus so zhes gzhung 'jug pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: it is able to teach the meaning that is asserted, ‚Äòthe mind is not consciousness that exists,‚Äô and thus it is able to teach the valid cognition that engages the treatise.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phyogs la sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phyogs la sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, the logical reason ‚Äúarising from the exertion of the two‚Äù is known to both parties, and it proves the predicate of the probandum ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù to the opponent.

original: des sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus pa de bzhin du ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rang la ma grub pa yang gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus pa de bzhin du ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rang la ma grub pa yang gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the logical reason ‚Äúarising from what is not yet arisen‚Äù is not established for us, but it proves the predicate of the probandum ‚Äúthe mind does not exist‚Äù to the opponent.

original: des kyang blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des kyang blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i don ston par nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus it is able to demonstrate the meaning of the thesis ‚Äúthe mind does not exist.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says here that the property of the subject known only to the opponent

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
translated: The meaning of the reason is definitely ascertained as unable to establish the object to be established.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not established for either party.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang ma grub pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang ma grub pa bzhin pas /
translated: It is just like the nonestablishment for the opponent.

original: blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to reverse the contradictory inference that demonstrates the nonexistence of the cognition of the mind, it is said that the meaning of the reason is not damaged by nonestablishment.

original: des ni sngar grangs can dag gis rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan gyi phyogs la sgrub pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma ston te
analyzed: des ni sngar grangs can dag gis rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs de sgrub pa'i chos gzhan gyi phyogs la sgrub pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i tshad ma ston te
translated: This demonstrates the valid cognition that refutes the reason stated by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya earlier, ‚ÄúThe reason is not established for us, but it does demonstrate the object to be proven.‚Äù

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, the example, the application of the example, and the conclusion.

original: dper na bsal ba smra ba gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang @65a * //
analyzed: dper na bsal ba smra ba gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang @65a * //
translated: For example, ‚Äúbecause the other party‚Äôs position is not established‚Äù is a reason that is not established for either party.

original: yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir des bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir des bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that the meaning to be proven, ‚Äúsound is impermanent,‚Äù cannot be proven.üîΩSimilarly, ‚Äúbecause the property of the subject does not occur in the other party‚Äôs position alone‚Äù is also a reason that is not established for either party.

original: sangs rgyas pa gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i don blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid na yin teüîΩzhes bya ba sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i don blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid na yin teüîΩzhes bya ba sgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that the meaning to be proven, ‚Äúthe mind exists when there is consciousness,‚Äù cannot be proven.

original: des na grangs can dag gi blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa de 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pas bzlog pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid
analyzed: des na grangs can dag gi blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa de 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pas bzlog pa'i phyir grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid
translated: Therefore, because the inference that demonstrates that the cognition of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is not an existent consciousness is refuted by the irreproachable contradiction, the meaning of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause of arising,‚Äù is not established.

original: nyams pa med do //
analyzed: nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason is not undermined.

original: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause of arising,‚Äù is conceived to be manifestation,

original: sngar grangs can dag gis blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs kyi chos skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog cing 'di skad ces /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i phyogs kyi chos skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog cing 'di skad ces /
translated: then the SƒÅ·πÉkhya previously asserted that the position, ‚Äúcognition is not an existent consciousness,‚Äù has the property of the subject, ‚Äúbecause of arising.‚Äù The meaning of that reason is conceived to be manifestation.

original: dper na bum pa ni gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pot is not an existent consciousness because it is something that is manifested.

original: blo yang gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya bar rtog na'o //
analyzed: blo yang gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya bar rtog na'o //
translated: because the mind is also illuminated.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe la sgrub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe la sgrub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: But even so, there is the fault that the meaning of the reason is not established and the example does not have the property to be proven.

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there the fault that the meaning of the reason is not established?

original: gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the refutation of manifestation has already been stated.

original: dbu ma pas grangs can dag gi gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir de dag gi gtan tshigs gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbu ma pas grangs can dag gi gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir de dag gi gtan tshigs gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Because the MƒÅdhyamika has already stated the refutation of manifestation of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the meaning of their reason, because of manifestation, is not established.

original: ji ltar dpe la grub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dpe la grub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there the fault that the example does not have the property to be proven?

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa'i chos gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de med de /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la sgrub pa'i chos gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de med de /
translated: In the example, ‚ÄúIt is like a pot,‚Äù the property to be proven, because of manifestation, does not exist.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni bya ba yin gyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni bya ba yin gyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, a vase is an action, but it is not that which is clarified.

original: rigs pa la mi mkhas pa kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: rigs pa la mi mkhas pa kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some who are unskilled in reasoning say,

original: phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body that is the fivefold skandhas and the sense organs is not the uncommon cause of the observation of the self.‚Äù

original: bdag khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: bdag khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas /
translated: Since it is not logical to state a proof that refutes its attributes without accepting the self,üîΩ‚ÄúYou who assert the self are undermined.‚Äù

original: bdag la spong ba khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @65b sngar dbu ma pas yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la spong ba khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @65b sngar dbu ma pas yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
translated: The MƒÅdhyamika should state another syllogism:

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body that is the fivefold skandhas and the sense organs is not the uncommon cause of the observation of the meaning of the words that is permanent and all-pervading,

original: dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes smras pa de la /
translated: because it is observed, just as, for example, a pillar is.‚Äù

original: 'dir mu stegs rigs pa can rigs pa pa la mi mkhas pa dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dir mu stegs rigs pa can rigs pa pa la mi mkhas pa dag 'di skad ces /
translated: Here, the tƒ´rthikas who are logicians say this:

original: khyed kyis de skad smras pa de ni khyad par gyi gzhi bdag yod par khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ni phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ma yin no zhes dgag
analyzed: khyed kyis de skad smras pa de ni khyad par gyi gzhi bdag yod par khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ni phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ma yin no zhes dgag
translated: ‚ÄúWhat you say is illogical. It is illogical to state a proof that refutes the following: ‚ÄòWithout accepting the existence of the self as the basis of the distinction, the self is not the cause of the observation of objects that is not shared with the five aggregates and the body that possesses the sense faculties.‚Äô

original: pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas des na khyed dbu ma pas kyang bdag yod par khas blangs pa yin pas de lta na bdag la sdang ba khyed kyis bdag med par khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //üîΩde skad ces zer ba'i lan du /
analyzed: pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas des na khyed dbu ma pas kyang bdag yod par khas blangs pa yin pas de lta na bdag la sdang ba khyed kyis bdag med par khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no // de skad ces zer ba'i lan du /
translated: Therefore, since you MƒÅdhyamikas also accept the self, in that case, you who hate the self are undermined by your acceptance of selflessness.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says the following.

original: de la 'dir tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir khas blangs nas gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag gsal bas tha snyad du gzhan gyis btags
analyzed: de la 'dir tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir khas blangs nas gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag gsal bas tha snyad du gzhan gyis btags
translated: Here, having accepted the self in general through the power of convention, the self that is imputed by others, such as being permanent, all-pervading, an agent, and an experiencer, is empty.

original: pa'i bdag stong pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir dang / don dam par ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ston pas tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pa'i bdag stong pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir dang / don dam par ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ston pas tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: This is taught by the example of the pot. Since all phenomena are taught to be emptiness ultimately, it is not the case that the mere features of the self that is imputed by others cannot be eliminated conventionally.

original: de'i phyir de ni nam mkha' ldang du zad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni nam mkha' ldang du zad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore this is just like the sky-flower.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pas don dam par ni bdag gi khyad par thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du bstan la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir smras pa khas blangs nas gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang thams
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pas don dam par ni bdag gi khyad par thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du bstan la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir smras pa khas blangs nas gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang thams
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way teach that ultimately all features of the self are empty. Conventionally, we accept the self as a general category and then refute the specific qualities of the self that are imputed by others. We refute the self‚Äôs permanence, its pervasiveness, its being the agent and experiencer,

original: cad du song ba dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid dang / bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di yin par 'dod pa sel bar byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: cad du song ba dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid dang / bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa phung po lnga dang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di yin par 'dod pa sel bar byed pa yin pas /
translated: and the assertion that the body, with its five aggregates and sense organs, is the unique object-possessor that is the cause of the self‚Äôs perception of objects.

original: tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Since we do not refute the mere self conventionally, our position is not undermined.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa can dag gi chos de ni nam mkha' ldang ba dang 'dra'o //üîΩphyir rgol ba dag na re /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa can dag gi chos de ni nam mkha' ldang ba dang 'dra'o // phyir rgol ba dag na re /
translated: Therefore the self of the Enumerators is like a sky-flower.

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: The counterparts may say, ‚ÄúThe self definitely exists because it is refuted in some contexts.‚Äù

original: 'di na @66a * //
analyzed: 'di na @66a * //
translated: Here,

original: khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because the absence of water in a well is refuted in the well, one knows that water exists elsewhere.

original: de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag med do zhes lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa yod pas gzhan la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa'i phyir dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag med do zhes lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa yod pas gzhan la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: In the same way, because the self is refuted in the body, faculties, and mind, the self does not exist in the body, faculties, and mind. Since the self is refuted in the body, faculties, and mind, the self exists elsewhere.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Therefore some proponents of the self say, ‚ÄúThe self definitely exists.‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra ba kha cig na re dbu ma pas lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs dag gi yul kha cig tu bdag bkag pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bdag gi yul nyid la ni bdag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba kha cig na re dbu ma pas lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs dag gi yul kha cig tu bdag bkag pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bdag gi yul nyid la ni bdag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te
translated: This is the statement of some proponents of the self who say, ‚ÄúSince the self is refuted in some objects of the collection of body, faculties, and mind by the MƒÅdhyamika, the self definitely exists in the object of the self that is other than that.‚Äù

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, the example, the application of the analogy, and the conclusion.

original: dper na 'jig rten 'di na khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten 'di na khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, when one says that there is no water in a well, because the well is denied, one knows that the water is elsewhere.

original: khyod dbu ma pas 'dir lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs dag la bdag med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir de dag las gzhan pa dag gi yul la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyod dbu ma pas 'dir lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs dag la bdag med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir de dag las gzhan pa dag gi yul la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, you MƒÅdhyamikas deny that the collection of body, faculties, and mind is the self. Therefore, since the self would be in that which is other than those, the self certainly exists.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, here the author of the commentary himself says:

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug dang byed pa po gtso bo dang / byed pa po dus dang / byed pa po sred med kyi bu dag med do zhes bkag kyang gzhan gang la yang byed pa po de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug dang byed pa po gtso bo dang / byed pa po dus dang / byed pa po sred med kyi bu dag med do zhes bkag kyang gzhan gang la yang byed pa po de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Although the internal sense spheres are refuted as being the creator, the powerful one, the primary creator, the creator time, and the creator Narayana, still it is not definite, because the effect of those creators does not exist in any other.

original: don dam par ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med pas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In the ultimate, since water and so on are not established, there is no example, and therefore this is illogical.

original: pha rol po'i sgrub pa de'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang dpe med pas de rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i sgrub pa de'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang dpe med pas de rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the opponent‚Äôs proof is illogical because its reason is not definite and because there is no example.

original: 'di ni rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa gang dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi byed pa po dbang phyug dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu dag ma yin par 'dod pa dag gis nang gi skye mched rnams ni byed pa po de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu ma yin par bkag pa na gzhan dag la yang byed pa po de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu med par mthong
analyzed: 'di ni rang dang gzhan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa gang dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi byed pa po dbang phyug dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu dag ma yin par 'dod pa dag gis nang gi skye mched rnams ni byed pa po de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu ma yin par bkag pa na gzhan dag la yang byed pa po de dag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu med par mthong
translated: When the internal sources are refuted as being the effects created by those creators, others see that effects created by those creators do not exist.

original: bas / des na /
analyzed: bas / des na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩis it the case that because they are refuted in some places, just as when it is said that there is no water in a well, because they are refuted, water is understood to exist in other places?

original: ci re zhig kha cig tu bkag pa'i phyir dper na khron pa na chu med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin du lus dang dbang @66b po dang blo'i tshogs dag la bdag med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir de dag
analyzed: ci re zhig kha cig tu bkag pa'i phyir dper na khron pa na chu med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin du lus dang dbang @66b po dang blo'i tshogs dag la bdag med do zhes bkag pa'i phyir de dag
translated: In that case, because it is said that the collection of bodies, faculties, and minds are devoid of self,

original: las gzhan pa la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: las gzhan pa la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: do you assert that the self exists apart from those?

original: 'on te kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir dper na nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug la sogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med par bkag pas gzhan dag la yang med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo'i
analyzed: 'on te kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir dper na nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug la sogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med par bkag pas gzhan dag la yang med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du lus dang dbang po dang blo'i
translated: But if you say that the self is refuted in some contexts, and that just as the result of the actions of an agent such as God is refuted in the internal sense spheres, it does not exist in other contexts either, then the self would not exist in other contexts, just as the self is refuted as not existing in the collection of body, sense faculties, and mind.

original: tshogs dag la bdag med par bkag pas gzhan la yang bdag med pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pas rig pa ma yin no
analyzed: tshogs dag la bdag med par bkag pas gzhan la yang bdag med pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pas rig pa ma yin no
translated: But that is not certain. Therefore, since the reason of the opponent, ‚Äúbecause it is refuted in some contexts,‚Äù is uncertain, it is not correct.

original: // don dam par chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dpe 'di na khron pa na chu med do zhes /
analyzed: // don dam par chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dpe 'di na khron pa na chu med do zhes /
translated: Since water and so on are not established ultimately, this example of the opponent is not correct.

original: khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khron par bkag pa'i phyir gzhan na chu yod pa nyid du shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de med pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as when it is said that there is no water in a well, because the water is refuted in the well, it is understood that water exists elsewhere. But that is not the case here, so that is not correct.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig yang bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa dag la skyon 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag la sngar dbu ma pas don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig yang bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa dag la skyon 'dogs par byed de zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag la sngar dbu ma pas don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa
translated: Some Enumerators object to the previous refutations of the self that were presented through inferences.

original: dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way have previously shown the following inferences to the Enumerators: ‚ÄúThe five aggregates, which are characterized by being suitable to be form, experience, be apprehended as signs,üîΩand be conditioned and cognized, cannot be the self.üîΩThis is because they are phenomena that arise and disintegrate, just like a vase.‚Äù

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa des phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa des phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The five aggregates and the body are not the unique causes for observing the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they are phenomena that arise and disintegrate.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung bar skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung bar skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot.

original: de'i phyir grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs can dag na re /
translated: The Samkhyas say:

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas dpe med pa dang zhes zer te /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas dpe med pa dang zhes zer te /
translated: Even things that are subject to destruction, such as pots, are not without a cause of perception, so your example is not established.

original: de dag na re 'di na rnal 'byor pa lus su 'pho ba'i sbyor ba gzhan gyi khyim las rgyal ba zhes bya ba sgom par byed pa na /üîΩgzhan gyi khyim na mi ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa dag 'dug pa'i nang du rnal 'byor pa des rang gi sems btang nas bdag nyid kyi lus 'di ro dang 'dra bar gyur la /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di na rnal 'byor pa lus su 'pho ba'i sbyor ba gzhan gyi khyim las rgyal ba zhes bya ba sgom par byed pa na / gzhan gyi khyim na mi ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa dag 'dug pa'i nang du rnal 'byor pa des rang gi sems btang nas bdag nyid kyi lus 'di ro dang 'dra bar gyur la /
translated: The Samkhyas say: Yogis who meditate on the yoga of transference of body called conquering the house of othersüîΩsend their minds into the house of others and their bodies become like a corpse.

original: gzhan gyi khyim na 'dug pa'i ro de ni sems pa dang bcas pa gson por gyur nas des gzhan gyi dbang @67a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim na 'dug pa'i ro de ni sems pa dang bcas pa gson por gyur nas des gzhan gyi dbang @67a * //
translated: The corpse in the house of others becomes alive and endowed with consciousness.

original: phyug dang 'byor ba thams cad bdag gir byed pa na /
analyzed: phyug dang 'byor ba thams cad bdag gir byed pa na /
translated: When it appropriates all the wealth and resources of others,

original: rnal 'byor pa de'i sems gzhan gyi khyim na 'dug pa'i ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can de'i nang du 'jug pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ni ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de'i sems gzhan gyi khyim na 'dug pa'i ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can de'i nang du 'jug pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa ni ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa de nyid yin pas /
translated: the yogi‚Äôs mind enters the house of others, which is a corpse that is subject to destruction. The uncommon cause for the yogi‚Äôs mind to enter the house of others is the corpse itself, which is subject to destruction and devoid of thought.

original: des na ji ltar ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa de rnal 'byor pa de'i sems gzhan gyi lus la 'pho ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang sems pa med cing roüîΩrnam par 'jig pa'i chos can dang 'dra ba yin pas /
analyzed: des na ji ltar ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can sems pa med pa de rnal 'byor pa de'i sems gzhan gyi lus la 'pho ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang sems pa med cing ro rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can dang 'dra ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, just as the corpse, which is subject to destruction and devoid of thought, is the uncommon cause for the yogi‚Äôs mind to enter the body of others, in the same way, pots and so on are also devoid of thought and are similar to a corpse that is subject to destruction.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa sems pa med pa dag kyang bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa sems pa med pa dag kyang bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore, pots and so on, which are devoid of thought, are also the uncommon cause for the mind of the self to observe its object.

original: des na khyed dbu ma pas phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /üîΩskye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na khyed dbu ma pas phung po lnga dang lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, you Followers of the Middle Way say that the five aggregates and the body are not the unique objects of observation of the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration.üîΩYou say that the aggregates and the body are not the self because they are subject to arising and disintegration, just like a vase.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The example you use is not suitable.

original: gzhan yang grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan yang grangs can dag na re /
translated: Furthermore, the Enumerators say,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dpe med do zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dpe med do zhe na zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe objects of the senses, such as vases, are not suitable as examples because they are the unique objects of observation of the self.‚Äù

original: 'di skad ces bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: bum pa las sogs pa dag 'jig pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe rdul phra mor gyur nas gtso bo'i bag la zha zhing 'khor ba dag gang gi tshe 'chags pa'i bskal pa 'byung ba de'i tshe na lus can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa dbang po'i
analyzed: bum pa las sogs pa dag 'jig pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe rdul phra mor gyur nas gtso bo'i bag la zha zhing 'khor ba dag gang gi tshe 'chags pa'i bskal pa 'byung ba de'i tshe na lus can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa dbang po'i
translated: When the time of the great destruction arrives, vases and so on disintegrate into subtle particles. The subtle particles dissolve into the primal matter. When the time of creation arrives, the primal matter gives rise to the subtle particles. The subtle particles give rise to the gross objects, such as vases.

original: dngos por 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur zhing /
translated: and they become the sense faculties.

original: de dag dbang por red nas skyes bu zhes bya ba bdag de yul la longs spyod par 'dod pa'i tshe na bum pa la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo lus can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa de dag skyes bu zhes bya ba'iüîΩbdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang khyed dbu ma pas phung po lnga dang lus ni /
analyzed: de dag dbang por red nas skyes bu zhes bya ba bdag de yul la longs spyod par 'dod pa'i tshe na bum pa la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo lus can rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa de dag skyes bu zhes bya ba'i bdag de yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang khyed dbu ma pas phung po lnga dang lus ni /
translated: When the self called puru·π£a wishes to enjoy objects, the subtle particles of things such as a pot become the sense faculties such as the eyes of embodied beings.

original: bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Since those particles are the uncommon cause of the self called puru·π£a observing objects, you MƒÅdhyamikas say that the five aggregates and the body are not the uncommon cause of observing the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they possess the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa'i dpe de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: For example, it is like a pot.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs can dag gi /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs can dag gi /
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not good‚Äù and so on.

original: rtog pa rnam pa @67b de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par go rims bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: rtog pa rnam pa @67b de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par go rims bzhin du ston to //
translated: Both of these conceptions are untenable, as will now be shown in order.

original: de la re zhig rtog pa dang po de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rtog pa dang po de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, the first conception is untenable, as will now be shown.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that such things as pots are the uncommon cause of the observation of those who possess the realization of reality,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are objects of the cognition of the ear and so forth.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, they are objects of the cognition of the ear and so forth, which are different from that.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul ni rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa de las gzhan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul ni rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the objects of the ears and so on of ordinary beings who do not possess the realization of thatness are the objects of the ears and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore they are not the uncommon objects of the yogis who possess the realization of thatness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, pots and so on are the objects of the ears and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore they are not the uncommon objects of the yogis who possess the realization of thatness.

original: des na kho bo cag gi dpe bum pa bdag yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas /
analyzed: des na kho bo cag gi dpe bum pa bdag yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas /
translated: Therefore our example, the pot, is not an uncommon cause of the object of observation.

original: grang can dag gi rtog pa de bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: grang can dag gi rtog pa de bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the conception of the nihilists is not good.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second conception is untenable,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du ma gyur pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du ma gyur pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: you say, ‚ÄúSince you assert that things such as pots that are not the nature of the sense faculties are the example, the error that we mentioned does not arise.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gi khyed kyis brtags pa'i 'jig pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dag dpe nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi khyed kyis brtags pa'i 'jig pa chen po 'byung ba'i dus kyi tshe bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dag dpe nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not assert that things such as pots that are the nature of the sense faculties at the time of the great eon of destruction that you imagine are the example.

original: da ltar bum pa dngos su yod pa 'di dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar bum pa dngos su yod pa 'di dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: We assert that this pot that actually exists now is the example.

original: des na dper na bum pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na dper na bum pa ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, for example, since a pot is a phenomenon that arises and disintegrates, it is not the uncommon cause of the observation of self.

original: phung po lnga dang lus kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin par 'grub pas /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang lus kyang skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin par 'grub pas /
translated: Because the five aggregates and the body are subject to arising and disintegration, it is established that they are not the unique cause of the observation of the self.

original: kho bo cag gi sgrub pa la dpe med pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sgrub pa la dpe med pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, our argument is not flawed by the absence of an example.

original: 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan ni thams cad du song ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la dbang po @68a * //üîΩrnams kyi nus pa yod la /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan ni thams cad du song ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la dbang po @68a * // rnams kyi nus pa yod la /
translated: Here, the Enumerators say: Since the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas are all-pervasive, the sense faculties exist in pots and so on.

original: dbang po rnams ni bdag yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas /üîΩdes na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni bdag yul la dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas / des na khyed dbu ma pa'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: The sense faculties are the unique cause of the observation of objects by the self.üîΩTherefore, since you Followers of the Middle Way have no example, your argument is flawed.

original: 'dir nus pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir nus pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: We respond as follows. Since there is no inference that can demonstrate the existence of such potential,

original: de yod pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe med par yang mi 'gyur bas de ni snying po ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de yod pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe med par yang mi 'gyur bas de ni snying po ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since that exists, the example of the pot and so on would not be nonexistent. Therefore, that is not the essence.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni /
translated: First, they say:

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have production and disintegration.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: zhes gsungs pas bdag phung po rnams nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas bdag phung po rnams nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Since that is stated, the self is not the aggregates themselves,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan yang ma yin pa'i tshul gyis bdag med par bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu pa /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan yang ma yin pa'i tshul gyis bdag med par bstan to / // / bam po drug cu pa /
translated: and it is not different from the aggregates. In this way, it is taught that there is no self.

original: de ltar bdag med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag med par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught in that way that there is no self,

original: da ni bdag gi med par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag gi med par bstan par bya ste /
translated: now, in order to teach that there is no mine,

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the opponent‚Äôs view,

original: bdag tu smra ba dag na re ;
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag na re ;
translated: the Proponents of Self say:

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te bdag gi yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te bdag gi yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The self definitely exists because the mine exists.

original: dper na nor yod pa'i phyir nor bdag yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nor yod pa'i phyir nor bdag yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, because wealth exists, the owner of the wealth exists.

original: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang / gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang / gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Here, since my house, bed, clothes, food, views, and so on exist, therefore I alone exist.

original: de ni pha rol po dag bdag gi yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de ni pha rol po dag bdag gi yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs statement that the existence of the self is established by the reason of the existence of mine.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is a syllogism that has a subject, a predicate, a reason, an example, an application, and a conclusion.

original: dper na 'di na nor dbyig la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'di na nor dbyig la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, since wealth such as jewels exists,

original: nor bu dag rnam thos kyi bu la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nor bu dag rnam thos kyi bu la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: the jewel owners such as Vai≈õrava·πáa exist.

original: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir bdag kyang yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir bdag kyang yod pa yin pas /
translated: In the same way, since my house and so on exist, I also exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the self definitely exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'di ltar bdag yod na ni de'i 'di yin no zhes bdag gi yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag yod na ni de'i 'di yin no zhes bdag gi yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the self existed, then ‚Äúthis is mine‚Äù would be established.

original: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: But since it has been shown that the self does not exist,

original: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: the self itself does not exist.

original: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How could ‚Äúmine‚Äù exist?

original: brtags na de ltar bdag nyid rnam pa thams @68b cad du mi 'thad na /
analyzed: brtags na de ltar bdag nyid rnam pa thams @68b cad du mi 'thad na /
translated: If the self itself does not exist in any way when analyzed,

original: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could ‚Äúmine‚Äù exist?

original: 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya na /
translated: In this way, if the so-called self is called ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: bdag de yang med de /
analyzed: bdag de yang med de /
translated: that self does not exist.

original: de med na de'i de yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na de'i de yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: If that does not exist, how could it be tenable to say ‚Äúthis is mine‚Äù?

original: de lta bas na bdag gi yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gi yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore ‚Äúmine‚Äù is also untenable.

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de ltar bdag med pas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag med pas /
translated: Thus, since the self does not exist,

original: bdag gi med pa des na pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs bdag gi yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi med pa des na pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs bdag gi yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause the self exists,‚Äù is not established.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: There is also no example.

original: don dam par nor dang nor bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /üîΩpha rol po dag gi dpe nor yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par nor dang nor bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni / pha rol po dag gi dpe nor yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the existence of wealth and the owner of wealth is not established ultimately.

original: nor bdag yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: nor bdag yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the opponent‚Äôs example, ‚Äúbecause wealth exists, the owner of wealth exists,‚Äù is taught to be unestablished.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: There is also contradiction in the meaning.

original: bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang / gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas zhes smras pa des bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir don dam par bdag yod pa kho nar 'dod pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang / gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas zhes smras pa des bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir don dam par bdag yod pa kho nar 'dod pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it shows that the self is a conventional reality‚Äù means that the opponent‚Äôs argument is flawed because it shows that the self is a conventional reality.

original: 'dis na de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩsgrub pa snga ma 'dis ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dis na de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / sgrub pa snga ma 'dis ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces /
translated: This argument also refutes the following arguments that the opponent might make: ‚ÄúThe self exists because its effects exist‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe self exists because its qualities exist.‚ÄùüîΩThe first argument shows that the opponent‚Äôs position is flawed because it contradicts the opponent‚Äôs own beliefs.

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent might respond by saying, ‚ÄúThe self definitely exists.

original: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It exists because its effects exist.

original: 'di ltar phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dag thams cad bdag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dag thams cad bdag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because all internal and external things are the effects of the self,

original: gal te bdag med du zin na bzhi med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dang / de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag med du zin na bzhi med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dang / de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: if the self did not exist, its effects would not exist because the basis would not exist.

original: de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa dag ni bdag gi yon tan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa dag ni bdag gi yon tan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Likewise, the self definitely exists because its qualities exist.

original: gal te bdag med du zin na /üîΩgzhi med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bdag med du zin na / gzhi med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, and so on are the qualities of the self because if the self did not exist,üîΩits qualities would not exist because the basis would not exist.

original: de'i yon tan yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang /
analyzed: de'i yon tan yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang /
translated: In response to such arguments, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the self does not exist,

original: bdag gi 'bras bu dang yon tan yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi 'bras bu dang yon tan yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: how could its effects and qualities exist?

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no @69a * //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe med pa dang gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no @69a * //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established, there is no example, and the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: zhes skyon gyis lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes skyon gyis lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how you should respond with objections.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang la bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba de ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang la bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba de ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
translated: Thus, one who does not view the external and internal as the self and mine sees reality.

original: rnal 'byor ba de de sgom par byed cing bstan par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba de de sgom par byed cing bstan par byed do //
translated: That yogin cultivates and teaches that.

original: de sgom par byed cing bstan par byed pa de'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de sgom par byed cing bstan par byed pa de'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas /
translated: When he cultivates and teaches that, his clinging to the self and mine is pacified.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnal 'byor ba yang dag pa nyid so sor rtog pa la brtson pa la /üîΩbdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnal 'byor ba yang dag pa nyid so sor rtog pa la brtson pa la / bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in that way, the yogin who strives in the discernment of realityüîΩhas no grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù

original: dar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur // zhes bya bas ni /
translated: because the self and mine are pacified.üîΩThis is what is said by the verse:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The result of cultivating the method taughtüîΩis the absence of grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba ni gang zag bdag med pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba ni gang zag bdag med pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the result of the meditation on the selflessness of persons is the absence of the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù due to the pacification of the manifest clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra bdag kyang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: bdag tu smra bdag kyang phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: The proponents of a self may object, ‚ÄúA self certainly exists because

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: the view of the self exists.üîΩThe view of the self exists because the view of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and the view of ‚Äòmine‚Äô exist.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la de kho na shes pa yang dag par skyes pa la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la de kho na shes pa yang dag par skyes pa la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i phyir ro
