translated: The view of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and the view of ‚Äòmine‚Äô exist because the view of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and the view of ‚Äòmine‚Äô exist in relation to the body, the sense faculties, the mind, and so on, which are devoid of a self and being mine.

original: // mo gsham gyi bu lta bu med pa la ni de lta bu med do //
analyzed: // mo gsham gyi bu lta bu med pa la ni de lta bu med do //
translated: The view of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and the view of ‚Äòmine‚Äô do not exist in relation to things that are devoid of a self and being mine, like the son of a barren woman.‚Äù

original: thar pa'i gnas skabs gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la ni de ltar shes pa de yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa de kho na shes pa la yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i gtanüîΩtshigs kyis bdag yod par sgrub cing /
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas skabs gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la ni de ltar shes pa de yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa de kho na shes pa la yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag yod par sgrub cing /
translated: The context of liberation is the absence of grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the absence of grasping at ‚Äúmine.‚Äù Since that exists, therefore the self alone exists.üîΩThis is the statement of the opponent, who proves the existence of the self by the reason that the yogi who knows reality has the correct view.

original: gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid bdag yin pas de yod pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi yang nges pa kho nar yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid bdag yin pas de yod pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi yang nges pa kho nar yod pa yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: And since it is said that when one sees things as they really are, grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and grasping at ‚Äúmine‚Äù will be absent, and since that is the self, the self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù definitely exist because that exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩ'di na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu med pa gang la ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba med pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /

original: 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yod pas /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yod pas /
translated: Here the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúIn our philosophy there is an intrinsically real self that has no self-grasping and no grasping at being mine.

original: des na ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam du shes pa'i bdag kyang yod @71a * //
analyzed: des na ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam du shes pa'i bdag kyang yod @71a * //
translated: Therefore there is a self that knows, ‚ÄòI have no self-grasping and no grasping at being mine.‚Äô

original: la ; des de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: la ; des de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur bas /
translated: And because of that, reality is seen.

original: khyed dbu ma pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the faults you Madhyamikas claim are not present in our system.

original: de dag na re gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nang gi byed pa bdag med pa'i yul la blos bdag med par lta ba ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag na re gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nang gi byed pa bdag med pa'i yul la blos bdag med par lta ba ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: They say that because the internal agents such as the eye that are part of the elements are without self, the mind views the object as without self and so the conception of I is reversed.

original: ngar 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa med la /
translated: Therefore the conception of I does not exist.

original: yid bdag ma yin pa blo'i char gtogs pa yang rang las gzhan pa skyes bu gzhan gyi don lus dang dbang po'i yul dag la dmigs par byed pa na 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi skyes bu gzhan gyi yin no snyam pas nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'jug
analyzed: yid bdag ma yin pa blo'i char gtogs pa yang rang las gzhan pa skyes bu gzhan gyi don lus dang dbang po'i yul dag la dmigs par byed pa na 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi skyes bu gzhan gyi yin no snyam pas nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'jug
translated: Also, the mind that is not the self but is part of the intellect does not engage in the conception of mine when it observes the objects of other persons and other bodies and sense faculties that are different from itself, thinking, This is not mine but belongs to another person.

original: pa'i phyir nga yir 'dzin pa yang med pas /
analyzed: pa'i phyir nga yir 'dzin pa yang med pas /
translated: Therefore the conception of mine also does not exist.

original: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang yod la /
analyzed: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang yod la /
translated: Thus, the self that is not the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and not the apprehension of ‚Äúmine‚Äù and is the nature of consciousness does exist.

original: des de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur bas khyed dbu ma pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur bas khyed dbu ma pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: And since it sees reality, the faults you Followers of the Middle Way ascribe to us do not apply to our position.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary says:

original: bdag la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i don byed pa dang rten sgra la sogs pa dag la nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i don byed pa dang rten sgra la sogs pa dag la nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe apprehension of ‚ÄòI‚Äô in the view of the self as a self exists in the sense of being the referent object of that view, and the apprehension of ‚Äòmine‚Äô in the referent objects of that view, such as sound, does not cease.

original: ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pas de ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pas de ni lan ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of the apprehension of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and the nonexistence of the apprehension of ‚Äòmine‚Äô are not established. Your response is not valid.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid de yod par gyur na /üîΩbdag de la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pa dang / skyes bu'i de'i don rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nang gi byed pa dang byed pa'i rten sgra la sogs pa de tsam dag la skyes bu de'i nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bdag shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid de yod par gyur na / bdag de la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pa dang / skyes bu'i de'i don rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i dbang po la sogs pa nang gi byed pa dang byed pa'i rten sgra la sogs pa de tsam dag la skyes bu de'i nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: If the so-called existent self were the reality of the person,

original: nga yir 'dzin pa yang med pa nyid du ma grub pas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon snga ma de nyid so na gnas bzhin pas grangs can dag gi tshig de ni kho bo'i lan ma yin no //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa yang med pa nyid du ma grub pas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon snga ma de nyid so na gnas bzhin pas grangs can dag gi tshig de ni kho bo'i lan ma yin no //
translated: then since the view of self and the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would exist in that self just as they do in reality, the nonexistence of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would not be established. And since the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù would not cease with regard to the person‚Äôs faculties and so on that are included in its object, the person‚Äôs internal creator and the mere sound and so on that are the basis of the creator, the nonexistence of the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù would not be established. Therefore, since the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù would not be nonexistent, the previous error would remain. Therefore the statement of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is not my response.

original: don de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that meaning, the master ƒÄryadeva says:

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
translated: If the so-called self exists,

original: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
translated: It is illogical to say ‚Äúselflessness.‚Äù

original: yang na de nyid @71b rtogs pa'am //
analyzed: yang na de nyid @71b rtogs pa'am //
translated: Or, if you assert that the so-called self exists,

original: mya ngan 'da' ba des brdzun 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' ba des brdzun 'gyur // zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Then the realization of thatness or nirvana would be false.

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod par gyur na ni bdag med pa zhes bya ba de mi rigs pas /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod par gyur na ni bdag med pa zhes bya ba de mi rigs pas /
translated: If the so-called self exists, then it is illogical to say ‚Äúselflessness.‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would not be reversed.

original: 'on te ngar 'dzin pa ldog par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te ngar 'dzin pa ldog par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is reversed,

original: des na yang na de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yang na de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the so-called self that is imputed by others as the realization of thatness would definitely be false.

original: 'on te de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa nges pa de nges par mi brdzun par yod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa nges pa de nges par mi brdzun par yod par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that the so-called self that is imputed by others as the realization of thatness definitely exists and is not false,

original: de la thar pa mi srid pas //
analyzed: de la thar pa mi srid pas //
translated: then liberation is impossible for you.

original: des na yang na pha rol po dag bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na yang na pha rol po dag bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, either the one who is called the self and who is asserted by the opponent to attain nirvana is definitely false.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
translated: Here, some Samkhyas say that intrinsic nature is liberated,

original: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smras te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smras te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: while others say that purusha is liberated.

original: sngar slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
analyzed: sngar slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
translated: Previously, Master ƒÄryadeva said:

original: mya ngan 'da' ba nges brdzun 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' ba nges brdzun 'gyur //
translated: Nirvana would definitely be false.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus he refuted the assertion that nirvana is liberation.

original: 'on te de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa de nges par mi brdzun par yod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i bdag yod par gzhan gyis yongs su btags pa de nges par mi brdzun par yod par 'dod na ni /
translated: If the self that is imputed by others, called ‚Äúthe one who realizes reality,‚Äù definitely exists and is not false,

original: de la thar pa mi srid pas /
analyzed: de la thar pa mi srid pas /
translated: then liberation is impossible.

original: des na yang na pha rol po dag bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de la /
analyzed: des na yang na pha rol po dag bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de nges par brdzun par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de la /
translated: Therefore, either the one who is called the self and who is asserted by the opponent to attain nirvana is definitely false.

original: 'dir grangs can dag bdag yod kyang de la thar pa srid pas bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te /üîΩde la grangs can dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de yang kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag bdag yod kyang de la thar pa srid pas bdag ces bya ba mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te / de la grangs can dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa de yang kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
translated: Here, the Samkhyas say that although the self exists, since liberation is possible for it, the so called self attains nirvana.

original: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung gnyis yod par ston to //
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung gnyis yod par ston to //
translated: The Samkhyas assert that nirvana is the transformation of the self, and they have two texts: some say that the nature is liberated and others say that the person is liberated.üîΩThis passage teaches that.

original: de la re zhig gang dag /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag /
translated: First, those who sayüîΩthat the nature is liberated say:

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can ni //
translated: The nature is the basis of various things

original: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas ni /üîΩrang bzhin thar par smra ba'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur // zhes bya bas ni / rang bzhin thar par smra ba'i gzhung ston te /
translated: that are transmigrators, bound and liberated.üîΩThis passage teaches the text of those who say that the nature is liberated.

original: de yangs grangs can rang bzhin thar par smra ba dag gi gzhung /
analyzed: de yangs grangs can rang bzhin thar par smra ba dag gi gzhung /
translated: The text of the Samkhyas who say that the nature is liberated is as follows:

original: gser bdun cu pa zhes bya ba las tshigs su bcad pa de skad ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: gser bdun cu pa zhes bya ba las tshigs su bcad pa de skad ces 'byung ste /
translated: The Seventy Verses on Gold states:

original: rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa de ni blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid kyi dbang po @72a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam par gyur pa de ni blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid kyi dbang po @72a * //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe nature is the basis of various things‚Äù means that the nature is the three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas in a state of equilibrium.

original: dang ; de tsam lnga la sogs pa 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rten yin zhing /
analyzed: dang ; de tsam lnga la sogs pa 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rten yin zhing /
translated: It is the basis of various things, such as the five sense faculties, the five action faculties, the mental faculty, the five subtle elements, and so on, which are animate and inanimate.

original: de la sna tshogs rten pa dag yod pas sna tshogs rten can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sna tshogs rten pa dag yod pas sna tshogs rten can zhes bya'o //
translated: Since various things are based on it, it is called the basis of various things.

original: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur //
translated: It is samsara, bondage, and liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can de ni gang gi tshe 'gro ba lnga po dag tu 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na ni 'khor bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can de ni gang gi tshe 'gro ba lnga po dag tu 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na ni 'khor bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: When the nature that is the basis of various things cycles in the five transmigrations, it is samsara.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin long ba grum po'i don la 'jug pa bzhin du skyes bu'i don la lus dang dbang po dang yul dag la 'jug pa de'i tshe na ni 'ching bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin long ba grum po'i don la 'jug pa bzhin du skyes bu'i don la lus dang dbang po dang yul dag la 'jug pa de'i tshe na ni 'ching bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: When the person engages in the meaning of ‚Äúperson‚Äù in the same way that a blind man engages in the meaning of ‚Äúcrooked,‚Äù in terms of the body, faculties, and objects, then he is bound.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin de skyes bu'i don las ldog pa de'i tshe na ni thar par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin de skyes bu'i don las ldog pa de'i tshe na ni thar par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: When the person turns away from the meaning of ‚Äúperson,‚Äù then he is liberated.üîΩThus, since the person is the agent, he is engaged in action, and so he cycles, is bound, and is liberated.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang 'ching ba dang / thar par yang 'gyur gyi skyes bu ni za ba po yin pas bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang 'ching ba dang thar par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni byed pa po yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang 'ching ba dang / thar par yang 'gyur gyi skyes bu ni za ba po yin pas bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang 'ching ba dang thar par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the person is the experiencer, he is not engaged in action, and so he does not cycle, is not bound, and is not liberated.

original: de ltar rang bzhin thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da' bar smra ste /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da' bar smra ste /
translated: Thus, since the person is liberated, he is said to attain nirvana.

original: 'di la grangs can dag rang bzhin thar par 'dod pa'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'di la grangs can dag rang bzhin thar par 'dod pa'i gzhung ni /
translated: On this point, the Samkhyas‚Äô scriptures state:

original: gang gi tshe blo la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe na blo nyid thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe na blo nyid thar par 'gyur te /
translated: When the consciousness of mere awareness arises, at that time the mind itself is liberated.

original: de yang ji srid du blos blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du mi shes pa de srid du ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa mi skye bas 'ching ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang ji srid du blos blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du mi shes pa de srid du ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa mi skye bas 'ching ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, as long as the mind does not understand that the mind and self are different and that the natures of sattva, rajas, and tamas are different, the consciousness of mere awareness does not arise and it is bound.

original: gang gi tshe blos blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan yin no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blos blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan yin no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar par 'gyur bas /
translated: But when the mind understands that the mind and self are different and that the natures of sattva, rajas, and tamas are different, at that time the consciousness of mere awareness arises and the mind itself is liberated.

original: de la rang bzhin thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the mind itself is liberated by nature and that is nirvana.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the incorrect tenets of those who say this,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin no snyam pa'i blo ni log par lta ba yin te zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩdes na grangs can de dag gi blo bdag kyang gzhan la /üîΩrang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de ni log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin no snyam pa'i blo ni log par lta ba yin te zhes bya ba smras te / des na grangs can de dag gi blo bdag kyang gzhan la / rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de ni log par lta ba yin te /
translated: The thought that the self and intrinsic reality are different is a wrong view.üîΩTherefore, the thought of the Samkhyas that the self is one thing and intrinsic reality is another is a wrong view.

original: 'ba' zhig nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: The thought that the self is one thing and intrinsic reality is another is a wrong view because it is not the cause of the generation of knowledge alone.

original: de ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi thar pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de la thar pa med do //
analyzed: de ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi thar pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de la thar pa med do //
translated: Liberation does not exist for them because that thought is the cause of bondage, not the cause of liberation.

original: ci'i phyir bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de log par lta ba @72b yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de log par lta ba @72b yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the thought that the self is one thing and intrinsic reality is another a wrong view?

original: de'i phyir / de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, because it is not different from that.

original: gang gi phyir blo ni rang bzhin de las gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo ni rang bzhin de las gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo de log par lta ba yin te /
translated: Because the thought is not different from intrinsic reality, the thought that the self is one thing and intrinsic reality is another is a wrong view.

original: ji ltar blo rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar blo rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the intellect is not different from its nature?

original: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin las chen po 'byung zhing de las nga rgyal 'byung /
analyzed: grangs can dag nyid kyi gzhung las rang bzhin las chen po 'byung zhing de las nga rgyal 'byung /
translated: The Samkhyas themselves say in their scriptures that the great one arises from the nature, from that the I-principle arises,

original: de las dbang po dang / yid dang / de tsam dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las dbang po dang / yid dang / de tsam dag 'byung ngo //
translated: from that the organs, the mind and the subtle elements arise.

original: blo ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: blo ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: Since the intellect is asserted to be the nature of the self, therefore the intellect and the self are different.üîΩThe nature called the quality of sattva, rajas and tamas is also different.

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan cha mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo log par lta ba de ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi thar pa'i
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan cha mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i blo log par lta ba de ni 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de ni 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi thar pa'i
translated: The intellect that thinks in this way is a wrong view. Since it is not the cause of the arising of knowledge that is just consciousness, it is the cause of bondage, but not the cause of liberation.

original: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de la thar pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de la thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore liberation does not exist for them.

original: ci ste grangs can dag 'di skad ces blo de la bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i shes pa tha dad pa med kyang rang bzhin gyis skyes bu gcig thar par byas pa na rang bzhin nyid kyang thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste grangs can dag 'di skad ces blo de la bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam pa'i shes pa tha dad pa med kyang rang bzhin gyis skyes bu gcig thar par byas pa na rang bzhin nyid kyang thar par 'gyur te /
translated: The Samkhyas might say: Although the mind does not have a separate consciousness thinking that the self is one thing and its nature another, when one person is liberated by his nature, his nature is also liberated.

original: kho bo cag gi gzhung las rang bzhin ni bro gar mkhan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gzhung las rang bzhin ni bro gar mkhan dang 'dra ste /
translated: In our scriptures it says that nature is like an actor.

original: ji ltar bro gar mkhan gyis /
analyzed: ji ltar bro gar mkhan gyis /
translated: Just as an actor

original: bro gar gyis grong gcig gi don byas nas grong gzhan dga' bar bya ba'i phyir grong gzhan dag tu yang rgyu zhing 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bro gar gyis grong gcig gi don byas nas grong gzhan dga' bar bya ba'i phyir grong gzhan dag tu yang rgyu zhing 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: performs for the sake of one town and then goes to another town to entertain it,üîΩin the same way, after liberating one person by his nature, nature engages in and goes to the welfare of other people in order to liberate other people.

original: rang bzhin yang skyes bu gcig thar par byas nas yang skyes bu gzhan dag thar par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu gzhan dag gi don la 'jug cing 'gro 'o zhes 'byung bas rang bzhin la thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba
analyzed: rang bzhin yang skyes bu gcig thar par byas nas yang skyes bu gzhan dag thar par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu gzhan dag gi don la 'jug cing 'gro 'o zhes 'byung bas rang bzhin la thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba
translated: Thus, nature has liberation.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis thar par gyur na yang skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis thar par gyur na yang skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the author of the commentary himself said, ‚ÄúEven if one person were liberated, because it is common to many people,

original: don ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: since it engages for the sake of people who have not done their purpose, there is no liberation.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rang bzhin des skyes bu gcig thar par gyur na yang de skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir don ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin des skyes bu gcig thar par gyur na yang de skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir don ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas /
translated: Thus, if one person were liberated by that nature, since it is common to many people, it engages for the sake of people who have not done their purpose.

original: skyes bu dag la mtha' med pa'i phyir rang bzhin de la nam yang thar pa med do //
analyzed: skyes bu dag la mtha' med pa'i phyir rang bzhin de la nam yang thar pa med do //
translated: Since people are infinite, there is never liberation in that nature.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni rang bzhin thar par smra ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni rang bzhin thar par smra ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: Thus far he has shown that the treatise of the proponents of natural liberation is untenable.

original: da ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the treatise of the proponents of liberation of the person is untenable,üîΩhe says:

original: gang dag skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching bas sngar @73a * //
analyzed: gang dag skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching bas sngar @73a * //
translated: Those who assert that the person is bound by the bonds

original: bcings pa thar bar gyur par smra ba zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bcings pa thar bar gyur par smra ba zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúOne who advocates that the bound is liberated.‚Äù

original: des ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: des ni skyes bu thar par smra ba'i gzhung ston te /
translated: This teaches the treatise of the person who advocates liberation.

original: de yang grangs can skyes bu thar par smra ba dag gi gzhung las 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de yang grangs can skyes bu thar par smra ba dag gi gzhung las 'di skad ces /
translated: Moreover, the treatise of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya who advocates that the person is liberated says:

original: gal te skyes bu med na rang bzhin skyes bu'i don la 'jug par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rang bzhin skyes bu'i don la 'jug cing rang bzhin skyes bu'i 'ching ba yin pa ni skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu med na rang bzhin skyes bu'i don la 'jug par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rang bzhin skyes bu'i don la 'jug cing rang bzhin skyes bu'i 'ching ba yin pa ni skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
translated: If the person did not exist, the nature would not engage in the purpose of the person. Therefore the nature engages in the purpose of the person. The nature is the bondage of the person. This is called ‚Äúbondage in terms of the person.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni 'ching ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni 'ching ba yin pas /
translated: Thus the nature is bondage.

original: de bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar mi byed kyi gzhan 'ching bar byed de /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid 'ching bar mi byed kyi gzhan 'ching bar byed de /
translated: It does not bind itself, but it binds another.

original: des bcing bar bya ba gzhan de ni skyes bu yin pas skyes bu ni rang bzhin gyis bcings so //
analyzed: des bcing bar bya ba gzhan de ni skyes bu yin pas skyes bu ni rang bzhin gyis bcings so //
translated: That other thing that is bound by it is the person. Therefore the person is bound by the nature.

original: de ltar skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes bu de ni phyis thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes bu de ni phyis thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the person who is bound by the natural bondage that is dependent on the person is liberated later.

original: de la ji ltar na skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas skyes bu de sngar bcings she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas skyes bu de sngar bcings she na /
translated: How is the person bound by the natural bondage that is dependent on the person?

original: sngon ji srid du rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rtul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du mi shes pa de srid du ni blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa mi skye bas
analyzed: sngon ji srid du rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang rtul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du mi shes pa de srid du ni blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa mi skye bas
translated: As long as the intellect that is a part of nature does not know that the self is one thing and that the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas is another, the knowledge of the intellect is not generated.

original: blo nyid bcings pa yin la /
analyzed: blo nyid bcings pa yin la /
translated: The intellect is bound.

original: blo bcings pa des dper na gzugs la brten te gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu yang 'ching bar byed pas /
analyzed: blo bcings pa des dper na gzugs la brten te gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu yang 'ching bar byed pas /
translated: The person is bound by the intellect that is bound, just as a reflection arises in dependence on a form.

original: de ni skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas skyes bu sngar bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas skyes bu sngar bcings pa yin no //
translated: This is the person who is bound by the natural bondage that is dependent on the person.

original: ji ltar na skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes bu de phyis thar par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩgang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: ji ltar na skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes bu de phyis thar par 'gyur zhe na / gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: How could a person who was previously bound by natural bondage come to be liberated later?

original: snying stobs dang rtul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rtul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la /
translated: When the mind that is part of the nature of the person understands that the self is different from the mind and that sattva, rajas, and tamas are different, at that time the mind alone is liberated.üîΩThe liberated mind liberates the person just as a reflection arises in dependence on a form.

original: blo thar pa des dper na gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu yang thar par byed pas de ltar blos bdag nyid kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan yin no snyam du shes pas bdag nyid thar pa gzugs lta bu de la brten
analyzed: blo thar pa des dper na gzugs la brten nas gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu yang thar par byed pas de ltar blos bdag nyid kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan yin no snyam du shes pas bdag nyid thar pa gzugs lta bu de la brten
translated: Thus, the mind understands that the self is different and the nature is different.

original: nas skyes bu la yang de ltar shes pa gzugs brnyan lta bu skye zhing skyes bu thar bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: nas skyes bu la yang de ltar shes pa gzugs brnyan lta bu skye zhing skyes bu thar bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: and a person arises from barley, then a reflection-like consciousness would arise in that way, and the person would be liberated.

original: skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes @73b bu phyis thar pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'ching bas sngar bcings pa'i skyes @73b bu phyis thar pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The person who was previously bound by the intrinsic bondage of the person is later liberated.

original: de ltar skyes bu thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu thar par 'gyur ba de mya ngan las 'da'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the person who is liberated attains nirvana.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In order to refute the incorrect scriptural statements of those who say this, the author of the commentary says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe self of those is different from the other, and intrinsic nature is also different.‚Äù

original: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du blo nges par byas pa yang skyes bu snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par med do zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du blo nges par byas pa yang skyes bu snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par med do zhes bya ba smras te
translated: The mind is certain, but there is no difference between the earlier and later persons, and there is no difference between the one who is bound and the one who is liberated.

original: / grangs can dag gi blo gzugs lta bu sa bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas te bdag nyid thar pas skyes bu gzugs brnyan lta bu yang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: / grangs can dag gi blo gzugs lta bu sa bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas te bdag nyid thar pas skyes bu gzugs brnyan lta bu yang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The Samkhyas think that the self is different from the intellect, which is like form, and that the self is also different from the nature. They think that just as the self is liberated, so the person, which is like a reflection, is also liberated.

original: grangs can bdag nyid kyis gzhung las skyes bu ni rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa yin par 'dod pas des na rang bzhin gyis char gtogs pa'i blos bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas su zin
analyzed: grangs can bdag nyid kyis gzhung las skyes bu ni rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa yin par 'dod pas des na rang bzhin gyis char gtogs pa'i blos bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas su zin
translated: However, the Samkhyas themselves assert in their scriptures that the person is permanent, unchanging, and not produced by earlier and later differences. Therefore, the self, which is included in the nature, is definitely thought to be different from the intellect.

original: kyang / skyes bu rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gnas skabs gang gis bcings pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par dang / gnas skabs gang gis thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par dmigs su med pas de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi tshul ltar rang bzhin thar pas skyes bu thar par mi 'gyur bas skyes bu la thar pa med do //
analyzed: kyang / skyes bu rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gnas skabs gang gis bcings pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par dang / gnas skabs gang gis thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par dmigs su med pas de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs brnyan gyi tshul ltar rang bzhin thar pas skyes bu thar par mi 'gyur bas skyes bu la thar pa med do //
translated: But since the permanent person, which is unchanging, is not observed to have any difference before and after, any difference that is said to be ‚Äúbound by some circumstance‚Äù or any difference that is said to be ‚Äúliberated by some circumstance‚Äù does not exist. Therefore, just like the relation between a reflection and its original object, the person is not liberated by liberation, which is its nature. Therefore the person does not have liberation.

original: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' la yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas /
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' la yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas /
translated: Here the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas might say, ‚ÄúIn our philosophy there is a phenomenon called transformation.

original: des dper na gser gyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur yang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dbyings yongs su 'gyur ba bzhin du skyes bu'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur yang blos bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas te thar par gyur
analyzed: des dper na gser gyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur yang gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dbyings yongs su 'gyur ba bzhin du skyes bu'i rang bzhin mi 'gyur yang blos bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par byas te thar par gyur
translated: For example, just as the nature of gold does not change but its shape, such as a bracelet or necklace, does change, the nature of the person does not change but the mind ascertains that the self is different from the person and the nature of the person is different from the self and one attains liberation.

original: pa na skyes bu yang de'i rnam par yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes bu thar bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: pa na skyes bu yang de'i rnam par yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes bu thar bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: When one attains liberation, the person also changes its aspect, and therefore the person attains liberation.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this former position, the author of the commentary states:

original: gal te yongs su 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: gal te yongs su 'gyur na yang /
translated: If it transforms,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgang gi phyir yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa ste /üîΩrang bzhin gyi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te / gang gi phyir yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa ste / rang bzhin gyi chos yin gyi /
translated: the error would arise that consciousness does not exist because it transforms.

original: skyes bu'i chos ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i chos ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is called transformation is impermanent, it is a quality of the person and not a quality of the self.

original: gal te skyes bu de yongs su 'gyur na @74a * //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu de yongs su 'gyur na @74a * //
translated: If that person were to change,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: then the error would arise that consciousness would not exist because of its transformation. Therefore, that is also unacceptable.

original: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces dper na gzugs yod pa tsam gyis gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du blo yod ba tsam gyis skyes bu la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces dper na gzugs yod pa tsam gyis gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du blo yod ba tsam gyis skyes bu la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te ;
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhya says, ‚ÄúFor example, just as a reflection arises due to the mere presence of a form, in the same way, the mere presence of the mind gives rise to the consciousness of the mere person.

original: de yang gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i nang gi byed pa'i blo la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum las snying stobs shas che bar gyur pa na blo de la bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa'i nges pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de ltar blo la nges pa skyes pa yod pa tsam gyis dper na gzugs
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i nang gi byed pa'i blo la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum las snying stobs shas che bar gyur pa na blo de la bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa'i nges pa skye bar 'gyur zhing de ltar blo la nges pa skyes pa yod pa tsam gyis dper na gzugs
translated: When the mind that is a part of the nature of the person has an abundance of the quality of sattva, then the mind definitely generates the thought ‚ÄòI am different from others‚Äô and ‚ÄòI am different from my nature.‚Äô Just as a reflection arises due to the mere presence of a form, in the same way, the mere presence of the mind gives rise to the consciousness of the mere person.

original: yod na gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur bas skyes bu la thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: yod na gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du skyes bu la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur bas skyes bu la thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to the opponent‚Äôs position that ‚Äúthere is liberation for the person,‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary here states:

original: ci ste yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nang gi byed pa snying stobs shas che bar gyur pa na gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par gyur na yang /
analyzed: ci ste yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nang gi byed pa snying stobs shas che bar gyur pa na gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par gyur na yang /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the self is different from the other because it is the cause of the arising of the reflection, then even though you have ascertained that the self is different from the other and that the self is different from the nature,

original: de lta na yang nang gi byed pa la bye brag yod par zad kyi skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de lta na yang nang gi byed pa la bye brag yod par zad kyi skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: still the inner agent has different aspects, but the person does not have different aspects. Therefore there is no liberation.‚ÄùüîΩEven though the self is different from the other,üîΩand the self is different from the nature,

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i nang gi byed pa po'i blo la bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i nang gi byed pa po'i blo la bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: the self is still included within the nature.

original: rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa'i bye brag yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa'i bye brag yod par zad kyi /
translated: The difference is that the former is a conceptual cognition, whereas the latter is a nonconceptual cognition.üîΩ

original: skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa yang med do //
analyzed: skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa yang med do //
translated: But since there is no difference in the person, there is no liberation.

original: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs las gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo nges pa skye ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs las gzugs brnyan 'byung ba bzhin du rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo nges pa skye ste /
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄúJust as a reflection arises from form, so too a cognition that is a part of the nature arises.

original: sngar bcings pa'i gnas skabs las phyis thar pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sngar bcings pa'i gnas skabs las phyis thar pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yod pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on the difference between the prior state of being bound and the later state of being liberated,

original: skyes bu la yang bye brag yod par 'dod pas skyes bu thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: skyes bu la yang bye brag yod par 'dod pas skyes bu thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: we assert that there is a difference in the person. Therefore the person has liberation,‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the response to this prior position is drawn out from within the Autocommentary.

original: bye brag yod na yang skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bye brag yod na yang skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúEven if there is a difference, the previous error still applies.‚Äù

original: skyes bu la bye brag yod na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid med pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung @74b yang gzhan yang bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du
analyzed: skyes bu la bye brag yod na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid med pas shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur bas de yang mi rung @74b yang gzhan yang bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du
translated: Moreover, although the thought ‚ÄúThe self is one thing and the nature is another‚Äù

original: shes pa bzlog pa yod kyang /
analyzed: shes pa bzlog pa yod kyang /
translated: is reversed,

original: skyes bu la shes pa bzlog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /üîΩyang gzhan yang grangs can dag zer ba ltar rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo de la blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: skyes bu la shes pa bzlog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni / yang gzhan yang grangs can dag zer ba ltar rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo de la blo bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: the thought ‚ÄúThe person is one thing and consciousness is another‚Äù does not arise.üîΩMoreover, according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, when the thought ‚ÄúThe nature that belongs to the part of intelligence is one thing,

original: snying stobs dang ; rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa skyes pa'i dus na /
analyzed: snying stobs dang ; rdul dang / mun pa'i yon tan gsum cha mnyam pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa skyes pa'i dus na /
translated: and the nature that is the three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas is another‚Äù arises,

original: blo de la bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las bzlog pa rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems skye zhing shes pa bzlog pa de yod kyang skyes bu rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa de la shes pa bzlog pa mi skye
analyzed: blo de la bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las bzlog pa rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems skye zhing shes pa bzlog pa de yod kyang skyes bu rtag pa mi 'gyur ba snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa de la shes pa bzlog pa mi skye
translated: The mind that is liberated from the mind that is bound to that view arises.üîΩEven though the mind that is liberated from the mind that is bound to that view exists, the mind that is liberated from the mind that is bound to that view does not arise in the permanent, unchanging person who is not distinguished by being earlier or later.

original: ba'i phyir des na skyes bu de la sngon bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las bzlog pa rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi khyad par 'ga' yang mi skye bas de lta na yang skyes bu la thar pa med do //
analyzed: ba'i phyir des na skyes bu de la sngon bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las bzlog pa rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyi khyad par 'ga' yang mi skye bas de lta na yang skyes bu la thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore, even though the mind that is liberated from the mind that is bound to that view does not arise in the person, liberation does not exist for the person.

original: khyed rgya'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis thar pa 'dod pa de la yang zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: khyed rgya'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis thar pa 'dod pa de la yang zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though liberation exists for you‚Äù refers to the assertion of liberation by the Chinese master Ha shang.

original: grangs can dag rgya'i gzugs la brten nas 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul bzhin du gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: grangs can dag rgya'i gzugs la brten nas 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul bzhin du gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo des blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that just as a relief image arises in dependence on a mold, when the mind that is part of the nature of the self knows that the self is one thing and that sattva, rajas, and tamas are another,

original: blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la /
analyzed: blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la /
translated: then the mind alone is liberated.üîΩThe liberated mind, which is like a mold, gives rise to the knowledge of the person, which is like a relief image. In this way, they assert that the person also has liberation.

original: blo thar pa rgya'i gzugs lta bu de la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa'i shes ba skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la yang thar pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de mi 'thad par sun 'byin pa ston to //
analyzed: blo thar pa rgya'i gzugs lta bu de la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa'i shes ba skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la yang thar pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de mi 'thad par sun 'byin pa ston to //
translated: The following shows the refutation of that untenable assertion.

original: ji ltar de mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de mi 'thad ce na /
translated: How is it untenable?

original: de'i phyir / skyes bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa la phyis kyang shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skyes bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa la phyis kyang shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
translated: since a person is unchanging, the mind that is in the state of being bound is not reversed, and the mind that is in the state of liberation does not arise.

original: ma bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not reversed,

original: dper na phyi ma bzhin pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na phyi ma bzhin pas thar pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: liberation does not exist.

original: des ni skyes bu ni rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin pas snga nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems ma skyes pa yin pas de ltar skyes
analyzed: des ni skyes bu ni rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin pas snga nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems ma skyes pa yin pas de ltar skyes
translated: This is stated because a person is permanent and unchanging. Since the mind that is in the state of being bound is different in nature and characteristics from the mind that is in the state of liberation, the mind that is in the state of being bound is not reversed, and the mind that is in the state of liberation does not arise.

original: bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas @75a * //
analyzed: bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas @75a * //
translated: Since a person is unchanging,

original: ma bzlog pa yin pa de la /
analyzed: ma bzlog pa yin pa de la /
translated: it is not reversed.

original: phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
analyzed: phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
translated: Later, a nonerroneous consciousness that is alone does not arise.

original: snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs phyi ma rnam par grol zin pa la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid pa bzhin pas de'i phyir rgya'i gzugs la brten nas 'bur gyi gzugs
analyzed: snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs phyi ma rnam par grol zin pa la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid pa bzhin pas de'i phyir rgya'i gzugs la brten nas 'bur gyi gzugs
translated: in the same way, in dependence on the form of a mold, the form of a cast arises.

original: brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul bzhin du gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la ;
analyzed: brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul bzhin du gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i blo bdag kyang gzhan la snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa de'i tshe na blo de la 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye bas blo nyid thar pa yin la ;
translated: When one understands that the mind that belongs to the category of nature is different from the self and that the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas is different, at that time a consciousness that is a mere consciousness arises in that mind. Therefore the mind itself is liberation.

original: blo thar pa rgya'i gzugs lta bu de la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la yang thar pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de mi 'thad pas skyes bu la thar
analyzed: blo thar pa rgya'i gzugs lta bu de la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la yang thar pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de mi 'thad pas skyes bu la thar
translated: In dependence on the liberated mind, which is like a mold, a consciousness that is a mere reflection of the person arises.üîΩSince this assertion that the person has liberation is untenable, the person does not have liberation.

original: pa med do zhes ston te /
analyzed: pa med do zhes ston te /
translated: In response, the present stanza explains that since it is untenable to assert that the person has liberation, the person does not have liberation.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The stanza is to be applied to the subject, the probandum, the proof, the example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na sngon rnam par ma grol ba'i gnas skabs la ltos te /
analyzed: dper na sngon rnam par ma grol ba'i gnas skabs la ltos te /
translated: For example, in dependence on the prior state of nonliberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs phyi ma rnam par grol zin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs phyi ma rnam par grol zin pa ni /
translated: the later state of liberation is already liberated in dependence on the prior state of nonliberation.

original: rnam par grol ba tshun chad nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gzhan ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba tshun chad nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gzhan ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because, from the very beginning, the mind of the liberated state has not been averted from the mind of the bound state, and the mind of the liberated state has not arisen as something other than the mind of the bound state.

original: de la phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid pas /
analyzed: de la phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid pas /
translated: Therefore, later on, too, it is impossible for a consciousness that is exclusively nonerroneous to arise.

original: de la thar pa med pa de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin pa snga nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas
analyzed: de la thar pa med pa de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i skyes bu rtag pa 'gyur ba med pa rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid yin pa snga nas bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas
translated: Just as there is no liberation in that [mind], in the same way, the permanent person imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, which is something different in nature and characteristics from the mind of the bound state, has not been averted from the mind of the bound state from the very beginning.

original: skabs kyi sems ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa de yang bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gzhan ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir de la
analyzed: skabs kyi sems ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa de yang bcings pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las ma bzlog cing rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems gzhan ma skyes pa'i tshul gyis snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir de la
translated: The mind that is not previously reversed through the nonarising of the mind at the time of bondage is not reversed through the nonarising of the mind that is liberated at the time of liberation.

original: phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor pa skye mi srid pas /
analyzed: phyis kyang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor pa skye mi srid pas /
translated: Therefore, later on, a nonmistaken consciousness that is solely aware of the person is impossible.

original: de la thar pa med do //
analyzed: de la thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore, liberation does not exist for the person.

original: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rgya'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis @75b skyes bu la thar pa yod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rgya'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis @75b skyes bu la thar pa yod par 'dod pas /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas may say, ‚ÄúWe assert that liberation exists for the person in the manner of the arising of a reflection of the person.

original: des na skyes bu snga nas ma bzlog pa yin yang phyis de blo rgya'i gzugs lta bu la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la thar pa yod
analyzed: des na skyes bu snga nas ma bzlog pa yin yang phyis de blo rgya'i gzugs lta bu la brten nas skyes bu la yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu skye ba'i tshul gyis skyes bu la thar pa yod
translated: Therefore, although the person is not previously reversed, later on, in dependence on the reflection of the person, a nonmistaken consciousness that is solely aware of the person arises in the manner of the arising of a relief image. Therefore liberation exists for the person.‚Äù

original: par 'gyur bas khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: par 'gyur bas khyed kyi sgrub pa snga ma de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: Therefore, your former proofs do not harm our position.

original: 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: shes pa skyes nas yang 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes pa skyes nas yang 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because consciousness would arise and then change, the error of consciousness not existing and so on would ensue.

original: de ltar sngon 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba ma skyes pa las phyis skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar sngon 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi shes pa ma nor ba ma skyes pa las phyis skyes par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if consciousness that is only prior and that is nonerroneous arises later,

original: de lta na skyes bu la 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bya ba dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na skyes bu la 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bya ba dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: then because the person would change, the errors of consciousness not existing, being impermanent, and being active would ensue.

original: 'dir gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'dir gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces gang gi tshe /
translated: Here, if the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúWhen consciousness is manifest,

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi byed pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa dag gi chos gzugs 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag skye ba med par mthong ba de'i tshe na nang gi byed pa rnams yul la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid thar pa yin
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi byed pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa dag gi chos gzugs 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag skye ba med par mthong ba de'i tshe na nang gi byed pa rnams yul la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid thar pa yin
translated: When one sees that the arising of the phenomena of the internal agents such as the eyes and so on, which are part of one‚Äôs nature, such as apprehending form and so on, does not exist, at that time the internal agents do not engage with objects, and that itself is liberation.üîΩAt that time, since the person is also liberated, therefore liberation exists for the person.

original: la / de'i tshe na skyes bu yang zhar la thar bas de'i phyir skyes bu la yang thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /üîΩ'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: la / de'i tshe na skyes bu yang zhar la thar bas de'i phyir skyes bu la yang thar pa yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du / 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: rje dpon rgyal ba bzhin du skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rje dpon rgyal ba bzhin du skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
translated: The phenomena of the agent such as apprehending and so on are imputed to the person just as the king is imputed to the royal assembly.

original: thar pa nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thar pa nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore liberation is imputed to the person.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa nang gi byed pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa dag gi chos gzugs 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag skye ba med par mthong bas de'i tshe na /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa nang gi byed pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa dag gi chos gzugs 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag skye ba med par mthong bas de'i tshe na /
translated: Thus, when one sees that the internal agents such as the eye and so on, which are the parts of the person, do not generate the phenomena such as the apprehension of form and so on, then at that time

original: nang gi byed pa rnams yul la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid thar pa yin la /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa rnams yul la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid thar pa yin la /
translated: the internal agents do not engage objects, and that itself is liberation.üîΩAt that time, if the person also desires liberation, then the phenomena of the agent such as the apprehension of form and so on are liberated.

original: de'i tshe na skyes bu yang zhar la thar pa 'dod na de ltar byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag thar pas skyes bu thar par 'dod pa de ni dper na g-yog 'khor dag gis pha rol gyi yul 'khor las rgyal bar byas pa rje dponüîΩla nye bar btags te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na skyes bu yang zhar la thar pa 'dod na de ltar byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag thar pas skyes bu thar par 'dod pa de ni dper na g-yog 'khor dag gis pha rol gyi yul 'khor las rgyal bar byas pa rje dpon la nye bar btags te /
translated: For example, when the retinue of servants conquers the lands of others, they impute the victory to their lord.üîΩSaying, ‚ÄúThe lord has won!‚Äù

original: rje dpon rgyal bar gyur to zhes zer ba ni rje dpon la nye bar btags pa'i phyir rgyal ba de rje dpon dngos kyi @76a * //
analyzed: rje dpon rgyal bar gyur to zhes zer ba ni rje dpon la nye bar btags pa'i phyir rgyal ba de rje dpon dngos kyi @76a * //
translated: because they impute the victory to the lord, the actual victor is the lord.

original: ma yin pa de bzhin du byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag thar par gyur pa skyes bu la nye bar btags te skyes bu thar par 'dod pa de yang skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin pa de bzhin du byed po'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag thar par gyur pa skyes bu la nye bar btags te skyes bu thar par 'dod pa de yang skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as that is not so, in the same way, the attributes of the creator, such as grasping, are imputed to the person who has attained liberation. The assertion that the person attains liberation is also imputed to the person.

original: thar pa de skyes bu dngos kyi ma yin pas skyes bu la thar pa med do //
analyzed: thar pa de skyes bu dngos kyi ma yin pas skyes bu la thar pa med do //
translated: Since liberation is not the actual person, the person does not have liberation.

original: de ltar rang bzhin yang thar par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin yang thar par mi 'thad la /
translated: Thus it is untenable that the person is liberated.

original: skyes bu yang thar par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu yang thar par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is untenable that the person is liberated,

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva says:

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
translated: If the so-called self exists,

original: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
translated: It is not tenable to say ‚ÄúI am selfless.‚Äù

original: yang na de nyid rtogs pa 'am //
analyzed: yang na de nyid rtogs pa 'am //
translated: Or if you realize that,

original: mya ngan 'da' ba nges brdzun 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' ba nges brdzun 'gyur //
translated: Then nirvana is definitely false.

original: zhes gsungs pas grub po //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas grub po //
translated: This is established.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is sufficient as a digression. The context itself should be analyzed.

original: brtag pa gong ma'i mjug bsdu ba dang / 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa'i tshig yin no /
analyzed: brtag pa gong ma'i mjug bsdu ba dang / 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa'i tshig yin no /
translated: This is a summary of the previous investigation and an introduction to the next investigation.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa des de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir /üîΩnang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa des de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir / nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: Thus, the yogi who strives to realize the thatness of the inner and outer bases of perception realizes them to be emptiness.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
translated: By the verse, ‚ÄúWhen the ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine‚Äô are extinguished with regard to the inner and outer,

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: the appropriated will cease,

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
translated: and through its extinction, birth will be extinguished,‚Äù

original: ces bya bas ni de ltar rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtogs pa dang ldan pas phyi dang nang gi 'du byed rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med par gyur pa /
analyzed: ces bya bas ni de ltar rnal 'byor pa gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtogs pa dang ldan pas phyi dang nang gi 'du byed rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med par gyur pa /
translated: the yogi who wishes to see the thatness of the selflessness of persons, who is endowed with thorough understanding, will not grasp inner and outer formations as the ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gang zag bdag med par chud pa'i 'bras bu ston te /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med par chud pa'i 'bras bu ston te /
translated: This shows the result of comprehending the selflessness of persons.üîΩThus, when the grasping of the ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù with regard to the inner and outer is extinguished,

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang bdag gi zhes bya ba de la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang bdag gi zhes bya ba de la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na /
translated: the appropriated will cease.

original: nye bar len par byed pa dang nye bar blang bar bya ba med pas nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi yang 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nye bar len par byed pa dang nye bar blang bar bya ba med pas nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi yang 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since there is no appropriator and nothing to be appropriated, the four types of appropriation also cease.

original: nye bar len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags pas skye ba zad par gyur pa de ni thar pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags pas skye ba zad par gyur pa de ni thar pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since appropriation ceases, existence ceases, and since existence ceases, birth is extinguished. That is called liberation.

original: de nyid gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That is the result of realizing the reality of the selflessness of persons.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that reality in detail,üîΩit says:

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na /
translated: Thus, when the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù in regard to the internal and external is extinguished,

original: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: the four types of appropriation‚Äîdesire, view, morality, and discipline, and the assertion of self‚Äîcease.

original: de la re zhig bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas ni @76b bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas ni @76b bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: First, by seeing selflessness, one abandons the appropriation of the self.

original: de spangs pas nye bar len pa lhag ma rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de spangs pas nye bar len pa lhag ma rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By abandoning that, one also abandons the remaining appropriations.

original: de dag ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i skye gnas can yin pa'i phyir ro //
