analyzed: de dag ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i skye gnas can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are born from the appropriation of the self.

original: nye bar len pa 'gag pa'i phyir de'i skye gnas las byung ba'i srid pa zad par 'gyur bas de zad pas na skye ba zad de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag pa'i phyir de'i skye gnas las byung ba'i srid pa zad par 'gyur bas de zad pas na skye ba zad de /
translated: Since appropriation ceases, the existence that arises from that birth ceases. Since that ceases, birth ceases.

original: de ni thar pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni thar pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is called liberation.

original: de ni gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang zag bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That is the result of realizing the reality of the selflessness of persons.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: thar pa de yang gang zag bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyon thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thar pa de yang gang zag bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir 'phags pa nyon thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that liberation is for ƒÅryas, that is, ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, because they see the selflessness of persons.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'thob ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'thob ste /
translated: Those who go by the vehicle of the Buddha attain it by abandoning the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi thar pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi thar pa ni /
translated: The methods for abandoning the afflictive obstructions are just those that have been taught.

original: sgrib pa rnam gnyis spangs pas 'thob po zhes khyad par du bstan cing /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam gnyis spangs pas 'thob po zhes khyad par du bstan cing /
translated: This teaches that liberation, Buddhahood, is attained by abandoning the two obstructions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni theg pa gsum char gyi yang thun mong yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni theg pa gsum char gyi yang thun mong yin te /
translated: The methods for abandoning the afflictive obstructions are common to all three vehicles.

original: de ni 'di yan chad du ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'di yan chad du ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Those are the methods that have been taught up to this point.

original: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bstsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas gang zag bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bstsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas gang zag bdag med pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by refuting the proofs of others and by teaching the faultless proofs of one‚Äôs own position, the selflessness of persons is taught.

original: da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bstsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pas chos bdag med pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bstsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pas chos bdag med pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, having refuted the proofs stated by others, I will teach the selflessness of phenomena by showing my own faultless proof.

original: chos bdag med pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spong zhing /
analyzed: chos bdag med pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spong zhing /
translated: The selflessness of phenomena eliminates the obscurations to omniscience,

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pas de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pas de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin te /
translated: and since it is attained by attaining unsurpassed transcendent wisdom, it is not shared in common with sravakas and so on.

original: de thob pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de thob pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the method for attaining it,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ni 'di bshad de /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ni 'di bshad de /
translated: this is explained in order to eliminate the obscurations to omniscience.

original: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Liberation is due to the exhaustion of karma and affliction.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and affliction arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from mental fabrication.

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Mental fabrication ceases due to emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs smras te /üîΩ'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs smras te / 'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the context of the above verses.üîΩHere, since karma and affliction are the causes of birth,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: liberation is due to the exhaustion of karma and affliction.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, those actions and afflictions arise from unreal imagination.

original: @77a * // ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @77a * // ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist by intrinsic reality.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: Among them, the afflictions arise from incorrect imagination.

original: ji ltar yul gcig kho na la yang la la ni chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yul gcig kho na la yang la la ni chags par 'gyur /
translated: For example, with regard to a single object, some become attached,

original: la la ni sdang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: la la ni sdang bar 'gyur /
translated: some become angry,

original: la la ni rmongs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: la la ni rmongs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ngo //
translated: and some become ignorant. Therefore, the afflictions arise from imagination.

original: las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa dag yin te /
translated: Actions are the formative actions of body, speech, and mind that are associated with an afflicted mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag ma rig pa dang ldan pa ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du bya bdag kyang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bka' stsal pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag ma rig pa dang ldan pa ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du bya bdag kyang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bka' stsal pas /
translated: The Lord has said, ‚ÄúThe person who is ignorant, who is engaged in the performance of meritorious and non-meritorious actions, is also engaged in the performance of actions that are neither meritorious nor non-meritorious.‚Äù

original: las kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: las kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, actions also arise from unreal imagination.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i spros pa las byung ngo ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i spros pa las byung ngo ;
translated: Those imaginations arise from the proliferation of conceptualization, which is the adherence to the idea that the things of the world, such as gain and loss, are real.

original: / spros pa de ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / spros pa de ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: That proliferation ceases through emptiness.

original: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang stong pa nyid shes pa skyes na de'i 'jig rten pa'i spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang stong pa nyid shes pa skyes na de'i 'jig rten pa'i spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one realizes emptiness, which is the characteristic of the selflessness of phenomena, and when the knowledge of emptiness arises, the proliferation of the world ceases.

original: de lta bas na chos bdag med pa stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin la stong pa nyid bsgom pa kho nas ni de kho na rtogs shing shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos bdag med pa stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin la stong pa nyid bsgom pa kho nas ni de kho na rtogs shing shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the objective selflessness of things is reality, and by meditating on emptiness alone, one realizes and knows reality and abandons the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i thar pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i thar pa ste /
translated: That is the liberation not shared by sravakas and so on.

original: chos bdag med pa'i de kho na bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i de kho na bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is the unexcelled intuition itself, the result of meditating on the reality of objective selflessness.

original: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: zhes gsungs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: las dang nyon mong pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag zad pas /
analyzed: las dang nyon mong pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag zad pas /
translated: Since karma and afflictions are the causes of birth, through their exhaustion,

original: sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni thar pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni thar pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: one is liberated from suffering.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ci las 'byung ba de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ci las 'byung ba de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the origin of those karma and afflictions, he says:

original: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ni yul rnams las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ni yul rnams las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Those karmas and afflictions that are the causes of birth do not arise from objects.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yul rnams yod kyang de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yul rnams yod kyang de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those karmas and afflictions do not exist for those free from attachment, even though objects exist for them.

original: 'o na ci las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci las 'byung zhe na /
translated: If that is so, from what do they arise?

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Karmas and afflictions arise from discrimination.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sdug pa dang mi sdug par kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par @77b rtog pa dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sdug pa dang mi sdug par kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par @77b rtog pa dag las 'byung ste /
translated: Karmas and afflictions arise from discriminations that are characterized by the conception of the attractive and the unattractive.

original: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because they arise when those discriminations exist.

original: 'di na gang yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood that when something exists, that which arises is caused by it.

original: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod na las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni
analyzed: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod na las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni
translated: For example, just as a sprout arises when a seed exists, so too karma and afflictions arise when there is the conception called the non-noble, improper attention.

original: / de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: / de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe bstan to //
translated: This shows the example of its concomitance.

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pas de la de dag kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pas de la de dag kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: When there is no conception, they do not arise,üîΩjust as in the case of an ƒÅrya being.

original: dper na 'phags pa'i rgyud bzhin no zhes bya bas ni de'i ldog pa'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa'i rgyud bzhin no zhes bya bas ni de'i ldog pa'i dpe bstan to //
translated: This shows the example of its reversal.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the characteristics of karma and affliction,

original: de la las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: karma is the mental formation of the afflicted mind and the engagement of body and speech motivated by it.

original: nyon mongs pa ni sems can gyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sems can gyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa dag ste /
translated: Afflictions are those that afflict the mindstream of sentient beings.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Desire and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag ci las 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag ci las 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the origin of those conceptualizations,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni spros pa las 'byung bas de dag spros las byung zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni spros pa las 'byung bas de dag spros las byung zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThose causes of karma and affliction are conceptualizations, and they arise from mental fabrication.‚Äù

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: They arise from mental fabrication that has the characteristic of adherence to the conventional truth.

original: spros pa de gang gis 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa de gang gis 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate by what means that mental fabrication ceases,

original: spros pa de yang gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa de yang gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBy what means does that mental fabrication cease?‚Äù

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Mental fabrication ceases through emptiness.

original: rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The word ‚Äúrealization‚Äù is implied.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the cessation of mental fabrication through the realization of emptiness,üîΩhe says,

original: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is stopped by realizing the reality of the objective selflessness.

original: des ni chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pas spros pa 'gag par bstan to /
analyzed: des ni chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pas spros pa 'gag par bstan to /
translated: This shows that the cessation of fabrication is due to the realization of emptiness, the reality of the objective selflessness.

original: // yang na /
analyzed: // yang na /
translated: Or else,üîΩüîΩ

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: it is stopped by emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid shes pa ste /üîΩstong pa nyid shes pa skyes na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa @78a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid shes pa ste / stong pa nyid shes pa skyes na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa @78a * //
translated: emptiness is the knowledge of emptiness.üîΩWhen the knowledge of emptiness arises, it is stopped.

original: nyid shes pa skyes na spros pa 'gag par bstan te /
analyzed: nyid shes pa skyes na spros pa 'gag par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the cessation of fabrication is due to the arising of the knowledge of emptiness, the reality of the objective selflessness.

original: de ltar chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang stong pa nyid shes pa skyes pas spros pa 'gag pa de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i thar pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang stong pa nyid shes pa skyes pas spros pa 'gag pa de ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i thar pa ste /
translated: Thus, the liberation that is not shared with the sravakas, etc. is the cessation of fabrication due to the realization of emptiness, the reality of the objective selflessness, and due to the arising of the knowledge of emptiness.

original: chos bdag med pa'i de kho na bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i de kho na bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
translated: The result of meditating on the reality of the selflessness of phenomena is the unexcelled intuition itself.

original: gal te gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas sdug pa dang mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa de dag nye bar zhi ba 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas sdug pa dang mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa de dag nye bar zhi ba 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If the mere seeing of the selflessness of the person were to accomplish the pacification of karma and addictions that arise from the discrimination of the agreeable and disagreeable,

original: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then the seeing of the selflessness of phenomena would be pointless.

original: pha rol po dag na re theg pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba ni thun mong yin la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re theg pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba ni thun mong yin la /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs position, which means that the liberation of the three vehicles is common,

original: de yang gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong pa kho nas 'khrul pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tha tshig yin no //
analyzed: de yang gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong pa kho nas 'khrul pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tha tshig yin no //
translated: and that since that is so, the seeing of the selflessness of phenomena is pointless, because the mere seeing of the selflessness of the person is sufficient to eliminate error.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs nas dbyung bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs nas dbyung bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they wish to completely and totally eradicate the net of afflictions along with their traces.

original: de yang chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa can yang des spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa can yang des spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it is impossible to do so without seeing the selflessness of phenomena and because the antidote, the self-arisen wisdom that unmistakenly comprehends the object of all phenomena, is also to be eliminated by that,

original: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that seeing the selflessness of phenomena is not meaningless.

original: theg pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba thun mong yin zhing de gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas 'grub tu zin kyang bla na med pa'i theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba thun mong yin zhing de gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas 'grub tu zin kyang bla na med pa'i theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The liberation of the three vehicles is common, and although it is already accomplished by merely seeing the selflessness of persons, the tenet of those who proceed by the unsurpassed vehicle is the perfection of wisdom.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin par 'dod la /üîΩye shes phun sum tshogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs phyung bas rab tu phye ba de yang chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i shes pa gang la gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa yod pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba de yang chos bdag med
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin par 'dod la / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs phyung bas rab tu phye ba de yang chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i shes pa gang la gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa yod pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba de yang chos bdag med
translated: It is asserted that the perfection of elimination is distinguished by the perfection of wisdom, which is distinguished by the complete uprooting of the web of affliction together with their latent states.üîΩThat perfection of wisdom is impossible without seeing the selflessness of phenomena, and the perfection of elimination is distinguished by the elimination of the nonafflictive consciousness that has as its object the antidote, selfarisen wisdom, which is the unmistaken understanding of all phenomena.

original: pa @78b nyid mthong bas de spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa @78b nyid mthong bas de spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That perfection of elimination is eliminated by seeing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i sgo 'di nas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'thob pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba'i sgo 'di nas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba'i 'bras bu bla na med pa 'thob pa'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this door of seeing the selflessness of phenomena, one attains the unsurpassed fruition that is distinguished by the perfection of exalted wisdom and the perfection of abandonment. Therefore, seeing the selflessness of phenomena is not meaningless.

original: de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni thar pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni thar pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Thus, emptiness, which has the characteristic of the complete pacification of all elaborations, is liberation. This is the conclusion.

original: theg pa chen po la mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid du shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid du shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the Mahayana, nirvana is understood to be the emptiness of the conditioned. This is what it means.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the source of that,

original: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Aryadeva‚Äôs composition is presented.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
analyzed: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
translated: In brief, phenomena are harmless;

original: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //üîΩ'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid // 'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
translated: Nirvana is emptiness.üîΩIn this regard, the Tathagatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: Have said that these two are alone.

original: zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis theg pa chen po 'di la mdor bsdu na dge ba'i chos ni srog chags rnams la mi 'tshe ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis theg pa chen po 'di la mdor bsdu na dge ba'i chos ni srog chags rnams la mi 'tshe ba yin te /
translated: In brief, the virtue of the TathƒÅgatas in the MahƒÅyƒÅna is not harming living beings.

original: des ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan la /
analyzed: des ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan la /
translated: This teaches conventional truth.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid du shes pa yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid du shes pa yin te /
translated: Nirvana is the knowledge of conditioned emptiness.

original: des ni don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pas /
analyzed: des ni don dam pa'i bden pa bstan pas /
translated: This teaches ultimate truth.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la mdor bsdus na /üîΩdon gyi dmigs ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig tu 'dus so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la mdor bsdus na / don gyi dmigs ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig tu 'dus so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no /
translated: In brief, the MahƒÅyƒÅnaüîΩis subsumed in just these two topics.

original: // / bam po drug cu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug cu gcig pa /
translated: Therefore, in this way, emptiness, which is characterized by the complete pacification of all elaborations, is nirvana.

original: mu stegs can kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas say:

original: 'di la khyed kyi ston pas mdo sde las //
analyzed: 'di la khyed kyi ston pas mdo sde las //
translated: In this regard, your teacher said in the s≈´tras:

original: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
translated: I am my own protector;

original: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
translated: Who else could be my protector?

original: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
translated: Through the wise one‚Äôs own good discipline,

original: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs shing /
analyzed: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs shing /
translated: he will also attain the higher realms.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: sems can 'khor bar zhugs pa ni //
analyzed: sems can 'khor bar zhugs pa ni //
translated: Sentient beings who enter sa·πÉsƒÅra

original: sdug bsngal las ni rnam mi 'grol //üîΩzhes kyang gsungs pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni rnam mi 'grol // zhes kyang gsungs pas /
translated: are not liberated from suffering.

original: khyed bdag med do zhes smra ba la khas blangs pa snga mas gnod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khyed bdag med do zhes smra ba la khas blangs pa snga mas gnod par 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, since your statement ‚Äúthe self does not exist‚Äù is undermined by your earlier assertion,

original: de'i phyir bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: therefore your inference refuting the self is not established.

original: de ltar gzugs bdag med pa nyid bstan pa la /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs bdag med pa nyid bstan pa la /
translated: Thus, when the selflessness of form is taught,

original: 'dir gzhan mu stegs can @79a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan mu stegs can @79a * //
translated: here, other tƒ´rthikas,

original: dag gis skyon gzhan ma mthong nas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dag gis skyon gzhan ma mthong nas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: not seeing any other fault, say that your assertion is undermined.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: sems can gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bas blo gros nyams pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bas blo gros nyams pa /
translated: Those sentient beings whose minds are impaired by the view that denies cause and effect

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: say, ‚ÄúThis world does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: There is no next world.

original: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There is no ripening of the fruits of good and bad actions.üîΩThere are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba la mngon par zhen pa rtag tu mi dge ba mngon par 'du bya ba la gzhol ba'i yid dang ldan pa ngan song gi g-yang sa chen po'i 'gram na gnas pa dag yod pas /
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba la mngon par zhen pa rtag tu mi dge ba mngon par 'du bya ba la gzhol ba'i yid dang ldan pa ngan song gi g-yang sa chen po'i 'gram na gnas pa dag yod pas /
translated: Thus, they are always intent on creating nonvirtue, and they stand on the edge of the great abyss of the lower realms.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la phan gdags par bzhed pa gzhan la phan pa bskyed pa'i thugs dam mnga' ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la phan gdags par bzhed pa gzhan la phan pa bskyed pa'i thugs dam mnga' ba /
translated: Therefore, the Lord Buddhas, who wish to help them, who are intent on benefiting others,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun la brten nas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun la brten nas /
translated: and who see, based on the continuum of mind and mental factors,

original: phyi ma la de dag gi rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs pa rnams kyis tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang gis bdag yod do zhes kyang gdags par mdzad pas de'i phyir /üîΩbdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
analyzed: phyi ma la de dag gi rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs pa rnams kyis tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang gis bdag yod do zhes kyang gdags par mdzad pas de'i phyir / bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
translated: that their continuum will not be interrupted in the future, have designated the existence of a self by the power of conventional truth.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The self is designated.

original: sems can gang dag bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bya ba la rang dbang can dang / za ba po yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa dag yod do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bya ba la rang dbang can dang / za ba po yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa dag yod do //
translated: There are sentient beings who conceive of the self as permanent, omnipresent, the agent of virtue and nonvirtue, and the experiencer.

original: de dag bdag tu log par lta ba'i thag pas sems bcings shing /
analyzed: de dag bdag tu log par lta ba'i thag pas sems bcings shing /
translated: They are bound by the rope of the view of the self.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i yul la bdag med pa'i lta ba ma bskyed pas /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo'i yul la bdag med pa'i lta ba ma bskyed pas /
translated: They have not generated the view of selflessness with regard to the body, the sense faculties, and the objects of the mind.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis shin tu ring du song yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis shin tu ring du song yang /
translated: Even though they have gone very far by the power of meditative concentration and meditative equipoise,

original: bya rkang pa bshal thag gis bcings pa thag ring por song yang phyir lhung ba bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag las rnam par mi 'grol bar thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: bya rkang pa bshal thag gis bcings pa thag ring por song yang phyir lhung ba bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag las rnam par mi 'grol bar thugs su chud nas /
translated: like a bird whose legs are bound by a thong, they fall back and are not liberated from the suffering of birth and so on.

original: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i thag pa bcad pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i thag pa bcad pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: Having understood this, the Buddha, in order to sever the rope of the view of the self and thereby pacify suffering,

original: phung po lnga la bdag med do zhes kyang bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lnga la bdag med do zhes kyang bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /
translated: He also taught that the five aggregates are selfless.üîΩTherefore,

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He also taught that there is no self.

original: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po shin tu nye bar bsags pa /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po shin tu nye bar bsags pa /
translated: Those who have accumulated the roots of virtue to a great extent,

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa /
translated: whose faculties are mature,

original: zab cing rgya ched la mos pa /
analyzed: zab cing rgya ched la mos pa /
translated: who are devoted to the profound and vast,

original: @79b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i bshad pa bdud rtsi'i snod du gyur pa de dag la ni /
analyzed: @79b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i bshad pa bdud rtsi'i snod du gyur pa de dag la ni /
translated: who are vessels for the nectar-like explanation that realizes omniscience,

original: 'dus byas ngo bo nyid stong pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang chu zla lta bur thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: 'dus byas ngo bo nyid stong pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang chu zla lta bur thugs su chud nas /
translated: understand that compounded phenomena are empty of their own essence, like a dream, an optical illusion, or the moon in water.

original: don dam par bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: don dam par bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas taught that ultimately neither a self nor selflessness exists in the least.üîΩTherefore,

original: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The buddhas taught that neither a self nor selflessness exists.

original: bdag dang bdag med par rnam par brtag pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med par rnam par brtag pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because the basis of the imputation of self and selflessness, an entity, does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tha snyad du bdag khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la mi gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tha snyad du bdag khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la mi gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since we conventionally accept the self in this way, it is not harmed by the refutation of the self that is the object of negation.

original: des ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kun rdzob tu gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir bdag yod par yang bstan /
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kun rdzob tu gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir bdag yod par yang bstan /
translated: The Lord Buddha himself taught the existence of the self conventionally for the sake of disciples.

original: bdag med par yang bstan /
analyzed: bdag med par yang bstan /
translated: He taught selflessness.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par yang bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par yang bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: He taught that neither self nor selflessness exists.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: med dang yod dang gnyis ka dang // gnyi ga min pa'ang ston mdzad de //üîΩnad kyi dbang gis nges par ni //
analyzed: med dang yod dang gnyis ka dang // gnyi ga min pa'ang ston mdzad de // nad kyi dbang gis nges par ni //
translated: He taught nonexistence, existence, both, and neither.üîΩJust as medicine is prescribed

original: sman ni 'phrod par 'gyur ba bzhin //
analyzed: sman ni 'phrod par 'gyur ba bzhin //
translated: in accordance with the illness,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: so is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: gal te de ni don dam par bstan pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: gal te de ni don dam par bstan pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re /
translated: If you say that is not an answer because it teaches the ultimate,

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par bdag yod par bstan pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir khyod kyis de med par bsal bas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon ma spangs pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par bdag yod par bstan pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir khyod kyis de med par bsal bas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon ma spangs pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: then the opponents say, ‚ÄúThat is not an answer because it does not avoid the fault of contradicting your assertion that the self does not exist, since those words of the BhagavƒÅn teach that the self exists ultimately.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here, ‚ÄúThat is not an answer.‚ÄùüîΩBecause a s≈´tra says,

original: lung las / 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
analyzed: lung las / 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
translated: Here there is no self or sentient being,

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
translated: These phenomena have causes.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyod kyis ma smras pa'i phyir dang / bdag dgag par nus pa'i sgrub pa kho bos bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyod kyis ma smras pa'i phyir dang / bdag dgag par nus pa'i sgrub pa kho bos bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And because you have not stated an inference that teaches that the self exists and because I have taught a proof that is able to refute the self.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyed kyis bdag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma smras pa'i phyir dang kho bos bdag dgag par nus pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩkhas blangs pa la mi gnod pas de ni rigs @80a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyed kyis bdag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma smras pa'i phyir dang kho bos bdag dgag par nus pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir / khas blangs pa la mi gnod pas de ni rigs @80a * //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught selflessness ultimately, and you have not stated an inference that teaches the existence of a self, and I have taught a proof that can refute a self.

original: pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this does not contradict what is accepted, it is not illogical.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don gzhan du bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the meaning of the previous verse can be explained in another way,

original: yang na gzhan du brtag ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du brtag ste /
translated: it is also to be analyzed in another way.

original: mu stegs byed kha cig 'du byed bdag med pa skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i ngang can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na las dad 'bras bu med par btags nas 'jigs par gyur pa dag gis bdag yodüîΩdo zhes kyang btags pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kha cig 'du byed bdag med pa skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i ngang can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na las dad 'bras bu med par btags nas 'jigs par gyur pa dag gis bdag yod do zhes kyang btags pas de'i phyir /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas imagine that if the self does not exist in the aggregates, which are momentary and disintegrate in every instant, or if it does not definitely endure for another time, then karma and its result would not exist.üîΩThey imagine this and are frightened.üîΩTherefore they imagine that the self exists.

original: bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
analyzed: bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
translated: Therefore it is also imagined that it is the self.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan gang dag 'di ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag 'di ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
translated: Others say: This is merely a collection of body, sense faculties, and mind.

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis med de /üîΩsems su bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa nges par mi gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rig nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la rmongs pa /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis med de / sems su bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa nges par mi gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rig nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la rmongs pa /
translated: Here, the self does not exist inherently as the cause and effect of actions,üîΩand it is not tenable that this cycle of existence exists for these things that are not self-sufficient, that are not permanent, and that are not counted as mind.üîΩHaving understood this, the ignorant,

original: ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba ;
analyzed: ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba ;
translated: who are confused about the relation between cause and effect,üîΩsay, ‚ÄúThe person is only the domain of the sense faculties.

original: / skyes bu'ang de tsam nyid du zad //
analyzed: / skyes bu'ang de tsam nyid du zad //
translated: The person is just that much.‚Äù

original: sngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba //
analyzed: sngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba //
translated: Those who are dark and say much,

original: de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
analyzed: de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
translated: are like the tracks of a wolf.

original: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
analyzed: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
translated: O beautiful one, enjoy and eat

original: lus mchog khyed 'das gang de med //
analyzed: lus mchog khyed 'das gang de med //
translated: the supreme body, for there is nothing beyond it.üîΩHaving gone to a frightening place, do not return.

original: 'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus pa tsam du zad //
analyzed: 'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus pa tsam du zad //
translated: This body is merely a collection.

original: ces zer ba dag gis lus dang dbang po la bdag med do zhes kyang bstan pas /üîΩde'i phyir / bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
analyzed: ces zer ba dag gis lus dang dbang po la bdag med do zhes kyang bstan pas / de'i phyir / bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
translated: Since it is also taught that the self does not exist in the body and faculties,üîΩit is said,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is also taught that there is no self.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha, whose knowledge of all phenomena is not hidden,üîΩtaught that neither a self nor selflessness exists.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //üîΩbdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni // bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
translated: the buddhas have taught that

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: neither a self nor selflessness exists.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na spros pa med pa nyid legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par 'dzin pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na spros pa med pa nyid legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par 'dzin pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: This is because he fully understood the reality of all phenomena to be free of elaborations, because he abandoned the grasping of self and selflessness, and because he knew that the cause for engaging in the conception of self and selflessness does not exist.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas gzugs la sogs pa dag la kun tu mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas gzugs la sogs pa dag la kun tu mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because of the non-imagination of form, etc. due to the superimposition of self and selflessness.

original: des ni mu stegs bdag tu smra ba kha cig gis @80b ni bdag yod par bstan la /
analyzed: des ni mu stegs bdag tu smra ba kha cig gis @80b ni bdag yod par bstan la /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas who propound the self teach the existence of the self.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis ni bdag med par bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis ni bdag med par bstan gyi /
translated: Some LokƒÅyatas teach selflessness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med pa bstan to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med pa bstan to zhes bshad do //
translated: But the BhagavƒÅn Buddha teaches that neither self nor selflessness exists at all.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the Bhagavatƒ´ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: is quoted in the SubƒÅhupariprcchƒÅs≈´tra:

original: de ltar yang ji skad du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ji skad du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, as it is said, ‚ÄúForm is neither self nor not self.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a self or not a non-self.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a self or not a non-self is the perfection of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩAs for what was said, ‚ÄúElaboration ceases through emptiness,‚Äù how elaboration ceases through emptiness should be explained as follows.

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste zhes bya bas ni sngar /üîΩlas dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste zhes bya bas ni sngar / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: It was taught above:

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.üîΩKarma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from elaboration. Elaboration

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Ceaseless through emptiness.

original: zhes bstan pa de'i rigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de'i rigs pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the reasoning for that.

original: de'i phyir 'di la brjod par bya ba la rtog pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la brjod par bya ba la rtog pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúFrom the superimposition of thought on what is to be expressed, the inexpressible proliferations arise.‚Äù

original: des ni sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par rtog par brjod par bya ba nyid du sgro btags pa las ni sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sgras brjod par bya ba'i don la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par rtog par brjod par bya ba nyid du sgro btags pa las ni sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: This teaches that from the superimposition of the nature of expression on the object that is to be expressed, the inexpressible proliferations of the characteristics of words arise.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing dngos po thams cad brjod du med par mthong ba'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing dngos po thams cad brjod du med par mthong ba'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas
translated: Having directly perceived the emptiness that is the characteristic of the utter isolation of the nature of all things in the manner of not directly perceiving anything, having seen all things as inexpressible,üîΩthe expression of the inexpressible is stopped.

original: te / brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: te / brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni /
translated: This means that because there is no cause for the engagement of expression, there is no expression.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang gis de ltar mthong ba de'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang gis de ltar mthong ba de'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: The yogi who sees things in this way stops conceptual elaborations by stopping the expressible.

original: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po med pas spros pa 'gag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan te /
analyzed: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po med pas spros pa 'gag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan te /
translated: The meaning is that since the thing that is the cause of engaging in expression does not exist, conceptual elaborations are stopped.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong par mthong na @81a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong par mthong na @81a * //
translated: Because when things are seen as empty,

original: brjod par bya ba nyid ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: the expressible is stopped, therefore conceptual elaborations are stopped by emptiness.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba yod na de la brten nas spros pa yang yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba yod na de la brten nas spros pa yang yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, if the expressible exists, then conceptual elaborations exist in dependence on that.

original: brjod par bya ba med na gzhi med pa'i spros pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba med na gzhi med pa'i spros pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the expressible does not exist, how could conceptual elaborations exist without a basis? They could not!

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that point, it is said:

original: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that expressible stopped?

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa'o //
translated: By stopping the mind‚Äôs sphere of activity.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù is a remainder.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa des brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa des brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because the object of the mind is stopped, the expressible is stopped.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi spyod yul te /
translated: The object of the mind is the object of the mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means form, etc.

original: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Moreover, because it is not ultimately established.

original: gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag nyid don dam par yongs su ma grub pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag nyid don dam par yongs su ma grub pas /
translated: Because the object of the mind, form, etc., is not ultimately established,

original: log par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: it is stopped. Because of that, the expressible is stopped.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag yin na de dag med na ji zhig brjod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag yin na de dag med na ji zhig brjod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, if the expressible is form, etc., and those do not exist, what is there to express? There is not anything.

original: sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the words ‚Äúthe domain of mind,‚Äù

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni dngos por brjod de /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni dngos por brjod de /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe domain of mind is described as an entity,

original: rang gi ngo bo dang spyi'i ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang spyi'i ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because it reveals its own nature and the nature of the universal.‚Äù

original: ldog pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of ‚Äúexclusion,‚Äù

original: ldog pa ni ldog pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni ldog pa lta bu ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúExclusion is like an exclusion,

original: lta ba po'i de kho na shes pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa na yang dngos po'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lta ba po'i de kho na shes pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa na yang dngos po'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because even when the knowledge of reality of the viewer has arisen or not arisen, the nature of the entity, the domain of non-conceptual knowledge of reality, is not relinquished.‚Äù

original: dngos su ldog par bya ba med pa'i phyir ldog pa lta bu zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dngos su ldog par bya ba med pa'i phyir ldog pa lta bu zhes bshad do //
translated: Since there is nothing that is actually excluded, it is explained as ‚Äúlike an exclusion.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ldog pas brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pas brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog go zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthe exclusion of the elaborations that have the nature of expressions‚Äù is a summary.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang gang gis kyang mi byed de ;
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang gang gis kyang mi byed de ;
translated: Moreover, that exclusion of the domain of mind is not done by anything at all.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it?

original: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: The objects of mind, form and so on, are not produced and not stopped.

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: They are the same as the reality of nirvana.üîΩThe reality of phenomena, the nature of phenomena, and the essence of phenomena are synonyms.

original: chos nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la @81b sogs pa dag ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba bstan te /
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la @81b sogs pa dag ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches how the objects of mind, form and so on, are stopped.

original: gang gi phyir des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir de'i sems kyi spyodüîΩyul ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because when he sees them as they are in reality, he fully understands that the objects of mind, form and so on, are not produced and not stopped, and are the same as the reality of nirvana. Therefore his objects of mind are stopped.

original: yang na gzhan gyis spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la rig pa gang yin zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la rig pa gang yin zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Or else, when it is said that ‚Äúthe elaborations of others are stopped by emptiness,‚Äù what is that knowledge?

original: slob dpon gyi rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas de'i phyir /
translated: The master, the yogi who abides in emptiness and abides in signlessness, has stopped the expressible. Therefore,

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
translated: the expressible is stopped.

original: zhes bshad de /üîΩbrjod pa 'jug pa ldog pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad de / brjod pa 'jug pa ldog pas so //
translated: This is explained.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to //üîΩ'dir pha rol po dag gis khyod dbu ma pas sngar spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de la rigs pa gang yin zhes dris pa na slob dpon gyis rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing mtshan ma med
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to // 'dir pha rol po dag gis khyod dbu ma pas sngar spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de la rigs pa gang yin zhes dris pa na slob dpon gyis rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing mtshan ma med
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúbecause the engagement of expression is stopped‚Äù is explained in a different way in the following verses.üîΩHere, the opponent asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the reasoning behind the statement by you MƒÅdhyamikas that ‚Äòthe elaborations cease through emptiness‚Äô?‚Äù

original: pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: The master explains, ‚ÄúThe yogi who abides in emptiness and abides in signlessness has stopped the expressible. Therefore, because the expressible is stopped, the elaborations cease.‚Äù

original: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po rnams stong par mthong zhing ldog pas brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu dngos po rnams stong par mthong zhing ldog pas brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the cause for engaging in expression is seeing that things are empty, and by stopping that, the proliferation of the identity of expression is stopped.

original: des na sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: des na sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Therefore, the domain of mind is stopped.üîΩThe domain of mind is a synonym for the movement of mind.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni de'i brjod par bya ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni de'i brjod par bya ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bstan te /
translated: This teaches the cause for how the object of expression is stopped.

original: de yang sems kyi spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la sems rgyu ba dang 'jug pa dag dpyod pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs yin pas gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul de dag nyid ldog par gyur pa de'i
analyzed: de yang sems kyi spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la sems rgyu ba dang 'jug pa dag dpyod pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs yin pas gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul de dag nyid ldog par gyur pa de'i
translated: Moreover, the domain of mind is a synonym for the movement of mind, for engaging mind, for analysis, and for conception. Therefore, because the domain of mind is stopped,

original: phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the object of expression is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyis mngon par brtag pa yin par brjod de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyis mngon par brtag pa yin par brjod de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, The nature of the object is said to be the mental construction.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /üîΩsrid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang / srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:üîΩConsciousness is the seed of existence.

original: yul rnams @82a * //
analyzed: yul rnams @82a * //
translated: Objects

original: de yi spyod yul lo //üîΩzhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de yi spyod yul lo // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: are its domain.

original: sred pa'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa yin la yul rnams ni de'i spyod yul yin pas ji srid du yul rnams la sems kyis rnam par brtags shing sems kyi rgyu ba dang / 'jug pa dang / dpyod pa dang rtog pa yod pa de srid du sems kyi spyod yul yin par brjod do //
analyzed: sred pa'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa yin la yul rnams ni de'i spyod yul yin pas ji srid du yul rnams la sems kyis rnam par brtags shing sems kyi rgyu ba dang / 'jug pa dang / dpyod pa dang rtog pa yod pa de srid du sems kyi spyod yul yin par brjod do //
translated: Thus, since the seed of craving is consciousness and objects are its domain, as long as objects are mentally constructed, and the movement, engagement, analysis, and investigation of mind exist, they are said to be the domain of mind.

original: sems kyi spyod yul de ji ltar ldog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul de ji ltar ldog pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how that domain of mind is stopped, he says:

original: de yang dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the object-field of the mind is reversed because of abiding in the non-apprehension of objects.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When the selflessness of objects is seen,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of existence is stopped.

original: zhes gsungs pas sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang yul dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang yul dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the reversal of the object-field of the mind is a reversal because of abiding in the non-apprehension of objects.

original: de ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas brjod par bya ba ldog pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas brjod par bya ba ldog pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the conclusion that the expressible is reversed because of the reversal of the object-field of the mind,

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause of the reversal of the object-field of the mind.‚Äù

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas brjod par bya ba ldog la /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas brjod par bya ba ldog la /
translated: Because of the reversal of the object-field of the mind, the expressible is reversed.

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the reversal of the expressible, mental fabrication ceases.

original: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the object-field of the mind is reversed,

original: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHow is the object-field of the mind reversed?‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: The object-field of the mind is reversed because of the non-arising and non-ceasing of mind.

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //üîΩgang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs // gang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Reality is similar to nirvana.

original: gang gi sems kyi de kho na ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi sems kyi de kho na ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the reality of mind is unborn and unceasing,

original: de'i sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: the domain of mind is stopped.üîΩBecause the reality of mind is unborn and unceasing, the domain of mind is stopped.

original: de lta bas na gang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la sems kyi spyod yul log pas brjod par
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la sems kyi spyod yul log pas brjod par
translated: Therefore, because the reality of mind is unborn and unceasing, the domain of mind is stopped.

original: bya ba ldog cing brjod par bya ba log pas spros pa 'gags pas spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba ldog cing brjod par bya ba log pas spros pa 'gags pas spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the domain of mind is stopped, the object of expression is stopped. Because the object of expression is stopped, mental fabrication is stopped. Mental fabrication is stopped by emptiness.

original: spros pa stong pa nyid kyis 'gags na rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: spros pa stong pa nyid kyis 'gags na rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung la /
translated: If proliferation is stopped by emptiness, then conceptualization does not occur.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bas las dang nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bas las dang nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If conceptualization does not occur, then karma and afflictions are exhausted.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa thob pa ni gang zag dang chos bdag med pa bsgoms pa'i @82b 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩyang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid kyi don bstan cing tshig le'ur
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa thob pa ni gang zag dang chos bdag med pa bsgoms pa'i @82b 'bras bu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // yang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid kyi don bstan cing tshig le'ur
translated: If karma and afflictions are exhausted, then liberation is attained. This is the result of meditating on the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.üîΩOr, not seeing things and nonthings is called ‚Äúseeing reality.‚Äù

original: byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston to ;
analyzed: byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston to ;
