translated: This passage explains the meaning of ‚Äúproliferation is stopped by emptiness‚Äù and teaches another explanation of the previous verse.üîΩHow is that?üîΩSome think that way.

original: / de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du kha cig de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: / de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du kha cig de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //üîΩzhes bshad de /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //üîΩzhes bshad de /
translated: The object of expression is stopped.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong na'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong na'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If one does not see things and nonthings.üîΩOr, if one does not see things and nonthings, that is called ‚Äúseeing reality.‚ÄùüîΩIn that regard, some think, ‚ÄúWhat is that like?‚Äù

original: yang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste zhes bshad pa de la kha cig de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba ni de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste zhes bshad pa de la kha cig de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //üîΩzhes bshad de /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste // zhes bshad de /
translated: The object of expression is stopped.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong na brjod par bya ba ldog pa ni de kho na mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong na brjod par bya ba ldog pa ni de kho na mthong ba yin la /
translated: If one does not see things and nonthings, the object of expression is stopped, and that is seeing reality.

original: de kho na mthong bas ni spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de kho na mthong bas ni spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And it is said that by seeing reality, mental fabrication is stopped.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba brjod par bya ba ldog pa de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba brjod par bya ba ldog pa de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the object of expression is stopped, that is, by not seeing things and nonthings, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: The sphere of activity of the mind, etc.

original: dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of entities, etc.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The sphere of activity of the mind is the activity of the mind, etc.

original: de ni dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: That is stopped because of the non-apprehension of entities, etc.

original: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog la /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog la /
translated: And because of the cessation of the sphere of activity of the mind, the expressible is stopped.

original: brjod par bya ba log pas ni spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba log pas ni spros pa 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: And because of the cessation of the expressible, the elaborations cease. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be supplied.

original: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod yul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod yul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sphere of activity of the mind is the activity of the mind, etc.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de las sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so zhes gsungs pa'i skabs su sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos la /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de las sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so zhes gsungs pa'i skabs su sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos la /
translated: In the root text of the verse, it says, ‚ÄúBecause of the cessation of the sphere of activity of the mind,‚Äù but the term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is not mentioned.

original: 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: The commentator

original: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pas ste //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pas ste //
translated: says, ‚ÄúThe sphere of activity of the mind, etc.

original: zhes sogs pa'i sgra smos pa ni /
analyzed: zhes sogs pa'i sgra smos pa ni /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicateüîΩ

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rtsa ba de'i skabs 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rtsa ba de'i skabs 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text should be understood to imply the following lines from the commentary:

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag gi spyod pa dag kyang bsdu'o //üîΩgal te 'dir gzhan dag 'di @83a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag gi spyod pa dag kyang bsdu'o // gal te 'dir gzhan dag 'di @83a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù also include verbal conduct.

original: skad ces de ltar yul dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par yang mi snang la /
analyzed: skad ces de ltar yul dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par yang mi snang la /
translated: If someone were to object, ‚ÄúIn that case, it follows that the error of not seeing reality would ensue, since here the object does not appear in the aspect of an existent or nonexistent thing,

original: de la 'dzin pa'i sems kyi spyod pa yang mi snang zhing /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i sems kyi spyod pa yang mi snang zhing /
translated: the mental activity of apprehending it does not appear,

original: de brjod pa'i ngag gi spyod pa yang mi snang na de kho na mthong ba med pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i ngag gi spyod pa yang mi snang na de kho na mthong ba med pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ram zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: and the verbal activity of expressing it does not appear,‚Äù the author of the commentary would respond from within that position:

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that reality is not seen.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams ma mthong ba gang kho na yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams ma mthong ba gang kho na yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Because of that, not seeing objects such as form is itself said to be seeing reality,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is the realization of the nature of things without error.

original: 'di la mtha' gnyis su ma mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la mtha' gnyis su ma mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin te /
translated: Here, not seeing the two extremes is itself seeing reality,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the realization of the nature of things without error.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa bden pa pos bstan pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa bden pa pos bstan pa'i le'u las /
translated: Thus, in the chapter on the teaching of noble Satyaka,

original: ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni de kho na mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya bas ni de nyid kyi khungs bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni de kho na mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya bas ni de nyid kyi khungs bstan to //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúNot seeing is seeing reality.‚Äù This teaches the source of that.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir / brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
translated: the expressible is stopped.

original: zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni /
translated: This teaches

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par bstan pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pas spros pa 'gag par bstan pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: that because the expressible is stopped, conceptual elaborations cease.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the source of that,üîΩit says:

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra teaches:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is ultimate truth?

original: gang la sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang la sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: It is that with respect to which even the mind does not move, let alone words.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan nas kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan nas kyang /
translated: And similarly, the Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ states:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyir pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩThus, the nonseeing of anything is the seeing of reality.

original: de'i phyir lung de dag gis na mthong ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong ba yin pas de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lung de dag gis na mthong ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong ba yin pas de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the s≈´tra passage cited above does not contradict our interpretation.

original: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni /
translated: Therefore, with respect to reality,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing.

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: Its nature is like nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: zhes bya ba de tsam dag smra bar nus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de tsam dag smra bar nus te /
translated: One can only speak of that much,üîΩbecause the defining characteristic of all phenomena is voidness.

original: chos thams cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the following:

original: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni tha snyad kyi sgo nas de tsam dag smra bar nus kyi don dam par ni brjod par bya ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni tha snyad kyi sgo nas de tsam dag smra bar nus kyi don dam par ni brjod par bya ba med de /
translated: Therefore, one can only speak of that much in terms of conventional expressions in regard to reality. But ultimately, there is nothing to be expressed,

original: chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the defining characteristic of all phenomena is voidness and emptiness.

original: yang na stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer @83b snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid la kun tu lta zhing dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i ngag dang / yid kyi brjod pa ldog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer @83b snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid la kun tu lta zhing dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i ngag dang / yid kyi brjod pa ldog pa'i phyir //
translated: Or else, because all things are illuminated by the light of the sun of the knowledge of emptiness, and because verbal and mental expressions cease in the utter nonapprehension of any essence,

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
translated: the object of expression ceases.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i don ston cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i don ston cing /
translated: Thus, by the words ‚Äúthe object of expression ceases‚Äù and so on, the meaning of ‚Äúconceptual elaboration ceases through emptiness‚Äù is taught.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid kyi don rnam par bshad pa gzhan ston te /
translated: The following verse is stated to show another explanation of the meaning of the previous verse.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa gang stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu lta zhing dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa de'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa gang stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu lta zhing dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa de'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod
translated: Or, the yogi who sees the nature of all things illuminated by the light rays of the sun of the knowledge of emptiness and who abides in the non-observation of all things, for that yogi speech and mental expressions

original: pa ldog pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog la /
analyzed: pa ldog pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog la /
translated: cease.

original: de'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod par bya ba log pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba ni stong pa nyid kyi spros pa 'gag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod par bya ba log pas tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba ni stong pa nyid kyi spros pa 'gag pa yin te /
translated: Because of the cessation of speech and mental expressions, the elaborations characterized by the adherence to the conventional truth are pacified, and this is the cessation of the elaborations of emptiness.

original: de nyid theg pa chen po la chos bdag med pa nyid bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de nyid theg pa chen po la chos bdag med pa nyid bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: That is the means of attaining the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of intuition, which are the fruits of cultivating the selflessness of dharmas in the universal vehicle.

original: de nyid kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyang /
translated: And that is also

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: zhes bya bas ni brjod par bya ba ldog pa de nyid kyang gang gis ldog par 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni brjod par bya ba ldog pa de nyid kyang gang gis ldog par 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If the object of expression is stopped, by what is it stopped?

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: zhes bya bar ston to ;
analyzed: zhes bya bar ston to ;
translated: This is what is taught.

original: /'di sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: /'di sems kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is this called the domain of mind?

original: spyod yul ni mthu med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spyod yul ni mthu med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The domain is powerless.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The nature of mind is natural luminosity.

original: de ldog pa ni glo bur gyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol zhing gnas 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ldog pa ni glo bur gyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol zhing gnas 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Its stopping is liberation from adventitious obstructions and its transformation.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: ji ltar sems kyi mthu nyid ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi mthu nyid ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is the power of mind stopped?

original: 'di la yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skyes shing dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul tha dad pa la rtog pa'i rgyun dag gis rnam pa tha dad pa du mar rtog pa na dar gyi srin bu bzhin du bdag gi mthu nyidüîΩkun nas dkris par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skyes shing dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul tha dad pa la rtog pa'i rgyun dag gis rnam pa tha dad pa du mar rtog pa na dar gyi srin bu bzhin du bdag gi mthu nyid kun nas dkris par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, consciousness arises by the power of the object, and when it conceives many different aspects due to the different objects of the nature and attributes of things, the continuum of thought becomes completely entangled like a silkworm in its cocoon.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas ni de mi 'jug pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas ni de mi 'jug pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The object of activity of the mind is reversed by seeing all phenomena as selfless, because that [self] does not engage.

original: des ni glo bur gyi sgrib pas 'ching ba dang / chos bdag med par mthong bas rnam par grol zhing gnas 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan to //üîΩsems kyi spyod yul log pa yang de kho na shes pa'i byed pa po dang ldan @84a * //
analyzed: des ni glo bur gyi sgrib pas 'ching ba dang / chos bdag med par mthong bas rnam par grol zhing gnas 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan to // sems kyi spyod yul log pa yang de kho na shes pa'i byed pa po dang ldan @84a * //
translated: This explains how one is bound by adventitious obscurations and liberated and transformed by seeing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin te /
translated: The reversal of the object of activity of the mind is not due to possessing the activity of knowing reality.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how?

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the same as nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams kyi spyod yul ldog pa de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams kyi spyod yul ldog pa de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Because it is not possible for anyone to stop the object of mind and other phenomena.

original: sems kyi spyod yul rang rig pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul rang rig pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the object of mind is stopped by the method of self-awareness.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of that,üîΩit is said:

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, in the Ratnak≈´·π≠a S≈´tra,

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi 'di ltar chos rnams nyid stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi 'di ltar chos rnams nyid stong pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúEmptiness does not make phenomena empty; rather, phenomena themselves are empty.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang de dag gi rang bzhin ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi rang bzhin ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: However, their nature should be understood to be like nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye 'gag med par ro gcig par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye 'gag med par ro gcig par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: This shows that all phenomena are of one taste in being free from arising and ceasing by way of nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes bya'i mtha' yang rtogs pa dang / brjod pa de tsam du zad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes bya'i mtha' yang rtogs pa dang / brjod pa de tsam du zad do zhes bstan to //
translated: The limit of knowable objects for bodhisattvas is also realized, and that is the extent of what is expressed.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that,

original: 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: it is said in the Questions of Brahma Vi≈õe·π£a-cinti S≈´tra:

original: ji skad du 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin shin tu skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kunüîΩtu mkhyen par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji skad du 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin shin tu skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kun tu mkhyen par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, the TathƒÅgata, having entered the essence of enlightenment, came to know the nature of the afflictions that are raised up by unreal imagination, the nature of which is utterly non-arisen and non-existent.‚Äù

original: de ltar spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ltar spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Thus, since conceptual elaborations cease through emptiness, the author of the commentary himself

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas gsungs pa /
translated: says, ‚ÄúƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva said,‚ÄùüîΩand quotes the following:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: The seed of existence is consciousness,

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: and objects are its domain.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: If one sees the absence of self in objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of existence will cease.

original: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩji ltar gzhan mu stegs can dag gis bdag dang bdag gir btags pa dang sde pa gzhan dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por btags pa dang / rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag gis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te / ji ltar gzhan mu stegs can dag gis bdag dang bdag gir btags pa dang sde pa gzhan dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por btags pa dang / rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba dag gis //
translated: This is also tenable.

original: sems dang sems kyis rnam par btags pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems kyis rnam par btags pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the self and mine imputed by other tƒ´rthikas, the imputations of entities of apprehendeds and apprehenders by other schools, and the mind and mental factors imputed by Proponents of Consciousness.

original: theg pa chen po'i dbu ma pa'i tshul 'di la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma brtags gcig pu na nyams dga' ba sgyu ma tsam du bya ba byed nus par yod @84b cing de la
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dbu ma pa'i tshul 'di la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma brtags gcig pu na nyams dga' ba sgyu ma tsam du bya ba byed nus par yod @84b cing de la
translated: In this system of the MahƒÅyƒÅna Madhyamaka, conventionally, outer and inner dependent arisings are mere illusions that are delightful when not analyzed, are singular, and are able to perform functions.

original: mngon par zhen pas ni srid pa gsum du 'khor zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun kyang 'brel par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas ni srid pa gsum du 'khor zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyun kyang 'brel par 'gyur la /
translated: Through clinging to them, one cycles in the three existences, and the continuum of affliction is connected.

original: de la mngon par ma zhen cing don dam par ngo bo nyid med par shes pas ni srid pa'i sa bon 'gag cing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba chen po yang thob pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mngon par ma zhen cing don dam par ngo bo nyid med par shes pas ni srid pa'i sa bon 'gag cing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba chen po yang thob pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By not clinging to that and knowing that ultimately it is devoid of essence, the seed of cyclic existence ceases and one attains the great bliss of nondwelling nirvana, which is attained in a manner of nonattainment.

original: de ni / slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas dang / 'phags pa lha dang / legs ldan 'byed dang / bud dha p'a li ta la sogs pa theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i lam smra ba rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas dang / 'phags pa lha dang / legs ldan 'byed dang / bud dha p'a li ta la sogs pa theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i lam smra ba rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the way of the perfection of wisdom by the masters Nagarjuna, Aryadeva, Bhavaviveka, Buddhapalita, and so on, who are proponents of the Madhyamaka path of the Mahayana.

original: de'i phyir de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, by seeing the equality of all phenomena, which is like nirvana, as unarisen, the domain of the mind ceases.

original: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
translated: And by the cessation of the domain of the mind, the object of expression ceases.

original: de log pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag pa bstan pa'i skabs kyis mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de log pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag pa bstan pa'i skabs kyis mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The passage, ‚ÄúBy reversing that, the elaborations characterized by manifest clinging to conventional truth are pacified‚Äù concludes the section on the teaching that elaborations cease through emptiness.

original: sngar / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: sngar / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Earlier it was said, ‚ÄúLiberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from elaborations, and elaborations

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Cease through emptiness.‚Äù

original: zhes smos pas rnam par grol ba thun mong ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes smos pas rnam par grol ba thun mong ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the uncommon liberation.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i spros pa las ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung la /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i spros pa las ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung la /
translated: In that regard, conceptuality arises from mundane elaborations.

original: rnam par rtog pa las ni las dang nyon mongs pa 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las ni las dang nyon mongs pa 'byung zhing /
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas ni thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas ni thar par 'gyur te /
translated: Liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa thob pa de yang sngar /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar pa thob pa de yang sngar /
translated: That liberation is attained through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions was stated earlier:

original: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the inner and outer,

original: bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
translated: When the self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù are extinguished,

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: the appropriated [skandhas] cease.

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
translated: Through their extinction, birth is extinguished.

original: ces smos pas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ces smos pas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught by that.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba'i rnam par grol ba gang zag bdag med pa nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs yin te //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba'i rnam par grol ba gang zag bdag med pa nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs yin te //
translated: That is the method for abandoning the afflictive obstructions, which is distinguished by the realization of the selflessness of persons, which is common to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: sgo de nas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: sgo de nas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: Through that door, all the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha together with their results are perfected,

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mthar thug pas rab tu bye ba'i mi slob pa tshogs dang spyod pa dang bse ru lta bu'i go 'phang nyid thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩspros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro @85a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mthar thug pas rab tu bye ba'i mi slob pa tshogs dang spyod pa dang bse ru lta bu'i go 'phang nyid thob par 'gyur ro // spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro @85a * //
translated: and one attains the state of the nonlearner, distinguished by the ultimate result of the ≈õrama·πáa, the state of the assembly, the conduct, and the rhinoceros-like.üîΩIt was said, ‚ÄúElaboration ceases through emptiness.‚Äù

original: zhes gang smras pa de la ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it cease through emptiness?

original: sngar brjod par bya ba ldog pa sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sngar brjod par bya ba ldog pa sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: The object of expression is stopped by stopping the domain of mind.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unborn and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the same as nirvana.

original: zhes smos pa'i rim gyis chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i rim gyis chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la //
translated: In this way, by seeing the sameness of nirvana and the non-arising of all phenomena, the domain of mind is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul log pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
translated: By stopping the domain of mind, the object of expression is stopped.

original: de log pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de log pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: By stopping that, the elaborations characterized by the manifest clinging to the conventional truth are pacified.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par grol ba chos bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pas rab tu phye ba shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par grol ba chos bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pas rab tu phye ba shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs yin te /
translated: This is the method for abandoning the obscurations to omniscience, which is distinguished by the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, the uncommon liberation of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sgo de nas ni theg pa chen po'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: sgo de nas ni theg pa chen po'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: From this door, all the paths and results of the Mahayana are perfected.

original: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang nyid thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩrang gi sde ba dang gzhan gyi sde ba kha cig na re dbu ma smra ba ni dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir med pa bdag dang khyad par med do zhes zer ba de dag la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi go 'phang nyid thob par 'gyur ro // rang gi sde ba dang gzhan gyi sde ba kha cig na re dbu ma smra ba ni dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir med pa bdag dang khyad par med do zhes zer ba de dag la /
translated: Through this door, one will perfect all the paths and results of the Great Vehicle and attain the state of a Bhagavan Buddha, who is unexcelled.üîΩSome members of our own Buddhist tradition and some non-Buddhists say that the proponents of the Middle Way are no different from nihilists because they deny the existence of all things.

original: kha cig gis dngos po sel ba nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i btang stoms pa dag bzhin nam /
analyzed: kha cig gis dngos po sel ba nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang so so'i skye bo dang dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i btang stoms pa dag bzhin nam /
translated: To this, some respond that, although the nihilists and the proponents of the Middle Way are similar in that they both eliminate things, the former are ordinary beings and the latter are arhats.

original: dmus long dang mig can gyis phyogs mi bde'o snyam du nges par shes pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang khyad par yod pa bzhin du med pa pa dang / dbu ma pa dag la yang khyad par yod do zhes lan 'debs par byed pas ni pha rol pos dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la khyad par yod par ma brjod pas lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: dmus long dang mig can gyis phyogs mi bde'o snyam du nges par shes pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang khyad par yod pa bzhin du med pa pa dang / dbu ma pa dag la yang khyad par yod do zhes lan 'debs par byed pas ni pha rol pos dngos po'i de kho na rtogs pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la khyad par yod par ma brjod pas lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni
translated: Although it is definitely known that the blind and the sighted have different perspectives, the response that ‚Äúthere is no difference between the blind and the sighted‚Äù is not a response because it does not state that there is a difference between the blind and the sighted.

original: / skabs 'dir rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig na re gang 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: / skabs 'dir rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig na re gang 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: In this context, some of our own Buddhist schools and some non-Buddhist schools say, ‚ÄúWhat difference is there between the view that this world does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med de //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med de //
translated: that the world beyond does not exist,üîΩand that a substantial sentient being is not born, and the view that all things are unarisen and unceasing?‚Äù

original: sems can rdzas te skyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba de dang gang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par lta ba zhes bya ba de gnyis la khyad par ci yod ces zer ba'i lan du /
analyzed: sems can rdzas te skyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba de dang gang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par lta ba zhes bya ba de gnyis la khyad par ci yod ces zer ba'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said:

original: slob dpon buddha p'a li tas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu chen khyod ni stong pa nyid kyi don rnam par mi shes nas de gnyis 'dra'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: slob dpon buddha p'a li tas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu chen khyod ni stong pa nyid kyi don rnam par mi shes nas de gnyis 'dra'o snyam du sems so //
translated: You think that they are similar because you do not understand the meaning of emptiness.

original: 'di la so @85b sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa dang / so sor brtags nas btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa de gnyis btang snyoms byed par ni 'dra mod kyi so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la so @85b sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa dang / so sor brtags nas btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa de gnyis btang snyoms byed par ni 'dra mod kyi so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the two, that which is indifference without analysis and that which is indifference with analysis, are similar in that they are indifference.

original: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan par bstan la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan par bstan la /
translated: However, it is taught that indifference without analysis is associated with the fetter of ignorance.

original: btang snyoms byed pa cig shos ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms byed pa cig shos ni /
translated: The other, indifference with analysis,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kun tu bstan pa yin pas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kun tu bstan pa yin pas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du /
translated: is taught by the transcendent buddhas, the bhagavans. Therefore there is a very great difference between these two.

original: 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar mthong ba ni ma rig pas kun tu rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar mthong ba ni ma rig pas kun tu rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, here, the view that ‚Äúthis world does not exist‚Äù and so on is a mind that is confused by ignorance.

original: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all things are empty of essence.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ba cig shos ni shes pa sngon du btang ba yin pas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ba cig shos ni shes pa sngon du btang ba yin pas de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che'o //
translated: The difference between these two is very great, because the latter is preceded by knowledge.

original: gzhan yang med pa nyid mthong bzhin du 'jig rten 'di med do zhes tshig 'ba' zhig brjod pa de la ni dper na dmus long phyogs 'di mi bde'o zhes brjod kyang mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas der 'khrul pa dang rdeg 'cha' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa nyid mthong bzhin du 'jig rten 'di med do zhes tshig 'ba' zhig brjod pa de la ni dper na dmus long phyogs 'di mi bde'o zhes brjod kyang mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas der 'khrul pa dang rdeg 'cha' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin
translated: Moreover, while seeing nonexistence, one who says, ‚ÄúThis world does not exist‚Äù is like a blind man who says, ‚ÄúThis direction is uncomfortable,‚Äù but does not see it because he has no eyes.üîΩThus, while saying, ‚ÄúThis world does not exist,‚Äù because he has no eyes of knowledge, he does not see it, and so he is tainted by those errors.

original: du / de yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes brjod kyang shes pa'i mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas skyon de dag gis gos par 'gyur zhes bshad pa de ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: du / de yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes brjod kyang shes pa'i mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas skyon de dag gis gos par 'gyur zhes bshad pa de ni lan ma yin te /
translated: That is not a response.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: pha rol pos med pa pa dang dbu ma pa gnyis dngos po'i de kho na rtog pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: pha rol pos med pa pa dang dbu ma pa gnyis dngos po'i de kho na rtog pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la /
translated: The opponent says that the nihilists and the Madhyamikas are the same in their conception of the reality of things.

original: buddha p'a li tas khyad par yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: buddha p'a li tas khyad par yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddhapalita says that this is so because the opponent does not state a reason for the difference.

original: 'di skad brjod na rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'di skad ces brjod na rigs so zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod na rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'di skad ces brjod na rigs so zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is the proper response‚Äù and so on is the author‚Äôs own response to the opponent‚Äôs statement.

original: de dag gi lan gdab pa'i tshig ston to //üîΩde'i phyir / med pa pa dang dbu ma smra ba dag gang gi tshe mtshungs par rtog / tha snyad kyi dus su'am /
analyzed: de dag gi lan gdab pa'i tshig ston to // de'i phyir / med pa pa dang dbu ma smra ba dag gang gi tshe mtshungs par rtog / tha snyad kyi dus su'am /
translated: It shows the proper response to the opponent‚Äôs position.üîΩTherefore, he says, ‚ÄúWhen do the nihilists and the Madhyamikas become the same?‚Äù

original: 'on te de kho na la lta ba'i dus su zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te de kho na la lta ba'i dus su zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is, at the time of conventional usage or at the time of viewing reality?

original: de gnyi ga'i dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par ston to //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par ston to //
translated: He shows that they are very different at both times.

original: de la re zhig tha snyad kyi dus su ni de dag rgyud dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pas dge ba'i phyogs drungs phyung zhing mi dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad la zhugs pa dang / tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa de ltar dbu ma smra ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dag la skur ba mi 'debs shing /
analyzed: de la re zhig tha snyad kyi dus su ni de dag rgyud dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pas dge ba'i phyogs drungs phyung zhing mi dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad la zhugs pa dang / tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa de ltar dbu ma smra ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dag la skur ba mi 'debs shing /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way do not deny the relationship between cause and effect, which is like an illusion or a mirage.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam @86a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam @86a * //
translated: They do not engage in the paths of nonvirtuous actions.üîΩThey do not deny the arising of the aggregates of future existence from the contaminated aggregates of the present continuum.

original: lam zhugs pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyun las yang 'byung ba'i srid pa'i phung po 'byung zhing phung po'i rgyun 'gags pa sngon du 'gro ba las da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa rmi lam lta bu dag 'byung bar ston pas tha snyad kyi bden
analyzed: lam zhugs pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyun las yang 'byung ba'i srid pa'i phung po 'byung zhing phung po'i rgyun 'gags pa sngon du 'gro ba las da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa rmi lam lta bu dag 'byung bar ston pas tha snyad kyi bden
translated: They do not deny the arising of the present and future, which is like a dream, from the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates.

original: pa nyid la gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa nyid la gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore they do not undermine conventional truth.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su yang med pa pa dag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag mtshungs pa ma yin la zhes bya bas ni tha snyad kyi dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par bstan to //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su yang med pa pa dag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag mtshungs pa ma yin la zhes bya bas ni tha snyad kyi dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are not the same‚Äù indicates that they are not similar even conventionally.

original: de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not the same even when one is viewing reality.

original: 'di ltar med pa pa dag la ni rnam par shes pa med do zhes med pa'i yul can dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa pa dag la ni rnam par shes pa med do zhes med pa'i yul can dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa 'byung zhing /
translated: For the nihilists, the subject that perceives the nonexistence of consciousness is the nihilistic view that denies the existence of all things.

original: de yang log par shes pa yin pas 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas nye bar spags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang log par shes pa yin pas 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas nye bar spags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since that is a wrong view, it is sullied by the stain of immorality, and thus one will not attain the pacification of suffering.

original: dbu ma smra ba dag la ni de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag la yang yod pa'i blo sngar byung bar gyur ba gang yin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba dag la ni de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag la yang yod pa'i blo sngar byung bar gyur ba gang yin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs
translated: For the proponents of the Middle Way, even when they are viewing reality, the mind that previously existed in relation to things such as form will cease, thinking, ‚ÄúThese things such as form do not exist.‚Äù

original: pas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pas rnam par ldog par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni de kho na la yang lta ba'i dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par bstan to //
analyzed: pas gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pas rnam par ldog par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni de kho na la yang lta ba'i dus su yang shin tu mi mtshungs par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is not at all similar to the view of reality.

original: gal te 'dir pha rol po dag 'di skad du dbu ma pas don dam par dngos po yod par bkag pas dre'i zlas don gyis go bas dbu ma pa la med pa'i blo skye ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dir pha rol po dag 'di skad du dbu ma pas don dam par dngos po yod par bkag pas dre'i zlas don gyis go bas dbu ma pa la med pa'i blo skye ste /
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe Madhyamaka refutation of the ultimate existence of things implies that things do not exist, and so a mind that apprehends things as nonexistent arises for the Madhyamaka.

original: dper na lhas byin nyon mo zas mi za la 'tshag bzang ba las na /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin nyon mo zas mi za la 'tshag bzang ba las na /
translated: For example, because Devadatta does not eat food when he is sick, it is understood that he is not well.‚Äù

original: don gyis go bas nub mo za bar shes par 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: don gyis go bas nub mo za bar shes par 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that former opponent, the author of the commentary says:

original: don gyis go bas med pa'i blo skyes so snyam pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas med pa'i blo skyes so snyam pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The thought that the meaning is understood does not arise.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
translated: In order to teach the measure of that, whatever thought there is that ultimately objects such as form do not exist is not in accordance with fact,

original: blo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a thought.

original: dper na yod pa'i blo bzhin pas //
analyzed: dper na yod pa'i blo bzhin pas //
translated: For example, it is like the thought that something exists.

original: blo de sun phyung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: blo de sun phyung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because that thought is refuted.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, the example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na yod pa'i blo ni blo yin pa'i phyir med do snyam @86b pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gyis yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang blo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na yod pa'i blo ni blo yin pa'i phyir med do snyam @86b pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gyis yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang blo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the mind that thinks ‚Äúexists‚Äù is not a subject that thinks ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù in accordance with the meaning of ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù Likewise, the mind that thinks ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is not a subject that thinks ‚Äúexists‚Äù in accordance with the meaning of ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: med pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul can ma yin pas med pa'i blo de sun phyung ba'i phyir dbu ma pa la med par lta ba'i blo med do //
analyzed: med pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gyi yul can ma yin pas med pa'i blo de sun phyung ba'i phyir dbu ma pa la med par lta ba'i blo med do //
translated: Therefore, because the mind that thinks ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is refuted, the mind that views the absence of the Middle Way as nonexistent does not exist.

original: yang na gang na dngos por snang ba'i blo skye ba de la ni de bsal pas med pa'i blo skye ba'i skabs yod kyi sel ba med pa la ni med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas med pa'i blo yang ldog par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: yang na gang na dngos por snang ba'i blo skye ba de la ni de bsal pas med pa'i blo skye ba'i skabs yod kyi sel ba med pa la ni med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas med pa'i blo yang ldog par 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Or, when the mind that perceives things as existent arises, the mind that thinks ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù arises due to the elimination of that. However, when there is no elimination, the mind that thinks ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù also ceases due to the realization of nonexistence.

original: dbu ma pa don dam par dngos po yod par mi lta ba la yod pa bsal bas med par lta ba'i blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: dbu ma pa don dam par dngos po yod par mi lta ba la yod pa bsal bas med par lta ba'i blo yang skye bar mi 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: This teaches that for the Middle Way, which does not view things as existent ultimately, the mind that views nonexistence does not arise due to the elimination of existence.

original: spyod pa med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas par rab tu dben par gyur pa rnams la med do snyam pa'i blo mi skye ba'i phyir med pa dag dang dbu ma smra ba dag la sgra mtshungs pa tsam yang med do zhes bya basüîΩni sgra tsam mtshungs pa yang med par bstan to //üîΩston pa'i dus na yang yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod pa med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas par rab tu dben par gyur pa rnams la med do snyam pa'i blo mi skye ba'i phyir med pa dag dang dbu ma smra ba dag la sgra mtshungs pa tsam yang med do zhes bya bas ni sgra tsam mtshungs pa yang med par bstan to // ston pa'i dus na yang yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The Madhyamikas do not have the mere words, because they do not have the thought that the non-existent does not exist for those who abide in the practice of wisdom that is practiced without practice, and who are isolated.üîΩThis shows that they do not even have the mere words.üîΩEven when they teach, they merely negate existence.üîΩ

original: med pa nyid du ston pa mi byed pas yungs 'bru dang ri rab bzhin du khyad par shin tu che'o zhes bya bas ni tshig bstan pa'i dus na yang khyad par shin tu che bar bstan to //üîΩde ltar re zhig mdo mdzad pas //üîΩma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //üîΩchos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: med pa nyid du ston pa mi byed pas yungs 'bru dang ri rab bzhin du khyad par shin tu che'o zhes bya bas ni tshig bstan pa'i dus na yang khyad par shin tu che bar bstan to //üîΩde ltar re zhig mdo mdzad pas //üîΩma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //üîΩchos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: The Madhyamikas do not even have the mere sound of the word ‚Äúnonexistence,‚Äù because they do not have the idea that nonexistence exists in the nonexistence of the nonexistence of the original: zhes gsungs pas don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par bstan nas da ni 'jig rten tha snyad du ni don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshigs sbyin pa la sogs pa la mang
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par bstan nas da ni 'jig rten tha snyad du ni don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshigs sbyin pa la sogs pa la mang
translated: Having thus taught that ultimately all phenomena are the same as nirvana, the nature of phenomena devoid of arising and ceasing, the text now explains that, on the conventional level, the Buddha praised generosity and so on as the means for realizing the ultimate truth.

original: po nye bar blangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa phyi nang gi dngos po gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: po nye bar blangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa phyi nang gi dngos po gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa dang /
translated: The Buddha taught that the outer and inner things that are known in the world as real are indeed real.

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin par grags pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du grags pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa ma yin par grags pa de dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid du grags pa de dag ni /
translated: The Lord has also said that those things that are known in the world to be unreal, such as sky-lotuses, rabbit horns, and so on, are indeed unreal.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas @87a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas @87a * //
translated: And since the Lord has also said that those things that are known in the world to be real and unreal, such as the two truths, are indeed real and unreal,

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the following verse is stated to show the way in which the system of conventional truth is presented.

original: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa mang po nye bar blang ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dag de ltar bden pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa mang po nye bar blang ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dag de ltar bden pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Although all phenomena are the same as nirvana, they are taken up in order to realize the ultimate, because they are in accord with the many collections of generosity and so on, and because these outer and inner things are true even conventionally.

original: ji ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa dang / nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa gang dag yin pa de dag tha snyad du //
analyzed: ji ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa dang / nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa gang dag yin pa de dag tha snyad du //
translated: As for the things of the outer and inner worlds that are renowned as real in the world, and space flowers, rabbit horns, and so on that are renowned as unreal, conventionally

original: thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
translated: all are real and unreal.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the source of that statement,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang 'jig rten pa yod par grags pa deng yang yod par smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang 'jig rten pa yod par grags pa deng yang yod par smra'o //
translated: the Transcendent Conqueror said, ‚ÄúWhatever exists and is renowned in the world, I also say exists.

original: gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa deng yang med par smra'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa deng yang med par smra'o //
translated: Whatever is known to the world as nonexistent, I also say is nonexistent.

original: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te ;üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong par gzigs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te ; bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong par gzigs kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩ'di ni yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin no // 'di ni yang dag pa nyid dang yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Although the Lord sees things as empty of intrinsic reality in the ultimate, he says, ‚ÄúThis is reality, this is not reality, this is both reality and unreality,‚Äù in terms of worldly convention.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bya ba de'i tshe na don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa mang po nye bar blang ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa phung po lnga
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bya ba de'i tshe na don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa mang po nye bar blang ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa phung po lnga
translated: Therefore, when one engages in worldly convention, one should accumulate the collections of merit and wisdom, which are the causes of omniscience, and one should engage in the many practices, such as generosity, which are conducive to the realization of the ultimate.üîΩOne should engage in the five aggregates, which are known in the world, and one should avoid the ten nonvirtues, which are known in the world.

original: la sogs pa nang gi dngos po dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyir rol gyi dngos po gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa de dag thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas
analyzed: la sogs pa nang gi dngos po dang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyir rol gyi dngos po gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa de dag thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said that they are real.

original: yang dag pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be described as real.

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gang dag 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: And also, the BhagavƒÅn said that whatever is renowned in the world as unreal, such as sky flowers, the horns of a rabbit, and so on,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pas yang dag pa nyid ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pas yang dag pa nyid ma yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: is also unreal. Therefore, they should be described as unreal.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pas thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so zhes @87b bya bas ni /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pas thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so zhes @87b bya bas ni /
translated: Or, it is said that the BhagavƒÅn said that all exist because the sources such as the eyes and the objects such as form exist without contradicting conventional truth.

original: yang na thams cad yang dag ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun par yod pas thams cad yang dag ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na thams cad yang dag ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun par yod pas thams cad yang dag ces bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúeverything is real‚Äù means that the internal and external sense-spheres exist in accordance with conventional truth, and so ‚Äúeverything is real.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, since things arise dependently, like illusions, they are not established by their own-nature.

original: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes gsungs so zhes bya bas ni yang na yang dag min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes gsungs so zhes bya bas ni yang na yang dag min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since they do not exist as they appear, they are said to be ‚Äúunreal.‚Äù

original: phyi nang gi skye mched rnams don dam par brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi nang gi skye mched rnams don dam par brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúunreal‚Äù means that the internal and external sense-spheres, in the ultimate sense, arise dependently, like illusions, and are not established by their own-nature.

original: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Since they do not exist as they appear, they are said to be ‚Äúunreal.‚Äù

original: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam pa la ltos nas /
translated: In relation to the aspects of the two truths,üîΩit is said:

original: yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: Real and unreal.

original: ces gsungs so zhes bya bas ni phyi nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas ni sgyu ma tsam du bya ba byed nus pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir yang dag nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs so zhes bya bas ni phyi nang gi skye mched rnams kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas ni sgyu ma tsam du bya ba byed nus pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir yang dag nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The line Thus it is said indicates that, in dependence on the conventional truth, the external and internal sense-spheres exist as mere illusions, in that they are able to perform functions. Therefore, they are called real.

original: de dag nyid don dam pa'i bden pa la ltos nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag nyid don dam pa'i bden pa la ltos nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: In dependence on the ultimate truth, they are said to be unreal, because they are essenceless.

original: da ni don dam par yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin la yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don dam par yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin la yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that ultimately, neither is it unreal, nor is it real, that is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of realization, because the yogi/nis do not conceptualize the reality of all phenomena in any way,

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: It is not unreal, nor is it real.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca lta bu dag mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /üîΩyang dag pa nyid ma yin par yang mi brjod la /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca lta bu dag mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir / yang dag pa nyid ma yin par yang mi brjod la /
translated: In the ultimate, when yogis realize that the nature of things is empty, like an illusion, a dream, a mirage, a reflection, or an echo, they are non-conceptual with respect to the reality of all phenomena in every respect.üîΩTherefore, they do not say that it is not real.

original: yang dag pa nyid du yang mi brjod pas yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du yang mi brjod pas yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: They do not say that it is real.

original: yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba mu stegs byed thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa don dam pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba mu stegs byed thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa don dam pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is neither unreal nor real. This is the teaching of the transcendent buddhas, which illuminates the ultimate free from the faults of existence and nonexistence and is not shared with any tƒ´rthikas.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /üîΩthams cad yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te / thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
translated: Or, this has another meaning.üîΩEverything is real and not real.

original: yang dag @88a * //
analyzed: yang dag @88a * //
translated: Real.

original: yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: Not real, not unreal.

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: Not real, not unreal,

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i don ni rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of this verse is explained in another way in order to demonstrate the teaching of the explanation.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so
translated: Or else, the Blessed One taught all the knowable things, the inner and outer sense bases, which are devoid of self and what belongs to a self, and are characterized by non-movement, in order to abandon the afflictive obstructions. He said that they are real.

original: zhes bya bas ni //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni //
translated: This is said

original: thams cad yang dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the meaning of ‚Äúall is real‚Äù is that

original: don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
translated: he taught the explanation in another way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dang gzugs la sogs pa phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'iüîΩmtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa sems pa med pa gang yin pa de shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dang gzugs la sogs pa phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa sems pa med pa gang yin pa de shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught the internal sense bases such as the eyes and the external sense bases such as form in order to abandon the obscurations of affliction.

original: de rtogs na nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs na nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All those that are taught as objects of knowledge are called reality because when one realizes them, afflictions do not arise.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yang dag min zhes gsungs so zhes byas bas ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yang dag min zhes gsungs so zhes byas bas ni /
translated: Also, the characteristic of consciousness is said to be the agent because it is associated with the self and belongs to the self. Therefore it is said that those who listen, reflect, and meditate are not correct.

original: thams cad yang dag min zhes bya ba'i the tshig gi don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: thams cad yang dag min zhes bya ba'i the tshig gi don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
translated: This verse shows that the meaning of the statement ‚Äúall is not real‚Äù is explained in another way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po bdag tu gsungs pas rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag des bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes par byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang gom par byed pa dag ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po bdag tu gsungs pas rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag des bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes par byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang gom par byed pa dag ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said that the aggregate characterized by consciousness is the self. Therefore, since the self characterized by consciousness is the self, it is ‚Äúendowed with a self‚Äù and ‚Äúis mine.‚Äù Since it is said to be the agent that is conscious, the listener, the thinker, and the goer are not real.

original: 'di ltar don dam par rnam par shes pa yang bdag tu mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par rnam par shes pa yang bdag tu mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because consciousness is not asserted to be the self ultimately.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIn dependence on the conventions of treatises of the world,üîΩthe real and the unreal are described.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la stos pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la stos pa'i dbang gis /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIn dependence on the conventions of treatises of the world,

original: yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //üîΩces gsungs so zhes bya byas ni /
